But I haven‚Äôt been able to figure out whether it would be worth the money, and now that they have pulled a sneaky trick I probably won‚Äôt. I had been trying it out while deciding whether to buy in and pay for ‚ÄúPremium.‚Äù I have liked the limited parts of the app I have been able to access, but was hesitating because the app is kind of expensive for me. Unfortunately, when the app was updated they locked some of the aspects that were previously open. This doesn‚Äôt seem to be in the spirit of the intention of the app. If it‚Äôs purpose is to bring more ‚Äúcalm‚Äù to the world, why would they do something so frustrating? There are other meditation apps out there, so I guess I‚Äôll keep looking.
PS - After going back and looking at the reviews, I can see that this one review probably isn‚Äôt going to be noticed by anyone. There are only a few negative reviews, and like mine, they are mostly complaining about the high cost and the general ethos behind offering such an app at such a cost. Apparently this is a great app if you have the money for it, and there are a whole lot five-star reviewers who can afford it.

author: bazzoonboy
title: The content rocks; the app is even more stressful
content:
Been using Calm for years. Absolutely love the daily calm & daily trip. They‚Äôre short, practical, and the daily releases mean I check in more often than I do in apps with static content catalogs. 

BUT the app has, ironically, slowly grown more and more stressful to use.  (The newest stressor: 3+ popups pushing me to share with a friend, every time I open the app.) For an app I come to when I‚Äôm stressed, the overwhelming amount of content and options is wild. The homepage is an endless scroll, there are settings buttons everywhere (scene, volume, favorite, download), and the logo awkwardly helps clutter the homepage too, especially on iPad. Frankly I wish I could select the features I use (daily calm/trip), hide the features I don‚Äôt want, and live life as a focused and happy customer. 

One smaller request: Allow us to remove the default landscapes, and to upload our own! (Either just to our device, or ideally to a curated video marketplace‚Äîhuge differentiator opp, in my opinion.) The default lake scenes are fake and cheesy, I wish I could remove them from my device and just keep 1 or 2 that bring me peace.

author: tmoneyinfo
title: Love it
content: The best app ever it is so nice. It comes down your brain. It makes me fall asleep. I used to fall asleep like 2 o‚Äôclock, but I‚Äôm falling asleep at like 9 o‚Äôclock and it just helps my mind calm down and there‚Äôs so much things to do you can do like anything that‚Äôs cool, so nice. I love it so much and it makes me fall asleep and there‚Äôs so many songs to choose from you. Get this and try out yourself actually and some games and apps are scams but this is not a scam. This is amazing. It‚Äôs so nice. Relax you so much. It‚Äôs not just for sleeping depression when you‚Äôre having a bad day sleeping in the morning and also about just having fun. It‚Äôs really fun to have this app I suggest for you to get it if you can‚Äôt fall asleep it is so good. I love it. It‚Äôs the best it‚Äôs just so nice and if you like thunderstorms, how about you get this app it‚Äôs the best thing in the world. I think it‚Äôs just so nice because my mom loves it. I love it. My brother loves it loves it loves it.

author: YuliaMandernach
title: Constant Life Companion
content: I started off years ago using Calm and paying monthly. I now have a lifetime subscription and that was the best investment. I‚Äôm in the habit of waking up in the morning and meditating with Daily Calm, then journaling within the app (check-ins and gratitude practice). I often use sleep stories (I have quite a few favorites) when I have trouble falling asleep. Short nap time stories are perfect for me when I want a refreshing daytime break. I also use various music options for different times of the day and moods I‚Äôm in. There are new features added to the app on a regular basis so I know I‚Äôll never run out of fresh content. I have yet to try Daily Movement (Yoga and stretching). And the app has more to offer. I find myself recommending Calm App to everyone for a lot of different reasons. And as a subscriber I can gift 30days of free app usage to anyone interested in trying it out. A very cool feature!

author: Alexa Pascal
title: 100% YES!!
content: So, I have had a difficult time sleeping ALLüëè MYüëè LIFE! When I decided to try Calm, I was a bit skeptical because I had tried so many different apps, skills, and techniques in the past, and NOTHING worked. I was still up for HOURS at a time each and every night, and waking up with 5-6 hours of sleep each and every morning. When I downloaded Calm, I did not have the membership. I was a bit disappointed with how little I could do, and how expensive the membership was. But the investment was worth it! The sleep stories and meditations have me asleep in 30 minutes TOPS (with the help of some anti-anxiety and sleep pills). I also have depression and anxiety, and the guided meditations are amazing! Every morning, I stretch with the guided stretches, and I do the Daily Calm and check-ins each day. No matter how dedicated to mindfulness and meditation you would like to be, this app is worth your time and money. I feel so much happier and more well-rested. I give an 11/10!

author: Mc:x
title: First time for everything
content:
I've never been able to actually relax enough to meditate. Today, I didn't quit before giving it a true try. I experienced a sense of connection to life. A sweet calmness relaxed my heart rate and my muscles as well as my thinking.
I'm a believer in Jesus as the one savior. The entire bible is knit together too perfectly for it to have been a hoax. 
For the reason of being a Christian, I thought that true meditation would conflict. I believed that if one opened their mind to relaxation then it would allow for evil thoughts to sneak in.
This is NOT what I experienced. 
I simply continued to know my lord, and savior as I worked to relieve my self of the stress in my life. Therefore, allowing for meditation and Christianity to work as a powerful force to release the power of stress in my life. A way to look at my life one moment at a time. No overwhelming thoughts were given the power to ruin my moment, hours or day... I feel at peace and confident that God is ultimately in control!

author: SKPSKP0509
title: Great for anxiety and depression
content: Before using this app, I was going through a bad breakup and had anxiety, panic attacks and this constant fear of the future. I also had trouble sleeping at night because of intrusive thoughts. I was lucky to get 3 hours of sleep. I‚Äôve never been this emotionally wounded before. I called multiple emotional support crisis lines because I was just trying to hang on until my next appointment with my therapist. This kind lady recommended the Calm app. It‚Äôs $70 a year (equivalent to a Starbucks drink a month) and it was so worth it. I didn‚Äôt see improvement right away, but I tried out the mediation exercises and it seriously helped me out a lot. I never really knew how to mediate, but this app taught me how to manage my thoughts and strengthen my mind. I use Calm every night and every morning and it seriously works. I believe the meditation & calming anxiety exercises worked out better for me than anything else.

author: Gossymer9
title: Find Peace with Calm
content: The variety of meditation options in Calm means you will never be lost for a session regardless of why you‚Äôre seeking out a calming meditative escape. Pause your busy day and busy mind with everything from simple, low guidance sessions, set for the time you want and have available, or take a guided course that assists you with addressing an area of concern, like anxiety, depression, or just building resilience and gratitude skills. Calm now has masterclasses (which I intend to try soon!), meditations geared towards kids, and even bedtime stories, for those of us whose busy minds need a calm voice to lull us to sleep still. The calming bedtime sessions have helped me on numerous evenings when I thought I was going to be up way past my bedtime with insomnia. Instead, I quietly listened to someone reading a story, with tranquil ambient sounds, and was asleep minutes later. Give Calm a try, you have nothing to lose! The paid content is definitely worth the subscription price!

author: Funk zapper
title: Scam
content:
The system for managing subscriptions and payments through Apple unnecessarily complicates the process to unsubscribe for users. To unsubscribe, we must navigate through the app to find a single link that then directs us to the store that directs us to another page where we can then finally unsubscribe from a single link buried between a list of probably 30 different options. This is poor business ethic that deliberately obscures the process in hopes that users will simply give up and allow payment to be processed.

 I went through the process once upon the end of my trial subscription and must have hit the wrong button because I was charged $70 the next day. My request for refund from Apple was run through an algorithm that quickly informed me that my purchase does not meet the requirement for a refund. 

Listen. I tried this app ONCE and did not enjoy it. I never used it again. And now I‚Äôm stuck with it? Bad business. Shame on Apple. As for Calm, this is about as calm as it gets when your customers take the time to write an actual critical and constructive review.  Y‚Äôall should really think about fixing this.

author: Ambrai
title: Great way to meditate in any manner and at all levels.
content: I started meditating a over 2 years ago and went looking for an app to help shortly thereafter. The beginner guided sessions have walked me through the basics and getting better sleep. The deeper guided sessions start at 3 minutes and work up from there in great easy, workable increments. The daily Calm meditations are wonderful - all about 10 minutes long and give a bump to the variety of meditation available. The timed, unguided sessions are great once you know what you want to focus on. Sleep Stories include fiction and non-fiction read by a wide variety of people. There are tales in, what are to me, second languages, and they are amazing too! There's also music and ambient sounds with music. The most recent addition is 'Music' - this has 'Focus', 'Calm/Relax', 'Deep Sleep' and they seem to be different tones and patterns/wavelengths to help with those activities. I haven't used them much, but it's safe to say, this app is simply wonderful.

author: Uncle Danny Ray
title: Right place at the right time
content:
I am normally get tired of sponsored adds, but I was going through a breakup. I saw calm on an add and then looked a little into it. My girlfriend, now an ex, passed away shortly after I started my meditation journey. I tried to do it every day but through mourning it was hard to motivate myself to put the work in. 

Over time I continued making myself do it. Not constantly, but consistently. I did it when I felt unsettled or off center. I never understood this feeling until I stated meditation. Now I am able to recognize this feeling and address it with myself in the moment. I cannot express how much this app has held my hand throughout the grief.

I am grateful for the peace I find in meditation. Calm gave me a beginners guide to meditation and continues to guide my mind. It‚Äôs worth the money of course. It‚Äôs also worth sharing with your friends and family. Calm is a great app that shares a great purpose.

author: Gillian_96
title: I can‚Äôt sleep without this app
content:
I‚Äôve always been the kind of person who struggles falling asleep. I didn‚Äôt think that the sleep stories or the sleep music would help me, but boy was I wrong. At first I did all the free stuff. And then one night after going out to the couch and tossing and turning until 3 a.m. I kind of said screw it and paid the money for a years subscription. It seems like a lot of money, but broken down over an entire year it‚Äôs totally worth it!! 

I can not go to bed with out this thing, believe me I‚Äôve tried! I sleep so restlessly without it. I don‚Äôt use it too much for the meditation, but I have and it‚Äôs wonderful. I mostly use it for sleep. I‚Äôve found that I have favorite narrators that I like and I get so excited when my favorite narrator adds a new sleep story. 

I‚Äôm not someone who spends money willy nilly, but this was a very smart purchase and when my year is up I will be resubscribing. Just trust me, it will be worth every penny!

author: Cowjumpedoverthrmoon
title: Focus on you Mission and Nessage
content:
You want the program to exude calm before sleep, yet many of your stories just do not meet your goals.  The Dragon Story is an excellent example of missing the mark. As a Counselor,  it is not a relaxing story at all. It depands attention, visualization that is mysteriously dark and it simply misses the mark on helping anyone reach a stage of calm. If you are serious about helping those prepare fir sleep you MUST make major changes. Changed must include the following: 
1. Have a Relaxation Exercise that emphasizes breathing techniques, Walk Through the Relaxation Exercises step-by-step. Never ask your users to automatically do them.
2. Get Rid of telling stories. You are forcing people to listen and the idea is to Turn Off the brain so slumber can flow.
3. Slow down music! Have you ever considered watching a yoga session or other relaxation programs offered at parks or recreation facilities? They are slow moving and quiet. Use that as your inner movement.
4. Look at your fabulous name, ‚ÄúCalm‚Äù. DO NOT GIVE UP. YOU WILL DO THIS! I will be in the midst of writing my book. If you would like to set up a meeting, please let‚Äôs discuss a date after 12/02

author: Coconut playz
title: Thank you, Calm.
content: I suffer from anxiety ever since my first fish died, and I lost him. He was my favorite one of all of my fish, and now it‚Äôs kinda rough, he used to do little circles in the water whenever I entered the room after school. Calm helped me slow my thoughts down, and helped me get through it. It‚Äôs incredible how A little story, or music, or even just words, can help overcome what you are suffering through. Calm is A friend to me, always helping me get through stuff, and now, I still have anxiety, and am often anxious for one thing or another, but I am easily calmed down by calm. and am also very very very clumsy. So I burn myself or cut myself by accident. But calm helps. Giving relaxing words, music, or stories. I hope the makers of Calm and their workers should be very proud, helping people A crossed the world overcome fear, or anxiety, or depression, or guilt, and Etc. You guys are amazing. I wish one day, I can say thank you for everything, face to face. You guys are amazing!

author: TetonRyder
title: Pretty awesome
content: I am an insomniac and pay for this app to help me fall back asleep when I wake up in the night. I have found about A dozen stories on here that really work well for that. Those are the only ones which have soothing and not annoying voices, enjoyable content, and are written for adults.I wish there were more like this but this many are truly awesome and help me fall asleep when I wouldn‚Äôt have a chance without it. The other drawback to the app is that when your story ends you can‚Äôt just play it again without activating your brain much because it is always suggesting other stories or asking you to check in, it would be a lot better if it would just stay on the screen you‚Äôd chosen and all you would have to do is press play. Also I work in the wilderness during the summer so there‚Äôs no service at all. Sometimes I‚Äôm able to play the stories I have downloaded, but other times for some reason they all vanish from my liked page and some or all of them will not be playable from the all page either.

author: Eman0520
title: Genuinely did Not Expect such Great Results
content: First off, I would like to say everyone is different and how this app effects them may vary. In my experience though it has helped me so much with my anxiety. It‚Äôs helped me sleep better and just feel much better about myself. I was struggling the last couple months with anxiety and it was causing me panic attacks and I started to get full blown insomnia. For two weeks I had totaled at 8 and a half hours of sleep the whole week (not one night). My cousin gifted me a yearly subscription for this app and genuinely have never been more grateful. If you have the resources to spend on this app and you really need it, I would definitely recommend giving it a chance. If you don‚Äôt have the money I‚Äôm not sure what the free version is like but it may be good. And a word of advice, also use resources outside the app for help as well! You got this and stay strong!

author: satsuma6
title: Meditation leader voice a problem
content: This is a good app if you don‚Äôt have misophonia. The main daily meditation leader, Tamara Levitt, accentuates the sibilant s sounds at the end of words. Either she has a dental problem, or she feels this is calming (I hope she does not have a dental problem.) She also puts excessive smile in her voice. I feel like both of these problems could be fixed if she didn‚Äôt try so hard to sound like she‚Äôs leading a meditation. I‚Äôm sure she has a great voice if she would just not try so hard to sound ‚Äúcalming.‚Äù  The voice is excessively ‚Äúsweet.‚Äù She actually sounds like an evil Disney character that‚Äôs pretending to be good. Other female readers and meditation leaders on the app do not have this problem. The voice irritates me so much that I can not listen to most of the meditations (and as you can tell, I need meditation) Anyway, there are some other meditation leaders but she is the main one. If you are ok with her voice, you‚Äôll like the app. If you don‚Äôt you may still like some of the music, sleep stories, and other meditators. Just look for it on sale.

author: toe knoee
title: The sleep stories üëå üò© üëç
content:
This app has something for you regardless if you‚Äôre a beginner or if you‚Äôve been walking the path your whole life. The guided meditations are fine, but if you‚Äôre not into that, there‚Äôs a lot more on offer here. 
This app has showed me that bedtime stories are such an underrated category of content. Wonder read by Matthew McConaughey is probably the most beautiful thing I‚Äôve ever listened to. That collection of content alone is almost worth the price. 
The included Masterclass content on psychology is brilliant. The soundscapes are good and all the ones I‚Äôve tried loop very smoothly, if they loop at all, which I figure they must...but I digress. 
This app offers a lot of content for its price. Which, admittedly, does seem very steep at first, until you realize how much you‚Äôre getting. 
There is a lot to this app and I wish I could recommend it to everyone but that price point is a little scary for a lot of people I‚Äôd imagine.

author: mandifa419
title: Charging me premium twice despite requests to stop
content: My toddler likes the Thomas the tank meditations. I got the premium subscription for $70 a year out of desperation to get my kiddo to sleep. Apparently I was pretty sleep deprived myself because I bought it twice, as explained by the company representative. One under the App Store and one online with an email. When I asked if she could stop one of them, she ghosted me. I still can‚Äôt seem to cancel one of them, and the other had been paid for the year anyway. It was one day until the free trial ended, and the rep refused to help me. Regardless of the content, which I don‚Äôt personally find helpful, I think ethically the company should not take advantage of people like that. I‚Äôve led groups on mindfulness meditation for years as a therapist, and I think this content is just okay. Search for mindfulness meditations and lots of free videos will pop up. Or try reading or listening to real mindfulness like jon kabat-zin. Glad some people find this app useful, but I wish I‚Äôd never signed up. Paying for two premium subscriptions I barely use (and the one I can‚Äôt find auto renews!), feeling duped.

author: SwedishPisces
title: Love the stories/soundscapes, hate lack of playlist or default soundscape for after story ends
content:
I love you. But please either let us make playlists or at least elect to have a soundscape start after the story ends (or run in the background at the same time, or whatever) so that I don‚Äôt get awakened by my air conditioner compressor kicking on or the neighbor‚Äôs dog barking and have to fumble with starting up rain on car windows or brown noise or whatever. 

My kids and I rely heavily on your app for entertainment/comfort as we drift off and background noise while we sleep, and at the steep subscription cost, I feel like I should either be able to select something to automatically come on after Erik Braa or Nick Offerman‚Äôs warm hug of a voice has rocked me to sleep. The playlists you have are not set up for 30-45 minutes of story and then 8 hours of soundscapes. Please make that change or give us the ability to request specific playlists. It would make my evenings and my kids‚Äô sleep much better.

author: Qw12th
title: Canceled subscription because of Tamara Levitt‚Äôs voice
content:
This is a great overall app. The stories for kids are amazing, the breathing techniques are great, etc. all the good things you have read from all of the other reviews. 

One of the reasons I download the app was to combat insomnia. I wake up in the middle of the night and find the sleep meditations helpful for drifting back to sleep. This got frustrating quickly because the voice of the narrator for 90% of the sleep meditations is wildly irritating. She sounds like a caricature of a dame from the 40‚Äôs. Her voice is fine if I‚Äôm not trying to fall asleep, but it is terrible at 3 in the morning. There‚Äôs no option to filter out specific narrators and she seems to be the primary voice for sleep. 

I know that sounds, including voices, land differently for everyone, so you may find her voice soothing, or at least not mind it. I am hoping that new narrators and other options are added under sleep meditations.

author: Jessicaroza
title: Love Calm but won‚Äôt renew for another year.
content: Buyers of this app will not be displeased at the wealth of available stories, meditations, soundscapes, etc. The app truly pays for itself in one year. My Quip with the developers is about the structure of the app itself. The ease of use is 1000% more accesible from the locked version. The ability to navigate between soundscapes, sleep stories, meditations is more easily searched and thoroughly categorized. Obviously it is locked and I can‚Äôt listen to those items, but I can find them in an instant. Not sure if this is purposeful to get people to buy your app. I‚Äôd like to think that‚Äôs not true but in my experience the app is more difficult to navigate after purchase. Please try to make the experience more seamless for customers who decide to invest in their wellness and in your app. I believe the developers can make this a smoother transition from free app to purchased content. Thank you for your time and for existing. üïâÔ∏è

author: Ninifire2016
title: Download Calm Now!
content: I highly recommend downloading the app "Calm." Right now, I get to wake up after a long week and take a bath while listening to a woman with a Scottish accent softly speak about "Scotland's Hidden Hideaways." The whole app offers deep breathing exercises, meditation tracks and "sleep stories," which I don't always just use for sleep but for relaxing. Not selling anything just really enjoy this app. I often listen to the rain sound while sleeping and I love the sense of love and support I get in the stories. The meditation is nice too. My only suggestions: -Have a fast forward option for sleep stories -have categories in stories like read by male/female and have time categories (some are 30 min some are 12, would like them sorted) -have stories separated that don't necessary have to be for "sleep" but just for relaxation -add some more breathing patterns Love it, thank you! ^_^

author: Flyte99
title: I almost love this 100% but...
content:
When I downloaded this app I was delighted at the surprising approach to relaxing at bedtime: Sleep stories for adults! Genius! At first I thought the idea was silly but was sold after a couple evenings of stories. I subscribed for the year. I was really looking forward to the Daily Calm, too. 

Stories with wonderful readers like Anna Acton and Stephen Fry are pure heaven. Sadly, it‚Äôs Tamara Levitt‚Äôs voice that made me cancel my subscription. I feel awful saying this but it‚Äôs true. What is perhaps an attempt to sound soothing comes across as phony affectation. It‚Äôs grating. As a result I can‚Äôt listen to the Daily Calm. When my partner chose a story read by her one evening he and I were just minutes in before he asked for one read by someone else (without me having expressed my opinion about her tone of voice). 

This is a solid app. If the content she curates is read by others, however, it would be a GREAT app. I would happily resubscribe if the readers and voices at Calm were less Tamara and more varied.

author: 7448Head
title: Breath Taking
content:
I haven‚Äôt had this app very long. I have been trying to justify the purchase. I finally decided that my sanity was worth it. 
There‚Äôs no app out there to compare to this one, in how much research, thought, time and love that was put into the creation. The creators are constantly adding to it with more and more features and I am learning to meditate at age 63!
 I am finding that my life has become calmer (no pun intended), and definitely more focused on the wonderful things this life has to offer. I very much look forward to using this app each day‚Ä¶.sometimes several times a day, to center my well-being and be taken away to a place that I can only imagine. If you‚Äôre debating on whether or not to spend a little money on yourself to improve your life, go ahead! You‚Äôre worth it! Believe me, the people in your life will want to know where to send their thank you notes!

author: hdrryingswruiknxswas
title: Love love content but slow slow service
content: Iv been using this app for about a year now. Super helpful throughout pandemic!! Initially started using to help with sound at night to fall asleep. But now I love the sleep stories so much. The Exploring Ireland is played regularly in the evening and I now plan to go Ireland some day bc of the story. I use the  playlist during my yoga/stretching after a work out to calm down and relax and I‚Äôm obsessed!!  So highly recommend bc of the content! 5/5 stars! I gave it a 3 though over all bc it‚Äôs a very slow app. I‚Äôll have full service every and other app works great on my phone but the loading time with Calm App is so slow  compared to other apps on my phone..sometime I‚Äôll just end up turning it off bc it never loads no matter the WiFi or LTE I‚Äôm on... now idk if it‚Äôs my service or the app sometimes.  I‚Äôd give it 5 stars if the app was fast in loading time.

author: Hangingpictures
title: Wish I could buy some episodes
content:
Has some lovely calming images and sounds, and the unlocked bedtime story to which I listened had a a soothing voice. There many unlocked sessions I would like to hear and wish the owners would at least give a sample of the voice and then allow me to purchase the episode to own it, rather than requiring  a pricey (for me) yearly  subscription, for which the product is forever gone when it runs out. I know subscriptions are becoming the way of the world, but still I resist!  I do believe people should be paid for their work; I‚Äôd just like to be able to actually purchase a product; I would rate five stars if they would allow this. 

‚ÄúCalm‚Äù has a nice daily feature (one of the few push notifications I allow on my phone) which reminds me to stay in the moment, breathe, etc.   The app has some generous free offerings and I thank thank the developers for sharing these!

author: drmax944
title: First Impression
content: Today I began a free trial to ‚ÄúCalm.‚Äù I am impressed with its quality of content and the wide range of its content. Its images and sounds are exceptional for calming and inspiring. The voices sound like a therapist guiding you in relaxation, mindfulness, and peace. The reminders and daily practices help one to establish healthy daily routines and habits that have the potential to improve the quality of mental health and its frequency and duration. And these are my positive first impressions of the APP ‚ÄúCalm‚Äù after a brief 15-20 minute experience using it for the first time! I am looking forward to exploring more of its features and using them on a daily basis. I recommend that therapists and life coaches introduce this APP to their clients especially with those clients that are anxious, stressed, or angry. Well done to the developers of ‚ÄúCalm,‚Äù you have created a professional mental health APP that will improve the mental health, happiness, and peace of its habitual users!

author: Felinni
title: One year later!
content: I tried this app with very little expectation about whether meditation was going to do anything for me. In fact, I was just curious when I downloaded it to begin with. What I‚Äôve received has been so much more than I could have imagined. Learning to meditate with the resources inside was easy and tremendously beneficial to me. I had been looking for new ways to experience what it means to be present and mindful for more than 18 months when tried meditation. A year after using it, and now I cannot imagine a world where at some point during my day I don‚Äôt just stop in all the busyness and just ‚Ä¶ be. Through meditation I‚Äôm still learning that to be fully human, you must be fully present. And no matter what I‚Äôm going through, good or bad, I‚Äôm my best when I am just present in the moment. Thank you for the gift of meditation. Thank you for helping me be the my best self.

author: Donrose04
title: I need Calm so Badly!
content:
I‚Äôm in my 70s now , and always another problem each day. Last few years it has been health problems for either husband or me. I got a startling surprise just in the last week about my health. Thank the Good Lord I subscribed to CALM about two weeks ago. I‚Äôm not real familiar with it yet, but the past nights I have gotten some wonderful calming, refreshing sleep! Not a miracle, but much welcomed sleep. Usually when something is bothering me, I toss all night‚Ä¶. But is finding comfort and help by using calm. I‚Äôm so glad I subscribed to it! 
    I have it on my iPad‚Ä¶. I find it difficult to remember to take the iPad upstairs at night and downstairs every morning. Does anyone know of a solution that would not be too expensive? I have a kindle, is it possible to use my Calm subscription on two devices? I‚Äôm not sure the kindle would be sufficient. Any ideas would be appreciated.

author: Tweakmind
title: No Longer Keeps Playing When I Lock My Phone
content:
I really liked this app at first. Eventually, I got bored of it. It‚Äôs cumbersome to find something I want versus what it thinks I want. I like Sleep Stories but more and more of them are sleep stories for children. Seriously, people only use this because they don‚Äôt want to bond with their children by reading them bedtime stories? The stories should be to help get adults to sleep. 

Just after I wasted $70 on another yearly subscription, the app suddenly will not keep playing a soundscape when I lock my phone. How is this useful? I am not going to leave my phone unlocked all night when I am trying to sleep. I love the Rain on Leaves soundscape but the app refuses me to use it to get to sleep now.

The app used to go back to the Sounscape after a sleep story. Now it‚Äôs silence. If your using the app to cover other noise, it‚Äôs now incapable of doing so. I just canceled (although I am out for over 11 months of the subscription) and deleted the app again. This is the third time I‚Äôve tried to give the app a chance.

author: *uckthisapp
title: Calm to the rescue!
content: I don‚Äôt know what I‚Äôd do without this app. I‚Äôm a life long somewhat insomniac that cannot fall asleep unless I have something that ‚Äúoccupies‚Äù my brain, so I can turn off all the junk I worry about. These stories are highly entertaining, and very interesting, yet calming at the same time. They‚Äôre also educational! I‚Äôve learned many things from around the world that I didn‚Äôt know before. Most nights I‚Äôm out after 2-5 minutes, but some take longer. If I wake up during the night, I simply start a new story and I‚Äôm asleep again. I have my favorite narrators too. I find that male voices with accents other than American (with the exception of Erik Brah and Alan Sklar) really lull me to sleep. I need a deep voice lol. Females with British, Asian, Indian accents are great for me too. There‚Äôs also calming nature sounds and spa music. I‚Äôve been using the Calm app for 2 years now and it never disappoints! Now I don‚Äôt have to reach for the Xanax anymore!

author: Gypsyphnx
title: Top of the line, but...
content:
I have been a paid subscriber for years, and, until this year, I would have said that this app is perfect for insomnia: 

Celebrity voices coupled with the technique of measured cadence and gradually diminishing volume are features that make this sleep aide unique and more effective than any of the many others that I‚Äôve tried.

I only wish there were a timer on the nature noise that comes in when the sleep story is finished,  as it is the ABSENCE of noise that eventually wakes me up in the morning, like the opposite of an alarm. I use silence as my alarm on another app and it works splendidly, and is not nerve wracking, like an alarm would be.

However, after years of satisfaction, an noticeable issue has come to my attention: More and more of the sleep stories are of a religious nature. At first the sleep stories were fantastic: funny stories, fairie tales, travelogues, poetry, even some to BORE you to sleep, like someone reading the rules of cricket! LOL 

But, for some reason, writings are containing more and more religious content and I‚Äôm starting to feel like I‚Äôm in a class on Religions of the World, when I‚Äôm trying to go to sleep. This falls into the category of ‚Äúpersuasive rhetoric ‚Äú and my brain is busy analyzing my own opinion s on the theology or philosophy that is presented, keeping me from resting. 

Could we please just have stories that our brains will not be analyzing for truth?

author: MiTcHy24688642
title: Worth every moment.
content: This is such a well-rounded, thoughtfully created, educational, and inspiring tool for learning Mindfulness, reaping the benefits of it, and keeping it in everyday practice. Tamara Levitt is a wonderful coach, and I find her focused mini-practices extremely helpful. ‚ÄúThe Daily Calm‚Äù sessions are a nice way to start the day, and help me stay on track with my practice. I attended a weekly mindfulness group for over a year, and it helped me overcome some issues that I had been dealing with for decades. This app served as an adjunct to my weekly meetings, and nowadays, it‚Äôs a part of my daily routine. Whatever negative issue you might be dealing with, there‚Äôs no-nonsense help here. Sleeplessness, anxiety, depression, overeating, judgment, self-doubt, lack of motivation, boredom, and many other topics are covered, and can be cherry-picked to suit the most emergent need, or merely followed in the modules. I find it very useful for getting energized, sparking my creativity, or winding down from the day.

author: Blakiecakes
title: Good, but I like Headspace a lot better
content: I used Calm for quite a while, and there were a lot of things I liked about it, and a lot of things I didn‚Äôt. One of the things I love about Calm are the sleep stories which always helped me relax. I also liked the guided meditations by Tara Brach. I have very sensitive ears, especially when it comes to human voices, so I‚Äôm very particular about the voice. I didn‚Äôt like Tamara Levitt‚Äôs voice at all, and found it was way too sweet for me. Like a kindergarten teacher: ‚ÄúNow Wiggle your feetsies and toesies‚Äù. Ugh. after a while it ended up getting on my nerves abit. I realize this is more is about me than the teacher, but I guess we all have our preferences. Also I just like Headspace better. They have lots of videos, workouts, and advice vids that help you make a more comprehensive and integrated practice. I also find Andy to be a far more precise and technically minded teacher, which helps people like me who are very analytical and really like to think about things.

author: Mcunger
title: Almost a 5...
content: First of all I‚Äôve recommended this app to multiple friends who have purchased a subscription. We all think it is great for helping us relax, reduce anxiety and fall asleep. However, I periodically have issues with my phone not charging properly when the app is open so I asked my husband to download so we could trade off who‚Äôs phone plays the calm at night. I was very disappointed to find out that our 1 year subscription could not be shared. It basically makes the ‚Äúfamily sharing‚Äù pointless. My question to the developer is, will it really hurt your business that much to allow family members to share one subscription? I‚Äôve had this for over a year and this is the first time I‚Äôve even tried to share it with someone in my family list. It is not a cheap subscription but if it is going to hurt your business, then limit it to x amount of shares or offer the second subscription for a discount. Just a few thoughts. Otherwise. Great app.

author: Princiegall
title: Many insomnia triggers!
content: Migraine, fibromyalgia, genetic anxiety...all contributors to my struggles with falling asleep. I don‚Äôt remember the first place I saw Calm advertised but it popped into my head about three weeks ago and has already done wonders. Right now I‚Äôm mainly using the Music category and selecting either Sleep which are very gentle music compositions or Soundscapes which are different sounds from nature. There is so much to choose from depending on your needs.....sleep, energy, meditation, putting a child to sleep, yoga background sounds.....I‚Äôve only scratched the surface. What I have used has helped me focus on the sound instead of my pain or what I‚Äôm concerned about. I set it for 30 minutes and I fall to sleep before it‚Äôs over. Before this I was lying awake for 2-3 hours and sometimes more.....like all night long. I highly recommend this app to anyone who wants a little more peace in their life.

author: L@nZ
title: Calm app has helped to change my life
content:
[September update: I still use this app on a daily basis, including the new Sleep stories and music. I can't recommend this app highly enough. It is making a big impact in my life and my ability to deal with changes in our country and politics.] I highly recommend the Calm App, especially the basic subscription model. After learning meditation basics from the free versions, I realized that I needed more and subscribed more than a year ago. The Daily Calm meditation, each on a different but related theme, makes it possible to practice on a daily basis. The meditation leader presents lovely thoughtful meditations, with an appropriate quotation. There are numerous meditations focused on different issues such as anxiety, compassion, and loving kindness. The lovely images and sounds furnish calming and focusing backgrounds. The new sleep stories module has really helped with my middle of the night insomnia.

I highly recommend the Calm App.

author: Core104
title: This app locked me out after paying!
content: After trying this app for a few days, I was in a moment of stress and signed up for the 7-day free trial early this morning. After I agreed to have $60 charged in the App Store after the free trial, the Calm app did not unlock its content for me. I quit the app and tried again. No success.  I went to manage by subscription and hit ‚Äúrestore‚Äù within the app, but it said ‚Äúno account found.‚Äù I then logged out and tried to long in again‚Äî but the app wouldn‚Äôt let me log in, saying ‚Äúbad gateway‚Äù. I then tried to change my password, but I got an error message saying ‚Äúthere is a problem resetting your password.‚Äù I deleted the app and reinstalled it from App Store. Again no luck logging in‚Äî even though the App Store says I have a free trial and I‚Äôll be charged $60 after 7 days. Great. I can‚Äôt even access the app to cancel this recurring subscription. Their website doesn‚Äôt work and I can‚Äôt contact them. I will have to take this up with my credit card company. The Calm developers are CROOKS and SCAMMED me out of money. I wanted to use it to get back to sleep, but it‚Äôs made me anything but calm! STAY AWAY and choose a different app!!!!

author: Kasianay
title: Add it to your toolbox
content:
I‚Äôve been using calm since the start of my meditation journey around 4 years ago. It is an incredible tool to have in my back pocket. As a supplement to day-to-day life, it brings grounding, peace, and it helps me tap into my own sense of security. 

Since my first interaction with the app, there has been so much refinement. The content is more organized, adaptable, and influential. It is inclusive to a large scope of ages, and there are so many unique voices that this platform holds. I appreciate the racial and cultural inclusivity that it brings into the hands of its users as well. It‚Äôs really refreshing to work with a platform where I feel seen, and to know that others are being acknowledged in the same way.

Besides the daily practices, the music and soundscapes are my favorite aspects of the app. I look forward to participating on this platform as its evolution continues. Grateful for Calm :)

author: fingirl4ever
title: Please give some love to your sleep stories!!
content: I love the Calm App. It has so much content to offer its users from meditations, music, sleep stories, and wellness. I originally got the app to try out the meditations but fell in love with the sleep stories. I loved them so much that I bought the lifetime subscription to Calm. It seems like over the last year that Calm is focusing on the other areas of the app and not so much the Sleep Stories. I notice that the sleep stories don‚Äôt come as often as they used to and even that the sleep story area of the app is glitchy when you scroll it seems really laggy, it‚Äôs pretty hard to look at. I wish they would have more history sleep stories like they used to. I also wish they would add the ability to loop the stories so that they would repeat a few times. Please also bring back more new stories with some of the narrators that you used to use like Alan Sklar, Anna Acton and Erik Braa. Thank you!

author: Loving Jenn
title: LOVE This Ap
content: I‚Äôve never spent much money on an ap before, and I love this one so much I just forked over the money to get this one for life. I‚Äôm looking at it as an investment in my health. I love this one because it‚Äôs got everything I need to help me manage my anxiety and sleep better. I‚Äôm also a psychotherapist and use it often with my clients (just yesterday in fact). The music, meditations, education on meditation and sleep are all of excellent quality. I just open the ap and my body knows to calm down. I also love that it‚Äôs on my phone so it‚Äôs always accessible to me when I need it. The only thing I‚Äôd like calm folks is some kind of directory or search function. I‚Äôll send an email to you with more details...another thing I like is that there customer service folks are responsive and helpful. If you‚Äôre struggling with anxiety, worry, racing thoughts, sleep problems, this ap will help you!

author: CelestialWarrior
title: My daily routine
content:
Edit: reducing to 3 stars until this stops randomly playing scenes in the background. I reached out to support and have not seen a reply. Has been over a month.

Calm has become a huge part of my life. I‚Äôm on my 2nd year of my subscription and I am not looking back. I have grown substantially personally since starting this journey, and every day I deepen my understanding of my mind and how I view and interact with the world. I find Calm to be a blessing and it is regularly in my list of gratitudes. I think this is my most frequently recommended app, as it is the ultimate mental knife sharpener. You can better almost any aspect of your life with a daily sit. This may be the longest app review I‚Äôve ever written, and that‚Äôs because it‚Äôs warranted. I wish I could give this app 10 stars as it is a life changer and I am eternally grateful for the course adjustments it has helped me make in my life.

author: KathyLynn520
title: Just awesome!
content:
I struggle with anxiety and depression, plus the related insomnia. My doctors have all recommended meditation but I couldn‚Äôt ever figure out how to do it. The guidance on this app, however, finally made the connection for me. I‚Äôve learned how to quiet my mind without additional medication. Not saying all my problems are gone - just that I have a new tool to help me cope. 

And the sleep stories are the best! Anytime the brain won‚Äôt let me sleep, I turn a sleep story on. It engages my mind enough to distract it from the litany of worries, stresses, and reminders of middle school embarrassments. I love the wide variety of narrators and subject matter.

One other thing... when I began looking for a meditation app, I really wanted to avoid any that promoted specific spiritual or religious practices. I haven‚Äôt come across anything like that in Calm. I can fold these meditations into my own beliefs/traditions without feeling stressed that they‚Äôre in conflict with one another.

author: GriffonGirlisAwesome
title: Mostly everything is locked. So disappointed
content: One night, I was having a bad anxiety attack and I thought about downloading this app so I did and of course, i wasn‚Äôt thinking anything would be locked. As soon as I had got into my account, 90% of the stories were LOCKED. I was so mad because this is unfair to me. Basically everything is locked so this app is not for me and I‚Äôm very disappointed. If this app is for helping people, why should mostly everything be locked?! And I have to pay 70 dollars for premium? That‚Äôs ridiculous!! I don‚Äôt have much self-esteem and the self esteem stories were all locked, so I am pretty mad about that. I wanted to try a song. EVERY STORY IS LOCKED. I wanted to try a meditate story. EVERY STORY IS LOCKED. I wanted to try a sleeping story. ONLY 4 STORIES UNLOCKED. Do you not think that this is fair? I‚Äôve listen to all the stories that are unlocked without premium and I have to re-listen to them because everything is basically locked. This app is great and all, but basically everything is locked. The stories are good, but I have to listen to the same ones. Please unlock more. That‚Äôs why I‚Äôm giving it a 1 star and a negative review.

author: Z Taalib Bey
title: Seeing improvement
content:
I am using a variety of tools to assist with my personal growth and development. I have my work cut out for me. I've had this wonderful app for a couple of weeks. I started with the sleep stories and at first I couldn't do it every night. There was almost a week between the first and second time. Last night there was only a day between, and only a day between the one before that. I know that may sound insignificant but for me that is HUGE. I'm committed to doing the sleep every day, even when I work at night and I'm actually sleeping during the day. I am feeling the improvement in the quality of my sleep. Today I will also try the breathing and focus.

I tend not to rate apps, but for some reason I'm feeling compelled to with this one even though I haven't been using it long. I'm pretty sure I'll be back with periodic updates. Btw, I gave 4 stars (vs 5) to leave room for improvement.üíú

author: Russell216
title: It takes practice
content: The first time I tried calm was the first time I tried to learn meditation in general.  I practiced this skill while trying to stay sober last time.  I more or less missed the point.  Prior to my last sober date (still going strong) I revisited the practice as well as the app.  This time instead of trying to force meditation on myself and getting angry when my surroundings through me out of focus I let the teachings of Jeff and this app sink in more and approach the practice with a more easy going approach.  The skill of meditation takes alot of practice to make it a part of you, but it is well worth the time and effort put in.  My short term memory isn‚Äôt so hot and Im loaded with triggers, but Calm guides me in my practice and is priceless when my anxious takes over.  This is well worth it and may become one of the best things you have ever done for yourself, please try.

author: lovetherealbogglegame
title: Absolutely love and recommend!
content: I fall asleep within 10 minutes every time I play a sleep story! I have been using the Calm app for several years now and absolutely love it. It used to be really hard for me to fall asleep because my mind would constantly be thinking (unless I was extremely exhausted), and have the calm app to thank. There are so many sleep stories to choose from by several different narrators so you can find your favorites. They update with new stories regularly, which is awesome. They also have a calm kids section which helps our little ones to fall asleep before the story is over! We also enjoy the daily meditations. I can‚Äôt say enough good things and always recommend this app to everyone. It‚Äôs so relaxing. Thank you!! Keep being amazing!! Definitely worth the money too, especially the lifetime rate with the 60% discount!!

author: BloodyViper101
title: Fueled by greed, 99.9% behind a paywall
content:
The ads I‚Äôve seen for this app are heavily centered around assisting people going to sleep, so it‚Äôs odd that 10 minutes of searching lead to only finding 3 sleep stories on the free version. I don‚Äôt care to go through every album to count how many are available, but it‚Äôs pathetic that it requires extensive searching to find one. 
I even re-downloaded the when I was coming to write a review the first time because there were reviews shaming other reviews for ‚Äúnot looking hard enough‚Äù for the unlocked content. I‚Äôm now convinced that those reviews were forged by the developers, or they were looking for something other than a sleep app. 
When you start the app and go to the home page, it presents a variety of different tracks - and every one of the was locked but a motivational talk by LeBron James. At this point, I‚Äôm just typing to be typing; this app is a joke, I have no intentions of paying $70 a YEAR (not by months?) for an app that won‚Äôt let me preview what I‚Äôm getting. 
^Yeah, I could do the 1 week trial, but if I don‚Äôt cancel in time then I‚Äôm out $70 üëéüëéüëéüëé

author: AkshayAyyanchira
title: Highly Motivational
content: What I‚Äôve observed is motivation works differently for different people. Watching daily motivation quotes can work for someone, while watching some leader‚Äôs videos can do for some. But during all these media consumption phase we all are neglecting to care about what our brains want to tell us. We can only listen to our brains when we give attention to our thoughts. What do we think? how often are we getting distracted? how we cant even keep simple counts of breath as we breath as we are taken away with random thoughts. This can be realized as you spend quality time with yourself in a meditative state. I installed Calm with a bit of skepticism in mind that how can another media on a device help me not get distracted. But looks like it guides you well enough to have you introspect yourself, motivate you and gives a moment of self realization which you will definitely feel missed as you discover it. Great work team Calm!

author: CaseOfTheAnxieties
title: A game changer! So grateful for this App!!
content: I‚Äôve heard about Calm for a while now & remember seeing commercials but never thought to give it a try until recently and all I can say is WOW! Wish I got this months ago! With the virus lockdown I‚Äôve recently started to experience anxiety and panic attacks that I haven‚Äôt had since college (15 yrs ago). I tried my usual solo breathing & meditation techniques but they‚Äôre just not As effective as it used to be. I then started looking for meditation apps and thought I‚Äôd give this a try. SO glad I did! They have several categories from anxiety & stress relief to sleep aid sessions. All so very soothing, relaxing and 100% effective-I‚Äôm hooked! Also, I used to listen to gentle water or instrumental sounds to help me fall asleep but this app works so much better & faster. Definitely worth every penny and an absolute must to help with your mental health during this stressful & depressing pandemic. I am so grateful for Calm! :)

author: TrustMeBabes
title: Helps with sleep & stress [attn devs]
content: This is the best meditation app I‚Äôve tried. I use it 1‚Äì2 times a day. Great mix of content and teachers for different moods, goals, and time commitments. While the sleep meditations work for me, I find the sleep stories with celebrity narration too distracting and gimmicky to fall asleep to, but I know others users for whom this is their favorite feature. Calm offers a series of sequential programs for mindfulness skill-building: ‚Äú7 Days of ______,‚Äù where the next day‚Äôs content unlocks with the completion of the previous day‚Äôs. As a paying user, I wish there were a way to override this. I once exited a minute early, when the wrap-up was nearly over, because I had to leave, and the app made me redo that day to access the next meditation. Similarly, I just updated versions and lost three days‚Äô progress in a program. I think the only way to catch up is to let them play out with the volume off, which is a waste of time and energy.

author: bestava
title: A Gift of Kindness for Yourself
content:
I have been engaged with Calm for approximately two months. Tools within the app I have used include Daily Calm, Sleep Stories, musical selections and Mindfulness meditations focused on increased levels of practice tied to a specific set of behaviors. I am learning that active pursuit of mindfulness combined with my spiritual journey, is accelerating self awareness and self improvement, acceptance, patience and love towards others and an overall sense of accepting life‚Äôs ups and downs in a non-judgmental way. I find this is freeing my mind to enjoy each day more fully. My wife is amazed with changes in my words and actions. If you are engaged in Calm, I say congratulations and good for you, your family and friends. If you are in the process of beginning your own journey into deeper understanding of yourself and your world, I encourage you to make regular use of Calm and the resources it will afford you. 
Jim

author: Emdiam
title: One of the best
content: I‚Äôm rarely the type to review an app and I‚Äôm even less likely to purchase the full version of an app ‚Äî in the case of this app, I‚Äôve done both which should really be a testament to how much I truly appreciate this app and all its features. After long bout with insomnia and unable to ‚Äúshut down‚Äù my brain at night I downloaded this app and used the free features for a couple of weeks. The sleep stories lulled me to sleep and I was able to meditate after some intense anxiety. I finally purchased the full version and am so glad I did. No matter my mood or my goal (sleep, focus, or lessen anxiety) it has something for me and there‚Äôs so much content I never feel like it‚Äôs not worth it. I love the voice overs and guided meditations don‚Äôt feel forced. I‚Äôm brand new to this and I can see myself feeling better the more I use it. I look forward to it every night. A huge thanks to the makers of this app.

author: da hi hi
title: Great and great for people who can‚Äôt sleep but hard to log in
content:
My name is dalyshia green and this is my rate and let me start off my the first step of loginng in I had a hard time loging I‚Äôm cuz I did not sleep at that time when I woke up
On a Saturday night at 3am I could not sleep so I got on my iPhone and was playing a game and I saw this add and the rateings and I SAD ü§© this app really works so I downloaded  it  and I tryed to log in but it did not work so I used my zoom and it worked so I can do things and now imma talk about is great for people who can‚Äôt sleep witch is page and me talking 2 so this is a great app for people who can‚Äôt sleep first off the muisc that when you first log in I feel asleep and I woke up the next morning and ITS GREAT!!üòáüòá and I showed it to my family members that can‚Äôt sleep and it worked they said  and this is the ending of my rate ps Dalyshia green made on June 3th hope y‚Äôall have an great sleep and day üëã

author: Lauren_1211
title: Good, even without a subscription!
content: I‚Äôve been using this app on and off for a few days now, but each time I use it, I‚Äôve always had a positive experience with it. I‚Äôve only utilized the features that weren‚Äôt locked behind a paywall, but so far, I will say that this experience has been beneficial to ease my mind of stress and anxiety. It‚Äôs often stated that meditation helps reduce anxiety, and I can definitely agree with that statement. When you have racing thoughts and/or negative thoughts in general, a moment to relax, slow things down, and focus on yourself may be just what you need. One thing that I want to mention, but couldn‚Äôt fit it anywhere else, is that when I opened the app, there was calming music in the background that would fade when you closed out of it. I don‚Äôt think I‚Äôll pay for a subscription, but what I‚Äôve experienced so far is worth it for relaxation and decompressing after a long day.

author: Imaginationsfire
title: Hate new layout & Tamara‚Äôs Voice
content: I‚Äôve been a subscriber for over a year and have used the app almost daily during most of that time concurrent with my own journaling practice in Day One. I always loved opening the app and seeing the reminder to take a deep breath, and then feeling like I was somewhere else, somewhere calm. It made it easier to focus and meditate. But now all of that is gone, the ‚Äúplace‚Äù I went is gone, and the app is just another cluttered, stressful place of mental noise. Calm has added fragmented journaling options, which I guess is nice for any who wish them, but I will not trust my thoughts to their app, because that is essentially what it would be. Unlike Day One, they have no export feature or backups, and these recent events have not exactly made me trust them. A lot of materials are gone as well, though I can‚Äôt be sure of what all of it was. My arthritic thumbs don‚Äôt appreciate the new side-swiping menus for the sleep stories either. I wish I had not updated the app. I don‚Äôt know if I will keep my subscription; most of what is left is Tamara, Tamara, and Tamara.

author: Grammar J.
title: Invaluable
content: I can‚Äôt say enough about how healing this app is. I began practicing meditation with it following a concussion, and it did help. Then after, I kept with the practice prior to sleep, as I often stayed awake with racing thoughts. The Sleep Stories and meditations offered knocked me out every time. Still later, I really began practicing meditation during the day with the Daily Calms and other sessions. These have probably been the most valuable to my daily life. Much of the exhaustion I was experiencing that I thought was due to lack of sleep I believe now was due more to stress. Repeated practice of mindfulness has increased my calm, my awareness, my clarity, and my happiness. The guided lessons are akin to cognitive behavioral therapy, very poignant and always kind. There is no wrong way to practice this. There is no failing. There is no order that must be followed or schedule adhered to. There is only the benefit of the more you use it, the better you feel.

author: MC's MacBook Air
title: This is worth it!
content: I struggled with horrible PTSD symptoms for years now. It was difficult to apply mindfulness to my everyday routine until I found this app. It has greatly reduced my physical and mental symptoms by allowing me to become aware, ride the waves and let go of emotion. I‚Äôm not going to say it‚Äôs a cure because there is no such thing. I view it as a tool to maintain your mental fitness like a treadmill and exercise helps maintain your physical fitness. Gradually over time your mind becomes stronger and more capable but mindfulness like physical exercise should become part of your routine so you can keep optimum mental fitness. Also, I was on medication and no longer require it yet it doesn‚Äôt mean anyone should stop taking their medication. I suggest to start doing mindfulness and as you progress there may be a reduction to your prescription and eventually you may be able to come off of them. Hope this is helpful! God bless!

author: SoPo The Vibe
title: Calm, tranquility, solitude peace, prosperity & blessings to all.
content: In my short time this app to the amazing developers to ppl connecting finding calmness, consciousness in this chaotic world we raise our vibrations in we‚Äôve accomplished in science, quantum physics to esoteric & energy fields measured to raise it into a more positive vibrational alignment from 432HZ & ushered in the age of Aquarius for 3000 + years. So i send my light, love & positive energy to all as a member of the order of the light & thank you as a artist & musician SoPo The Vibe -I am of i am & humanity‚Äôs humble servant Arc Michael-SoPo The Vibe the free living soul/Creator artist & life coach to hope for humanity as you are if chosen to embark on this raising frequency & changing for the better the universe, multi dimensions & you as you exsist within it /Namaste, peace, shalom, OM-Praise be to the most high & love, light darkness &  all that is & we are. Remember the star matter in your eyes & you matter are loved & supported. SoPo The Vibe -

author: Feedback is Currency 2
title: Cool App. Wish there were more options for ‚ÄúHow you‚Äôre feeling?‚Äù
content:
So I‚Äôm trying this app out on the trial period‚Ä¶ so far it‚Äôs pretty cool. I love the notifications that prompt mindfulness and encourage me throughout the day. That happens on the free version as well. 

My favorite paid feature is the music library with songs featuring solfeggio frequencies, although the only one I saw was 432 hz. I also love access to albums such as ‚ÄúTransfigurations‚Äù by Moses Sumney.

What I don‚Äôt like in general is that ‚Äúcalm‚Äù is the only ‚Äúpositive‚Äù emotion available under the ‚ÄúHow are you feeling?‚Äù Check-In feature.

As though if I‚Äôm not feeling calm, I must be experiencing adverse conditions. I see the marketing thing they‚Äôre doing with ‚Äúcalm‚Äù as a positive emotion, however I think it would be helpful to include one or two other emotions such as ‚Äúexcited‚Äù and ‚Äújoyful‚Äù, or something like that. 

Also, in my opinion, the free version is definitely not worth having at all in comparison to some other apps which offer a handful of helpful free options, and a wealth of options once you subscribe.

I understand it‚Äôs a business that offers a wide variety of helpful features with popular (and probably expensive) celebrities and professionals though, so I‚Äôm sure they have to pay for that in addition to their employees.

All in all it‚Äôs a cool app if you decide it‚Äôs worth paying for. I‚Äôm still exploring .

author: fpoonline
title: Trying to fool us re fake "James Stewart" sleep story
content:
Four stars for train stories. Zero stars for fake "James Stewart" sleep story (AI voice made by Respeecher company masquerading as Jimmy Stewart) and your lying about it -- disgraceful, disrespectful, and creepy. There is no "beloved Hollywood legend James Stewart" narrating the story, as claimed -- the real JIMMY Stewart is of course dead, and coyly calling the terrible-sounding AI voice "James Stewart" and a "legend" is just cringe-making. Anyone with access to Google can read for themselves what you/Respeecher did and how. Why try to fool your subscribers? Terrible PR move, and an awful decision to "drink the AI Kool-Aid" with this step into deep-fake type content. Doesn't matter that Stewart's heirs signed off on it; money talking doesn't make it ethically right to make content that pretends a dead person said things they didn't. Anyone on staff ever read "1984" by George Orwell? If not, please do, and consider the larger implications of trying to pass off fake content as real, to use someone's likeness in an attempt to re-write their history, etc. 
Calm, please stop it, now.

author: Beymax2.0
title: Great content (home page overwhelming)
content: Love this app so much. It is so great that they have a meditation for such specific topics like emotions, stress, anxiety, etc. I‚Äôve also learned some good wisdom through the content for specific situations like grief etc. that got me unstuck a few times. Reached a point once using this app where I felt complete peace for a few days, which is unheard of from me, who has a lot of inner noise. Just one small critique though, the new Main Menu‚Äôs UX is quite anxiety inducing, it‚Äôs too much info at once. I find the layout a little ironic since one of the use cases are to get a quick meditation for anxiety. You get greeted with so much info on the first page alone, that I stopped using the main menu and just search or stumble around. The previous layout was so much clearer and better organized. I get that there is more content, but maybe there is a cleaner and more intuitive way. Please consider.

author: howmanynicknamescantherebe?
title: Just what I needed
content: Thanks for this fantastic app. I got this to aid in sleep while on international travel. That was ok but then I browsed the rest of the app and got interested in the meditation. Health providers have encouraged me for years to do this but I always assumed my mind was not disciplined enough for the practice. Enter Jeff Warren‚Äôs 30 Day course. I was hooked from my first ‚Äúsit‚Äù. Bringing your mind back to your focus without judgment and with compassion towards yourself is such a simple but powerful concept. I completed that course and have done others on managing pain and self esteem, as well as daily guides. I have even just used the timed meditation feature and ventured out on my own. I am a metrics kind of gal and I can report a data backed improvement in my resting heart rate. I wear a ring tracker and my sleep and RHR scores are improved.  Sorry to run on and on....this is a fantastic app for me and I hope you try it. Anyone can meditate.

author: luckybucky32
title: What a great and useful App!
content: Mind you, you can‚Äôt unlock all the features right away, or unless you pay or happen to have a ton of time on your hands, but this app was my favorite download of the year. You can meditate, listen to calming sessions, or music, and even choose your own scenes/background, which not only have accompanied sound, but also videos of corresponding scenes of nature and whatnot. My favorites are Pouring Rain, Tropical Beach, Passing Clouds, Coastline at Sunset, Foggy Steam, Thunderstorm, Evening Crickets, and Summer Meadow. They even have ones like; Fireplace, Zen Ocean, Falling Raindrops, Rhythmic Waves, Woodland Lake, Plains of Wheat, Mystic Fountain and Mountain Lake. I know there‚Äôs more but I suggest checking out this seriously cool App! Along with the Sleep Stories, relaxing music, focus training, and meditation for beginners, stress, relationships, sleep, emotions, and so on...this App is what you need at the end of any type of day, what we all need is a little Calm!

author: B.K. 73
title: has helped me in all aspects of life
content: i love this app so much. i was not someone who meditated or anything at all, i took a stress management class in college and we learned how to meditate. after that class, i felt i was having a hard time without any guided meditations, as i have ADD, and GAD, and have a hard time keeping my thoughts straight. i found this app, used the free version for a bit, and loved it so much that i decided to try the full version. i am currently on year two of using this app and i could not be more thankful for it. i have learned so much about myself. the ONLY thing i was thinking about today, was how cool, and probably impossible, it would be to be able to get it as an app on my Roku TV, and listen to my sleep stories and meditate through there. i‚Äôm sure apple TV has it, and i love listening to david attenborough on Our Planet, but it‚Äôd be awesome to be able to listen to the meditations on a TV!

author: Jjlee0126
title: One major flaw
content: I use this app for the sleep stories but i haven‚Äôt been using it lately because of one major flaw: they‚Äôre only around 30 minutes long with no option to create a playlist! If we‚Äôre using it for sleep then obviously the user has trouble falling asleep and how likely is it that you‚Äôre going to fall asleep within 30 minutes?! I‚Äôm starting to get anxious using this app because if a sleep story end then I know that 30 minutes has passed and I‚Äôm still not asleep. Then I have to go on my phone again and turn on another one. If I don‚Äôt fall asleep by the end of that one then that means that it‚Äôs been an hour of trying to sleep with no success. And on and on‚Ä¶I also get anxious because then it feel like a countdown (kind of like how if you really need sleep and you can‚Äôt you‚Äôre counting down how many hours of sleep you‚Äôll get if you fall asleep now, but with every passing hour you get more and more anxious that you‚Äôll be getting less and less sleep). I renewed my subscription for another year but I won‚Äôt renew again unless they fix this.

author: Lari Jones
title: More free options
content: I love the idea of the app but I can‚Äôt afford it. I have trouble falling asleep when my boyfriend is out of town so I was looking into the app and the sleep stories and calming noises sounded awesome but I personally can‚Äôt afford a yearly subscription for unlimited access. If there were even 5-10 options for every single thing, the app would probably have more downloads. Or, a monthly $2-$5 subscription rather than it‚Äôs all coming out at once. It would save $10 a year minimum. And up to almost $50 a year. The app might even make more money and be able to reach poor teens who can‚Äôt afford stuff like myself. I have one subscription (that isn‚Äôt a bill). I can afford 2 $75+ subscriptions a year. I just wish is was more available to a majority of teens and young people or even busy parents who can‚Äôt afford stuff for themselves. A cheaper option might be great. Or do a 30second add before each story to make money and the upgrade includes no ads. Just some ideas from a poor teen that can barely pay bills and eat spaghettios twice a week...

author: Girlygirl7777
title: Fantastic app!!!
content: I got this last Christmas Eve. Used it for a while... I decided to try it again before canceling my subscription. Reminded me how great the daily calm is. I love Tamara‚Äôs voice and it‚Äôs a wonderful way to start your day. And then I discovered the Master classes. Don‚Äôt know if I overlooked these when I first got the app or if it‚Äôs been added. Listened to Elizabeth Gilbert‚Äôs and was blown away. Just fantastic. Honestly either one of these is worth the price of admission. And to have both?! Plus other features I haven‚Äôt explored yet. Honestly I‚Äôm glad there is a subscription fee because it made me revisit this amazing tool. I am using it every day again and it really is making a positive impact on my mood and overall feeling of happiness. Worth every penny. If you are ready to be good to yourself give it a try. Thanks so much to everyone who created this app and is participating. You have my sincere gratitude and love

author: 65389t62437
title: Good app, I highly suggest!
content: I have always had trouble with anxiety and sometimes that affects my sleep. I normally listen to nature podcasts, or music before I go to bed. Calm is all of that and more, not to mention MUCH better quality. There is a good selection of white noise, nature sounds, music, piano, guitar, and songs, that are all great for falling asleep, or just for calming down. You can even have them play for as long as you want. There are meditations and breathing exercises that are worth listening to. There are also sleep stories that are good for kids that struggle falling asleep. This app is for all kinds of people, I think anyone would be able to find something on this app that helps them in one way or another. They even have sounds for babies and pets! It is so, so, easy to navigate and it has truly helped me have a peaceful nights sleep.

author: Claycab
title: Life Saver 4 Sure!!
content: As we all know, stress is a major contributing factor to many health related ailments. I love this app because it provides me with invaluable tools for managing and lowering my stress levels.  The Breathing exercises contained within were game changers for me.  Of course I‚Äôve known about breathing exercises before, but this was different.  Immediately while doing my first breathing exercise, my sustained breaths felt like I was chanting a mantra as they drew in and out of my body slowly; steadily; rhythmically.  Set to a chorus of Himalayan sounding bowls, one can still hear the gentle yet haunting tune long after the session is over. In fact, I can, in a moment of solitude, draw upon the soundtrack within my mind and have a breathing session anytime and anywhere I desire.  All thanks to Calm.  If you don‚Äôt already have the app, get it!  Your mind, body and soul will thank you for it.

author: MeldubCO
title: Changing my review‚Ä¶
content:
I formerly rated this app as a 5, and the app itself is great. I have been a subscriber for YEARS and up until now I‚Äôve been ok with the price increases because I use this app more than any other, HOWEVER now that they‚Äôve taken away family share, I will reconsider. I am not CALM about being charged more for less. Apparently leadership at Calm has lost sight of their original core values and succumbed to the ilk of Silicon Valley greed.  I will begin my review of other options and likely not renew. 

Sadly, here was my last review‚Ä¶

I‚Äôve been a Calm customer for several years and I love it! My Calm app is with me throughout the day. I start my day with the Daily Meditation (and days that I don‚Äôt, I find I‚Äôm not as positive and prepared to face challenges), I listen to the music options while I work, and often end my day with a Sleep Story. As an entrepreneur, working to get a start up business off the ground, its important for me to find ways to keep myself grounded, and some days, my Calm app is the only thing helping me do that.

author: thisismyentity
title: Great App, Suggestions?
content:
I love the scenery the ambience and the feel of the audio selections, especially through a speaker; because my phone speaker quality is a little lacking. The music is perfect to fall asleep to as well. I was meditating today using my favorite option, the timed meditation and afterwards had accidentally set a second as well, when it went off again I had an idea! What if you added a feature which allowed a loop? So that you could have an additional warning bell for those who meditate for hours at a time. I would personally really appreciate this option because I sometimes need an external reminder to come back to my body, 
(But it would be sad if this comes out as a feature only for Premium users because your monthly price is a little steep for me and I would really only use this feature)

author: sleepy amber
title: ‚ô° SUGGESTIONS ‚ô°
content:
‚Ä¢allow a que: when i fall asleep, it‚Äôd be nice to align a que to automatically go from a sleep meditation practice, to a sleep story, to music without having to exit my trance to open my phone and do it myself.
‚Ä¢add things to listen to during workouts: it would be awesome to have a breathing regimen to listen to with some upbeat simple background music. i would love to hear this calming voice guide me through breathing while i‚Äôm working out- maybe allow it to play over music we have playing in other apps if possible. simple upbeat ‚Äúelevator‚Äù music would even be great.

otherwise- this app grounds me, centers me, and makes me calm. i can actually appreciate the meditation programs, and don‚Äôt find them to be corny or tenuous. 100% worth the money for full access for a YEAR!! i love it, thank you creators for helping with my negative mindset. and i LOVE the voice, i hope you never change her!

author: cashinma
title: Way more helpful than expected - especially Masterclass
content:
I bought this because I‚Äôm terrible at meditation and mindfulness.  I needed something to keep me focused on my meditation.  

Initially, I struggled a bit with the voice of the person guiding the session, but once I got used to hearing her, it was much easier.  Other people and other stories and classes sounded different. 

I use the daily calm almost every day. the lessons in the meditation so often are reinforcing what I‚Äôm learning and hearing in another part of my life.  Very useful quotes at the end to remind me what the lesson was about.  Often I will screenshot the quote and picture and share it with friends.  

I love the variety of sounds I can select and how there is a visual with each.  

I recently listened to the Breaking Bad Habits addiction class and really felt as though I was at a seminar for psychologists and neuroscientists.  It was amazing what I learned.  I have a daughter who is a neuroscience and psych major in college. I had to share it with her.  

I‚Äôve also been stepping through the various meditations on self care, relationships, etc and those also have been enormously helpful.  

Sometimes my daughter can‚Äôt sleep so she listens to the stories on there.  I love that there are classics mixed in with new ones I had never heard of. 

Best $60 bucks I‚Äôve ever spent on an app like this.  Thank you, Calm.

author: ShortPotato_22
title: Where did the Journeys feature go???
content: I‚Äôve been a faithful Calm subscriber for years now- since before they even had the subscription feature available and it was mostly just background noises. Over the past month or so i‚Äôve absolutely loved the new ‚ÄúJourneys‚Äù feature they added, where you could pick a certain goal and complete activities like journal prompts, visualization stories, and check off tasks to level up and further positive habits. Suddenly, the entire feature disappeared. It‚Äôs just gone without any explanation. I was hoping the most recent update would bring it back but still nothing. I still use this app daily but i‚Äôm really disappointed because I very much enjoyed the addition of Journeys. I really hope it gets reinstated, but if not i‚Äôd at least like an answer as to why it‚Äôs now gone.

author: Stryder415
title: (Updated review)
content:
