I've been reading a lot about meditation but had been having trouble with actually doing it. Calm does an amazing job of guiding you in a constructive yet judgment free fashion. My only notes would be that it would be nice if they added more nature without water (such as a forest or mountains) and add some walking meditations. After completing the seven days of calm I subscribed and all the various options have been seriously helpful to me in my life.

I wrote the above years ago and still use calm to this day. I‚Äôve taken breaks here and there to use other apps when the content starts to repeat itself but other than that still love it. 

One feature I would love to see added at some point is being able to adjust the duration of more meditations. E.G. the daily meditations being able to be extended to 15-20 mins and so on.

author: laclagav
title: Review of Calm.
content:
Ok, many flaws and hard to navigate and very poor support. By the time one spends trying to figure out what‚Äôs going on, how to retrieve some part of program, you have spent tooooo much time on your device. This is suppose to be ? Calming.

Have received help on the glitches and now working well. I do like this app and it does help center oneself, calm oneself and with mindfulness accept one‚Äôs daily life with understanding. Continuing to work with this program. Thanks

I love the Calm App. Wished I had started mindfulness meditation years ago but happy I found it now. There are so many areas of this app that have helped me attain, I guess a better understanding of who I am and a loving kindness towards myself and others. It is not easy and many times difficult but this app has helped in my daily life, my attitude and judgements toward self and others. I thank you.

author: itsoktoday12
title: Are we helping people or hooking people?
content: ‚ÄúA resource to help people‚Äù that‚Äôs what I thought CALM was. And so, reluctant to seek emotional help because it‚Äôs such a personal issue, I turned to this app. And because I don‚Äôt have the means to purchase the app I have no access to their help. There is such a refreshing trend of prioritizing mental health in this age. But that‚Äôs half of the battle to actually helping people. I‚Äôm sure this app has good intentions but there will be no change in the epidemic of mental health issues so long as help is unattainable for ALL people who need it, not just those that can pay. If I had the means, I‚Äôd pay for a therapist. But those who lack the means to meet with someone are also left behind in such an accessible app that has such capability to make a difference. So my review: I feel very hungry for the help that this app offers and I feel truly left behind. I am sorry for the many others who I‚Äôm sure have come here searching for help, as I did, only to find help (once more) unattainable. Do we care about actually helping people? Or do we care only about hooking people?

author: jez.bookworm
title: Data and Graphics Heavy
content:
I purchased the premium app a few months ago and was able to use it a few times. The wi-fi at my house is satellite, so sometimes stories will not load or the app freezes. I had to get a new phone recently due to my old one getting hot, the screen dying, and eventually die altogether.

So, with my NEW phone, I download the app and within 2 minutes of it loading and scrolling through stories my phone feels super hot to touch. I paid for the year, so wanted to be able to use the app. Though, I don‚Äôt relish the idea of ruining  my phone in the process. I never noticed previously when my case was on the phone, but it hurt my hand how hot it became. So, can only imagine after running sounds or a story for a while what could happen over time. 

I love your UI, the content is great, the heavy load and CPU performance could certainly use work. I‚Äôd be equally happy with less fancy animations and graphics if it meant it was faster and didn‚Äôt run the risk of destroying my processor.

author: HoldingOut4Updates
title: Love it
content:
I love this app so much, and cannot begin to tell you how much it has helped me. An addition that I would love to see is the ability to go back to a daily calm that one has missed. I tend to meditate at night before bed, but if that doesn't happen before midnight, or I miss my 24hr window, I lose that Daily Calm. Then I feel terrible that I've missed it for that day. For example, yesterday's was about Practice... I'm a classical musician, and practice is a necessary evil, however I didn't get to meditate until it was too late, and it was no longer accessible. 

Also, why not make the daily calm a part of a larger accessible archive for subscribers, so that one may focus on a particular issue that needs work or focus, vs just a small selection of a few daily calms. For the steep cost of the subscription, that would really make me very very happy. Thank you for considering my ideas.

author: maipengwen
title: Thank you for making playlists a thing!
content: I was researching and trying out other meditation apps because calm did not have auto play, no way to create custom playlists, and constantly changing my meditation and worrying if I'd fall asleep before the meditation was over was severely disrupting my sleep. Their custom playlists that do auto play are only about 5 hours so if I did wake up in the middle of the night, chances are the playlist would be over and I'd have to look at my phone to start another meditation. I am BEYOND ecstatic that we can finally create playlists that auto play the meditations within them. Going forward I would love to see autoplay for the meditations within courses, masterclasses, everything - or at least the option to have auto play. I will likely be keeping my calm subscription, thank you!

author: Maddys mom 2
title: Suggestions
content:
I do love my Calm.  I don‚Äôt go to sleep without it.  I also use it when I take a nap.
But I would like to suggest when new ones are done that you leave out the word ‚Äúbed‚Äù.  There are many of us that sleep in a chair/recliner.  I haven‚Äôt slept in a bed in over 10 years and can‚Äôt because of arthritis in my spine.  I‚Äôve mentioned this to people and found so many people can‚Äôt sleep in bed for various reasons.  Many of your stories don‚Äôt use the word bed but still say things like snuggle under the covers and that works.
I don‚Äôt mean to be negative because I love your stories and I have my favorites and my favorite people to read them.  They are a blessing for those who have trouble sleeping like me.  Any time I wake in the night I put one on to help me back to sleep and it works.  It‚Äôs truly wonderful except for the word bed.
Thank you so much.

author: PGH51
title: One thing (and star) lacking
content:
I debated getting the subscription, but I am glad I did.  As a retiree, there is little that I am anxious about, but I am having trouble losing weight. I had hoped there would be more in this app to help me with that. There are 5 minute movement sessions that get me active in the morning, but I wish there were more to address the psychological aspects via meditation.

That said, I am finding more and more to appreciate in this app. I have an active brain that won‚Äôt often settle down when it should. The sleep stories are excellent for bedtime, with gentle voices, well-chosen words, and a length that are perfect to lull one into dreamland.

I believe this is an excellent app for emotional recovery from this pandemic and world events. So many people seem to have had problems adjusting to the isolation and sudden life-style changes. The frustration and anger might be eased with daily meditations as included here.

author: Moniiiiiiica
title: I NEVER WRITE REVIEWS BUT made sure to come and write a review on this one
content: This app has changed my life. Her voice is so incredibly soothing and beautiful, there‚Äôs different time settings 2 mins 5 mins 10 minutes. My life is so insanely stressful and hectic the only thing keeping me sane are her breathing techniques. What I also love is she doesn‚Äôt talk about wacko weird topics, she gives beautiful life messages that you can carry with you through he day. I clicked the increase focus and it REALLY helped me stop the distractions that we‚Äôre wasting my time. I‚Äôve had the app since Feb 9, today is March 3 and I have done over 4 hours of total meditation.  I want to keep this app forever and worth every single penny I recommend this for EVERYONE to improve the quality of their life and to be able to decrease some of their stress. My body is at ease every time I finish a session whether it be 2 Mins or 20 mins

author: Feathy7
title: Bloated, not the Calm I loved years ago
content:
Several years ago a therapist recommended Calm to me, as a person living with anxiety and mood disorders. I was skeptical but it changed my life, and helped me through a period of intense trauma.

However, the app has gotten bloated with content and absolutely unusable. It would be so simple to let users re-order meditations so their favorites are shown first, or select what is shown on the home screen and bottom buttons (for example, I never use music, but I loved the breathe bubble, which I have no choice but to keep hidden in the settings menu).

Without the option for customization, the app is counterproductive. I chose Calm over competitiors because of its soothing simplicity. Now it feels like I‚Äôm being controlled, and being sold someone else‚Äôs idea of ‚Äúmindfulness.‚Äù If your goal is to make mental health the new physical health or whatever your slogan is, try to remember the most important principle of mental health professionals everywhere: I, not you, am the expert on me. Your job is to work with me, not tell me what you think I need.

author: Linzimrg13
title: Great but one minor change...
content: This app is amazing and helps me fall asleep very quickly, the voices are amazing and so is the scenery, pictures and music this app gives. I use the sleep story a lot at night and I really think you guys should unlock premium stories for a couple days because I am so use to hearing ‚ÄúThe Waterfall,‚Äù ‚ÄúBlue and Gold,‚Äù and ‚ÄúThe Secret Lagoon.‚Äù I am 100% not saying they are bad stories because they are amazing. I just wish I could choose from different stories every once in a while instead of hearing the same stories over and over again each night. I also wanted to speak about the pricing, it is a little too over priced, mind you, I‚Äôm only 15 and there would be no way I could ever pay that price without a card of some sort. I overall love the app, from the start the story to finish, this is absolutely one of the best sleep story and meditation app I have ever downloaded. 4 Stars since the pricing and locked stories.

author: Mikayla629
title: Great app, but pricing is too much.
content: I absolutely love this app. I have OCD and constantly struggle with anxiety. I‚Äôve learned to deal with it better during the day, but at night, since I‚Äôm laying still, I have time to stop and think. Which turns into worrying and panic attacks. I usually take sleeping medicine for it, but then I started using the bedtime story part of the app, and it helped me to relax and fall asleep without having to take medication. Only thing is the pricing. I‚Äôm a college student and a part time nanny, and the pricing to unlock the full app is insane. I would love to continue to use the app since it‚Äôs helped me so much, but I only have to option of 3 stories to listen to, and it‚Äôs starting to drive me crazy I‚Äôve heard them so much. Even though I love this app, I‚Äôm not using it anymore, and will probably delete it. If they could lower their prices to where more people have the option to use the full app, I think it could really flourish.

author: SnkTab
title: Can‚Äôt Believe It‚Äôs Worth It
content:
Never before believed in meditation.  Downloaded Calm because I just wanted the nature sounds but ended up trying the 7 day free course.  Amazing.  Purchased a subscription right away.

I can‚Äôt believe that I need this app.  Expensive for my budget but it‚Äôs helped me so much on problems I never knew I had.  I‚Äôm a digitally addicted recent father and it helped me through the previously mind-numbing chore of taking care of a 1yo.  I was doing a good job but that didn‚Äôt mean I wasn‚Äôt screaming inside my head from boredom.  It helped me be present rather than distracted because apparently I‚Äôm distracted by everything.  Did not know this.  Helped me not get upset over stupid things at work.  Lessons my anxiety a little bit.  

Feature request, auto shut off.  I‚Äôve fallen asleep sometimes if at night and my phone died because app still running and my phone is my alarm.

author: App review psy 250
title: App Review Braxton.A
content: App Review (Calm App)- Braxton A. So, for the past week I have been using the clam app to reduce my anxiety. I liked the fact every time I went into the app that they asked how I was doing. Within this app they have many mediation options to calm anxiety. The first day there is a 3-minute mediation, the second day it is 5 minutes, the third day it is 10 minutes, and the time increases by 5 every day until on the seventh day the time is 30 minutes. This app is a good app to treat generalized anxiety disorder. Generalized anxiety disorder is an excessive form of anxiety and can be followed by uncountable physical symptoms like muscle tension, restlessness being easily fatigued, difficulty concentrating, etc. This app is a great way to reduce anxiety because the mediation that occurs throughout the seven days helped me feel more relaxed and I did not have as much tension as I normally do.

author: @stevenhi11
title: Amazing.
content:
In 2017 I started feeling guided to meditate for the first time. I sat down on the floor & started a 20 minute session. Let‚Äôs just say I didn‚Äôt even make it to 4 minutes. It felt like forever. I felt lost when it came to meditation. But eventually I came across the Calm app. 

I did the free meditations & loved them. But I also wanted to do just my own meditations. Just focusing on my breathing. So I started with one minute, then the next day two minutes, then the next three, then four, then five. & kept building up each day until I got to fifteen minutes & that‚Äôs how long I meditate now. 

The Calm app‚Äôs timer is so soothing. It‚Äôs not loud. It doesn‚Äôt make me jump when I hear it (I have anxiety). It‚Äôs perfect. 

In February of 2019 I decided that I was going to do a 30 day meditation challenge (15 mins per day). & being able to see my ‚Äústreak‚Äù encouraged me so much. I did it! Which was so huge for me. 

But now I‚Äôm here in August & I‚Äôm currently on a 30 challenge but I want to go further. I want to go all the way until Jan. 1st, 2020 & then start building up to 30 minutes a day. 

I do not use be Calm subscriptions as I just do not have the money for it right now. But the free things that Calm offers? Incredible. 

Thank you, Calm, for your app! Also thank you for responding when I tag you in my insta stories! 

5 stars. Amazing. Thank you!

author: alex212
title: Well worth it
content:
As someone that suffers from depression and anxiety, this app has worked wonders for me. I‚Äôd never given serious consideration to meditation, I always had it on my to do list, occasionally trying on my own for a few minutes.

This app changed all that. After the first 12 minute meditation/lesson in anxiety at the end of a hectic and stressful day, the negative feelings melted right away. It also has soothing music for sleeping for when I‚Äôm suffering from insomnia, or even bedtime stories. Which makes me feel 6 years old saying, but feeling 6 for a little before bed is surprisingly awesome!

It is pricey for an app subscription at $60 a year... but in my humble opinion, it‚Äôs well worth it if you suffer from anxiety like myself. That‚Äôs only $5 a month for some piece of mind. Have one less beer a month or save some other way, because this will be some of the best $60 you ever spent.

author: Firefox9675
title: Love the sleep stories- Updated
content:
Still love the app but wish they would add more sleep stories. Not meditations, not sleep music, but sleep stories. That is what helps me the most. I've emailed them twice to request more stories. The response has been that stories are added every week. But this is not true. It rotates between additions of sleep music, meditations and stories. So in truth, about one to two a month are added. 
If you have as big a problem as I do sleeping then the repitition of the same stories over and over becomes less effective. 
I've looked everywhere else for more stories but Calm is still the best for stories. I just wish they focused as much on the stories as they do on meditation. 

I have serious trouble sleeping, and the Calm sleep stories are a big help for me. I can listen to them and focus on the reader and my mind won't wander off like it always does to a million other things. Before I know it I'm asleepüòä

author: Bomgaroto
title: Benefits of daily practice
content: It‚Äôs about one year I began practicing daily meditation with Tamara Levitt here at Calm. My practice has been enjoyable and meaningful. I‚Äôve learned that this little time I spend here enables me to connect with myself in ways I never imagined, bringing me peace of mind and a mindfulness that serves me throughout the day. Also, being a guided practice, the guide is soft, pleasant and trustworthy. I reflect time and time again throughout my day on the topic and what it makes me feel, adjusting as possible. I appreciate this time because I am transcending my beliefs and am feeling better each time noticeably. Thank you for being my guide. Knowing that I can tap into the resources over the day with Jay, Jeff, and still have a little movement with May enriches my tranquility for when I feel I want to go there. I love you for the practice imparted on me. Happy Monday!

content: OK, I‚Äôve been through a lot today like I got into a lot of trouble so I am thanking you for making me calmer OK so sometimes I get meltdowns and then I just wanna use this app to say was that I having trouble falling asleep I use this I use this technique. author: SS. Walker
title: The Little Details
content:
The little details of Calm really make the app great. Those little notifications that pop up after a meditation, the encouragement that appears after any practice, the beautiful weekly emails, the AWESOME quality of the app all make Calm great. And that‚Äôs just the app I‚Äôm talking about so far.

The meditations themselves are beautiful. They‚Äôre patient, they‚Äôre calming and reassuring. Those little words and phrases of encouragement and patience the meditation teachers use make a huge impact. The multiple daily meditations that are available cover a multitude of topics for the exact feelings and emotions you‚Äôre experiencing. There‚Äôs always a practice that will hit the spot, no matter what you‚Äôre going through. Breakup, stress, anxiety, anger and even happiness! There‚Äôs always a mediation that will guide you through whatever you‚Äôre going through.

author: Ty1..4
title: Disappointed
content: I‚Äôve never written a review in my life, probably because I‚Äôve never been so disappointed about a product that I love so much (should be loved). It‚Äôs been a week plus since the latest update came out, that‚Äôs ample time to fix or go back one update to where a higher volume of your customers had access. Yes, in the past there was the occasional issue (once a month, if that), but nothing like this where the screen is stuck on ‚Äútake a deep breath.‚Äù I like so many have been a subscriber for several years and have used Calm religiously every night (it allowed to get off of sleep-aid medication), but now I am having to find other means to fall asleep. If you don‚Äôt hurry up and fix the app, you may be losing another longtime customer who has praised you and promoted you several times over!!

author: LMMmanatee
title: Best app ever!!!
content: Calm is such an incredible app. There is always something new to explore and all the features are really cool. The simple and East to use format is perfect for people with anxiety who get overwhelmed. Even though there are tons of choices, Calm makes it easy to narrow down the choices and help you find exactly what you are looking for. Calm customizes your recommendations based on how you are feeling that day and what you want to get out of the app. It has stuff for the whole family including a kids section.  You do have to pay $70 a year for premium, however that‚Äôs only a little less than $6 per month. My family compared it to being less than Netflix. The price is totally worth it for all the features it comes with. I would definitely recommend  this app to anyone with anxiety or anyone who just needs to make time in their day for mindfulness.

author: Des Nocturnaire
title: Are you kidding me???
content: I have been using this app to fall asleep when I need a reliable source of comforting white noise for a few years now. It‚Äôs not something that I use all the time but it‚Äôs something I come back to on those occasions when I can‚Äôt sleep. Recently, when I needed my song that helps me fall asleep every once in a while, I went into the app to find it LOCKED for the first time EVER. When I clicked on it to try and play the song, (water falling by Kip Mazuy in ‚Äúnature melodies‚Äù) a pop up comes up talking about a 7 day free trial and then a monthly payment after that. Unacceptable. You can‚Äôt just take something that has been free for years and then all of a sudden make it into a paid service. I know it‚Äôs a small issue but I am livid about this. I literally cannot believe this. You have taken my only reliable song that puts me to sleep when melatonin won‚Äôt do the trick. I don‚Äôt know what I‚Äôm supposed to do now when I can‚Äôt sleep and need to. You people behind the app probably don‚Äôt care though. Obviously all you care about is your GD money.

author: Musiqdeep
title: A few words of gratitude from an OG member.
content:
I‚Äôve been a member off and on from the very beginning. I‚Äôve seen calm take this massive transformation from humble beginnings to a complex yet simple and incredibly thought-out app. I‚Äôve always advocated for this app because I love all the changes it has made to itself over the years. I‚Äôm grateful for the people who made this app be the best meditation app ever. I‚Äôm very grateful this app exists, for it has been a massive addition to the betterment of my life, it not only has taught me to meditate, but it has taught me so many life lessons and skills. It is not only a learning tool to life but also an entertaining one as well, from meditations, to life classes, to stories and music this app is perfectly done and worth it value ten fold. If y‚Äôall download it, I hope explore it like I have.
Massive special thanks to you Tamara!

author: supernova_pwr_kat
title: Life Changing
content: Who knew an app could be a life changer for me. I practice my daily calm in the mornings before anything else. The act of meditation has had a profound effect on me so much so that people have asked what I‚Äôve changed. I am less reactive, more thoughtful, and kinder to myself. I appreciate the new additions to the app in the daily section, I love the sleep stories, sound scapes and guided the meditations are wonderful. One thing I would love to see brought to the platform are more options for advancing my meditation practice- something like a little less guidance and longer than 10-12 minutes. Something else that would be amazing is if the app would interface with Alexa so I didn‚Äôt have to have my phone next to me all night. Even with my requests, I give it five stars. Thank you for guiding me towards awareness and inner peace.

author: J-Nepomuceno
title: thank you Kaiser
content:
I get premium content through Kaiser insurance (which has been the best part of their mental health services, but that‚Äôs a different review....). 

I am so incredibly grateful for it because I‚Äôve been using it for the past two months and it took me out a depressive episode. 

Jeff Warren‚Äôs content keeps me around. It‚Äôs because of his 30 day course that I‚Äôve finally established a meditation practice after years of sincere attempts. His approach is very human and relatable; I find sessions with his recordings much more fruitful since he sandwiches the nuggets of clarity between quiet moments. I‚Äôm able to ease into the session, instead of being urged into quietness then being lectured by Tamara..maybe that works for other people but it‚Äôs inaccessible to me. 

I also use the children‚Äôs meditations with my five year old daughter and the sleep stories when she‚Äôs having a hard time sleeping. I‚Äôm glad to share this experience and skill with her. I was fortunate to have an elementary school teacher show me how powerful meditation and journaling was at an early age, but didn‚Äôt have a way to reintroduce it into my adult life AND share it with my daughter till now. 

I used Insight Timer for awhile but was overwhelmed by the features and endless options. I like that this is more curated and it‚Äôs lucky Jeff Warren‚Äôs content is so appealing to me.

author: Cat (scientist)
title: Poor support
content:
I believe this is a great APP except that they‚Äôve make no effort to respond to 3 concerns in emails via their support tickets 

The first one that I made some time ago was that I found it extremely difficult in the middle of the night to see the icons or read anything without glasses. I asked if they could make them little bit larger for  those of us who cannot see well at night without reading glasses. They never responded, in fact with in a few weeks they made the reading icons even more difficult to read.

Being a neuroscientist I recommended this app to my patients. Many of them complained of this difficulty and so I once again wrote a support ticket. They Never responded.
They also changed the voice of the Female narrator for the meditations and put a background noise which is constant. This may be easy for some people to hear her voice without difficulty But I find it impossible. Background sound rushing water perhaps like Niagara Falls. Very difficult to concentrate and hear her voice clearly.  I am a 20+ year veteran meditator and find this new sound agitating 
I explained it was difficult and asked if they would turn the volume down. The Never responded and made no change.

An App is only as good as the support. Which seems to be absent.  Too bad it is otherwise a good idea.

author: Lady Perseverance
title: Simply Put- Awesome Experience
content:
I‚Äôve been using Calm for about 2 years. It beats all other apps in this category no doubt. 
I am a person that suffers from chronic generalized anxiety along with depression. The anxiety can be crippling at times. Of  course I take meds so I can function, however no more taking a pill to fall asleep (and stay asleep)! That is a priceless asset that means so much to me. There are also times through the day when I use one of the many tools offered by Calm to lower my stress & anxiety level so that I can focus.
I love this app!!! The sleep meditations & stories allow me to drift off & I am having less nightmares. For the app developers, narrators & writers (and everyone responsible for making Calm what it is) - Thank you so very much. I appreciate the positive changes in my life that you all have made possible with your creativity & skills.

author: Darkly Goth
title: Excellent Mental Health App
content: I received a year‚Äôs subscription to Calm nearly 2 years ago, & am still enjoying the app. It became an oasis of serenity in a tumultuous world. There is a good selection of meditations, sleep stories, music, & more. The sleep stories work wonders! If I had one complaint, it would be that the selection of different people leading the meditations has declined. While I very much enjoy Tamara, I did appreciate the number of choices you offered in the past. One last note, it‚Äôs difficult to judge an app by comments of those who only use the free offerings of a paid app. Of course your choices will be limited. In order to pay to produce all the content & bring in more voices, they have to charge a fee. All the other good meditation apps do it as well. It‚Äôs just a fact that not everything on the internet can be free.

author: Iwanthintsdamnit
title: Life Changing
content: I was very skeptical about meditation before I actually started meditating. After trying everything I possibly could including exercising three hours straight like a maniac after work to try to manage my stress, I was recommended this app for guided meditation. I thought, why not give it a try? I am very grateful I did because meditation has been life changing in the way I view myself and the world. I‚Äôve managed my stress much better and I now handle difficult situations in a more calm and coherent manner. It helped me grow and adapt as a person. There are so many great features within this app that I also love like breathing exercises and stories from successful people on their journey.  Whether you are struggling or not, I think this app would be beneficial and helpful in your life and I highly recommend it.

author: DFoxinGA
title: Disappointed that the price was not clearly stated at time of download..
content:
I have horrible sleep problems. I worked nights for a while and have always been a ‚Äúnight owl.‚Äù However, I have just moved in with my 94 yo grandfather and he feels put out if I‚Äôm up late and sleep in.( I am medically retired). 
I‚Äôve seen your ads and decided to try the app. When I pulled it up, there was NO PRICE ADVERTISED AT THE POINT OF DOWNLOAD. However there was a NOTATION that said ‚ÄúIn app purchases.‚Äù Which is extremely misleading!! 
And when you‚Äôre taken to the sign up page, it gives you a date to cancel prior to being charged, however doesn‚Äôt specify HOW to cancel at the point of sale. This would also be helpful so the customer can record that info in order to make a cancellation easier, if that‚Äôs what they choose to do.  
I would love to try the app but I don‚Äôt want to be in a position where I have to search for a way to cancel before being charged. Also, it states that I can cancel at any time. Does that mean that I will receive a prorated refund for the time that I don‚Äôt use??

author: Harmony&Hope
title: Amazing! No regrets for the money spent
content: I use it daily now, though I did not at first.  At first I got it to start the practice of meditating but like most habits I want to establish, I quickly lost my stride and pretty much gave up. But because I often listened to the bedtime stories and used its "Scenes" for white noise to get work done, the app stayed on my radar and kept encouraging me. Eventually I tried the meditation part again, permitting myself to do it while lying down, right before falling asleep, (not the 'right' way). This training wheels method worked for me. Now I do the Daily Calm every morning and another meditation before bed (both sitting upright in a relaxed but alert position). Best of all, when I sense my stress levels rise during the day, I can focus on the breath and return a bit easier to a sense of calm. Much thanks to Tamara Levitt and all at Calm. üôè

author: thedollchanel
title: Definitely Taken Advantage Of
content: I downloaded this app because I felt it would help me sleep better at night and avoid my everlasting thoughts. The first night using the app was cool. I have only used it twice since downloading it. Today, I check my mail and it says it was renewed for $84 for a year!!! I know in my mind that I don‚Äôt select the subscription for $79. Who has that kind of money to spend on an app? Especially during an pandemic. People are out of work & can definitely use $84 for food & survival items. I think I was well taken advantage of because it was automatically set for 1 year subscription. Instead of asking if I would like to subscribe for another week, 1 month or 2 months, it was automatically set for one year. This app shows they‚Äôre just for the money. You can tell from the limited stories and soundscapes that they have. For $80 I should have more than just 12 soundscapes to help with my sleep. So now i'm forced to use the app for a year with limited soundscapes and honestly I didn‚Äôt even care for the app.

author: wccb14
title: found calm and sleep!!!
content: I never write reviews, but I have to share my positive experience and how life changing this app is. I was having issues with sleeping, which I have never encountered before. I would be exhausted and fall asleep at 7pm and wake up at 330am, unable to fall back to sleep. I went to the doctor for blood tests to see if i had any other physical issues that may be triggering the change in my sleep pattern and all tests came back negative. My doctor recommended to practice better sleep hygiene. I started using this app in the morning to meditate (10 min) and then use the sleep induced relaxation before bed. For 2 weeks now I have been able to get a full night sleep and feel more calm during the day. It takes practice and a willing to change, but this is the tool to use if you are ready and willing and want more calm and sleep in your daily life!

author: EGWagner
title: ‚ù§Ô∏è
content:
This app is so helpful. Really am glad to have found it! I am only on day 4 of this, but greatly appreciate the effect this is having on my inner-self. There's been just so much noise, incessant inputs from our noisy and screen-driven culture. Taking time to find, and cultivate a quiet serene inner space is priceless. 4 months later-I am still enjoying this wonderful collection of meditations, and practitioners. I would more than recommend this app, I would say it is essential equipment for life. 6 months later. Do yourself a favor and get this wonderful app, invest some time into the miracle that your life really is. Connect with the source of your power and be refreshed. Namaste. üôè
September 2024 update: Still enjoying this app. It has powerful tools to help manage the inner space and the exterior world‚Äôs barrage of challenges. May God bless you, namaste.

author: sempervirens117
title: Sonic therapy for improved mental health focus and wellness
content: The Calm app is revolutionary. It combines a range of real human voices and storytelling techniques with cutting edge sonic therapy using music and incredibly immersive ambient soundscapes that truly shine when you pair them with good noise canceling headphones by Bose or similar brands. I was diagnosed with Level 1 bipolar disorder as an adult and needed very expensive medical care that fortunately was largely covered by my wonderful health care provider, Kaiser Permanente- who also provided me access to the Calm app. Since listening regularly to morning meditations by Tamara Levitt and her colleagues, along with outdoor exercise, a ketogenic diet, and limited medication, my mental clarity not only has returned to ‚Äúnormal‚Äù but actually has become optimized to a state I never experienced before. It‚Äôs like that great Bradley Cooper movie, Limitless. Except it‚Äôs better because this is real.

author: NaiNaiJean
title: Essential
content:
I don‚Äôt know what I would do without this app. After years of working night shift, I need all the help I can get with sleep, and this app has been essential to my sleep hygiene. I preferred the old view/functionality (now it‚Äôs harder to see my favorites and they fall off my list after a while,) but it‚Äôs doable.

Update: I am so frustrated with the changes they‚Äôve made with this app, particularly because it seems designed to encourage just the right amount of insomnia to keep you needing it. For example, now when I wake up in the middle of the night and I open the app, hoping to limit my exposure to the phone and go back to sleep, I get a pop up asking me to rate the app. I have also found over time that I‚Äôm doing a lot of toggling between different areas of the app to get where I want to be. This is counterproductive for sleep, but very effective if the goal is to increase interaction with the app. Needs a lot of work.

author: Halfmagic3
title: Love ‚ù§Ô∏è
content:
I have been using Calm for over a year now and although I have fallen off the wagon a few times, I always gravitate back. It‚Äôs so helpful and sincerely helps guide you to a better state, so peacefully! Tamara is amazing and so soothing. She is like this little angle on your shoulder telling you it‚Äôs ok to just be, to find acceptance in everything. 

I have always been hesitant to start a meditation practice. Seemed so yuppie! But it really isn‚Äôt, it‚Äôs so much more than just sitting in silence and chanting to yourself or needing to be like a monk! It‚Äôs a short moment to practice awareness/mindfulness and learn to be present. To help guide you back to what is important in life. In the busyness of our current world, this app is genuinely ‚Äúthe calm within the storm.‚Äù It teaches better emotional intelligence as well. Struggling with PTSD and seeing many therapists that had good intentions but never really helped, I knew I had to ignite the change from within. This app along with Gratitude 365 did just that for me! It works! 

The Master Classes are also a favorite of mine; I wish they would post more! But I adore listening to the podcast like lessons; so helpful! 

I can‚Äôt recommend this app enough! It is worth every penny and then some! Better than a copay for a therapist! Do yourself a favor and commit to it and I promise you won‚Äôt be disappointed!

author: Dodging Raindrops
title: Thank you for allowing custom playlists!!
content: I asked if you all could update the software for making custom playlists and you did!!! The sleep stories are pretty helpful at night for me. By making my own playlist, I can put on my all favorite sleep stories for the whole time in bed on nights when I‚Äôm having trouble sleeping. I keep it on low volume- just enough to hear if I‚Äôm awake/ paying attention. If I wake up after dosing off, I can refocus on whatever story is playing which puts me right back to sleep. This is a really helpful feature. And Bhavnisha Parmar has the voice of an angle. Also, I‚Äôm a long time meditator. The Jeff Warren 10 min daily mediations are so helpful, especially on the days where I feel my mediation practice is lacking. I‚Äôll listen to those at the start of my 45 min sitting meditation.

author: woodie1
title: A calmer sleep
content: My wife and I have listened to CALM for well over 2 years. Cannot express how easy it is to fall asleep listening to this app. When she first started the app at night my thought was ‚ÄúYeah right‚Äù I‚Äôm going to listen to silly music and drift into dream land. After the first week I was sold. There are many Calm stories we have started off in listening in bed and sometimes takes several tries to stay awake to hear the end of it. Our recent story is with Keith Morrison that took 4 times to get to the end. The storyline is about Goldie Locks and how portage goes missing and a bed is slept in - this is a story where I wanted to laugh many times during his reading yet I didn‚Äôt want to wake up my wife. This is one of my favorite stories to date. He applies his investigation methods to the story as he does on Dateline - this is great!

author: Laurabeth46
title: Amazing but one suggestion
content: Amazing app. I use sleep stories every single night and my toddler uses the kids sleep stories at nap time. It‚Äôs so relaxing! I am actually excited to jump into bed at night because I get to listen to a story! I also use the ten minute daily calm meditations all the time! There is so much value in this one app- sleep stories, daily journaling, meditation, breathing exercises, and more! My one suggestion is to add more emotions to the daily check-ins. Most of the time I‚Äôm feeling an emotion and it‚Äôs not one of the choices. So I just have to pick one and make it work. For example, there‚Äôs no ‚Äúfrustrated,‚Äù ‚Äúguilty,‚Äù ‚Äúoverwhelmed,‚Äù ‚Äúsurprised,‚Äù ‚Äúshocked,‚Äù or ‚Äúcurious,‚Äù etc. I wish there were more emotion choices to better describe how I‚Äôm feeling. Otherwise, everything else is perfect! I love this app and I tell everyone I can about it. I would gladly pay $100/year for this app.

author: VMorek
title: Terrible support
content:
I have had this subscription for 2 years.  We use it daily.  My kids love the sleep stories and the soundscapes for white noise.  I use the soundscapes every day too. 
But beware!  My credit card # was stolen and when it tried to auto renew, it couldn‚Äôt.  I had to go and do it with the new card number.  I have the charge that has cleared my card and I can access on my phone, but content is locked on both iPads.  You can‚Äôt call, you can only email.  Got a generic and unhelpful response but I followed instructions.  Content still locked.  Emailed again, generic response about how to renew.  Not helpful.  Deleted app and reinstalled, logged out and back in.  Content still locked.  I emailed again and asked for someone to call.  Got a message that they don‚Äôt have call support - only email. I dismally had to dispute the charge on my card when I couldn‚Äôt get any help after days of trying. 
Come on Calm.  Your app is too good for you to have such low rate, crappy support.

author: sophiapoo420
title: Calm yourself and Calm your soul.
content: I absolutely love, needed and highly recommend this app! Whether it's for small daily breathing exercises, soothing sounds for bedtime or meditation, this app helps guide you along a path of self recovery and starts the moment you click download. I have to say it has helped me with daily living. The bedtime stories and soothing sounds alone sold me but I love the daily calm meditations. I have been healing daily and recommend everyone try it. My daughter loves it to help her sleep and the guided meditation. She now is a very enlightened, leveled out ten year old and the meditation helps now with her hormonal and menstrual transition.  I have to say everyone can benefit highly from it. The free demo is great to get your feet started and see how it helps before if you feel some doubt, but I doubt you will have any after you try it! Your soul will thank you! Calm yourself and Calm your soul.

author: Liz84266
title: Life changing
content: I suffer from PTSD and nights are the worst, especially if it‚Äôs been a rough day.  My mind brings up trauma, worries and my anxiety gets my heart racing.  I used to end up putting on a podcast which helps but I stay awake to listen to the information.  I love this app bc there‚Äôs many options and genres of things to listen too, they all have calming voices and is interesting enough to keep my mind occupied but not keep me awake.  Then when I wake from a nightmare, I immediately push the start over button and I am usually able to get back to sleep before the anxiety wakes me up.  I like to listen to the master classes over and over again.  I change the actual topic every month or so but I find comfort in routine.  And I LOVE to learn!  Plus I can download my favs so I can still use it when I have no internet.

author: ac962000
title: Horrible and Misleading App
content: I don‚Äôt usual leave reviews on apps but this one I couldn‚Äôt help. I need something to distract my mind and help me fall asleep or else I‚Äôm thinking about the day and things going on. Looking through the App Store I noticed this app had been downloaded in the past and I did not remember why it was deleted from my phone. Downloaded again and I remember why I deleted it‚Ä¶for a ‚Äúfree‚Äù app there is nothing free in the app itself. If you want to play anything you have to buy a subscription of 70$ a year. I don‚Äôt think it should even be labeled free in the App Store if you can‚Äôt even use it in the slightest. I was given the impression that even if there are in app purchases they at least have a lot of unlocked things to play, and then you pay more if it really benefits you and you‚Äôre interested in all the other things. That is usually how apps labeled free work. I would like to have a peaceful night sleep but I need to find something else. I don‚Äôt think I should have to pay so much just so I can sleep a little better.

author: Tanya from Pittsburgh, Pa.
title: Works wonderfully!üí§üåô
content:
I have been using this app a little ver two years, and I love it! I use it for nights when I can‚Äôt fall asleep. I mean, who doesn‚Äôt have good memories of story time at night , being read a story by mom or dad, and falling asleep while they were reading?!üíï
Also if I wake up to use the restroom, and can‚Äôt fall back to sleep I use it again!  Al l 
Stories have a time on them, and iPhone shuts off when story is over. I also use the music app to! More recently, I have tried the soundscapes. My favorite is the light rain at night. You can even hear a few crickets and night creatures, very relaxing.
I live in the city, and two doors down from me, they are building a home. I discovered that by put this soundscape on high volume, it blocks out the noises of the cat, and the hammering.   I just love this app!

author: QuietYogi
title: The opposite of what a stress reduction app should be
content:
It seems that the creators of calm made every effort to complicate the use of the app to a point that they succeeded to increase my level of stress. They do not understand that an app should be simple, intuitive and uncomplicated . Everything seems counter- intuitive . Where do you stop the sound within the app . Til now I could not find how to stop the sound unless I quit the app .  
The app does not recognize that I paid for my subscription and keep on trying to sell me the product. It does not know  that  I am good to go and can use it . No , no no no , how can they figure out a way to torture you so they  will not let you get away that easy. You have to use a number of steps supposedly giving you choices , but they miss the point of simplifying its operation and   for me they succeeded to create a new level of stress I did not had before using the app. 
So for now, this app is a a good source of frustration and agitation . I hope the developers read these reviews and do something about it.

author: REM0714
title: Amazing!
content: I‚Äôve had the free trial for 2 days now, and as a person who has clinically suffered from anxiety and depression most of my life, I already feel so grounded and balanced. Amidst the COVID-19 crisis & being in the epicenter of it all, I‚Äôve never experienced as much physical and mental relief as I have these past couple of days, simply by listening to the guided meditations, playing the soothing nature sounds while I quickly grocery shop, or falling asleep to the stories.  I would LOVE and HOPE to see more options available to us. I turn to this app any time I feel the need for balance and restoration of inner peace, and believe many of us can benefit from what is has to offer, especially right now. Thank you Calm for restoring my calm üôèüèΩ I hope to see some efforts from your successful company to help make this more widely available.

author: SDColorado
title: Incredibly impactful
content: I downloaded this app a few weeks ago during a particularly stressful stretch at work, and I have done at least one meditation every day since.  After working my way through all of the free meditations (a huge variety based on your needs - anxiety, focus, self esteem, etc.), this had become a part of my daily routine, so I went for the subscription.  And WOW, it‚Äôs so much more than just meditation - the daily calm each morning, the sleep stories before bed (so cozy, and come on, who doesn‚Äôt want Matthew McConaughey to read you a bedtime story??), the guided stretches, the breathing...all of it is so well thought out and relaxing.  It helps so much with stress from life and work, and has really improved my overall quality of life.  Definitely recommend, especially for those with stressful jobs or anxiety looking to improve their wellbeing.

author: jlstmtns
title: Life changing
content: Best investment in my health I‚Äôve ever made. I am growing with Calm as it continues to evolve expanding its offerings for short guided meditations from morning . Jeff‚Äôs daily trip and Jays wisdom. After years I am using this in my life and starting to live my life from a conscious rather than default to the fears. Ego etc. and I can truly now say thanks to Calm I have a practice and feel calm more of the time. So impressed im going to try the yoga. Best of all through Dr Lopez‚Äôs practices to relate differently with migraines I am having significant improvement. This for me is a solution. To live differently. I can‚Äôt say enough of how I appreciate the calm team. I came here for help with sleep through the fabulous sleep stories. And can happily say as much as I love the train rides. I am loving my own journey even more now. Be well many blessings of peace and love

author: Jmajor3
title: New Year, New Me at its finest!
content: Wow! Just wow I have never written an app review but this app is amazing! If you like soothing things like candles and mood lighting you‚Äôll love this!  I‚Äôve had it for 6 days and I‚Äôve used it for 6 days straight! ( the app likes to make you feel good about this and hey I love it!) I am not the type that can typically stick to something for more than a day or two but this app is something that makes you want to come back for more! The sleep stories are amazing and made me have vivid expressive dreams (of fields with lavender because of the lavender story of course!) The music portion is perfect for trying to focus in the office! And the guided meditation for beginners, is something I know will have transformative power over my life! There is a reason Jeff Bezos and Elon Musk meditate, it‚Äôs very effective! Overall download this app and pay full price for it, ya worth every penny!!

author: marciaontrack
title: Happily addicted to these short powerful meditations
content:
As soon as I experienced the mind - body connection 
These short guided meditations create , I became addicted!
Now I have to have my meditation time upon awakening in the AM with Tamara‚Äôs ‚ÄúDaily Calm‚Äù and in the evening with ‚ÄúDeep Sleep Release‚Äù.  In between or when I just want more of what is offered , I go for it and am rarely disappointed.  Tamara is so present it is like having your own personal ‚Äúmindfulness‚Äù Trainer right beside you with full attention on your betterment. I have practiced qigong for years and this is a wonderful quick pick me up selection of meditations when I‚Äôm too lazy to do a more physical meditation.  PLUS,  Tamara really helps you understand why you focus on the breath more than I have learned from others. I also love her tasteful selection of quotes and allegories to take into my day. 

  I‚Äôm a creative person and I think Tamara particularly understands the energy of creative people and resonates with that energy more than other guided meditation facilitators I have tried. 
  Thank you so much Tamara for having created a meaningful, healing  app to help us all be more mindful and connected to ourselves in a world that is filled with distractions constantly pulling us away from our ability to be centered and connected and mindful throughout the day.

author: emr313
title: Amazing app No professionalism
content:
I really love this app. I am a combat veteran who suffers from chronic depression and meditating has really helped me deal with my anger, anxiety and depression. This app has been a big party of my recovery process however, twice now I have been in the middle of a session and the app has locked on me saying I need to upgrade to their yearly subscription. 

This has not been a suggestion the app would not let me access my current meditation sessions and unfortunately in both occasions it has happened when I was at very desperate moment. 

I think it is extremely unprofessional for this service to lock me out of my account when I paying for a service only because you want me to upgrade. In fact I‚Äôm positive it‚Äôs an infringement of a our contract. I will be contacting the app company to further inquire.

author: Zephyr33
title: Alive and growing
content:
I was fortunate enough to find Calm sometime between 2018 and 2020. I don‚Äôt remember which but those were my years of trauma, feelings of loss, and loneliness. At first I used the Calm meditations every day, especially at night to help me sleep and get back to sleep after waking with anxiety in the middle of the night.  
Part of what‚Äôs great about Calm is that it‚Äôs not a stagnant app. There is new content every day and that makes feel that there are others there always thinking, feeling, and working to help.  I guess you could call it a living app. Anyhow, at the times I needed it, the meditations and breathing helped me feel less alone and got me through those few years. 
Now, I‚Äôll sometimes use one of the sleep stories to distract my mind when I‚Äôm thinking too much. I usually fall asleep long before the story ends no matter how interesting it is to me.  Darn! How did that story end? The next night I fast forward to the last I remember of it. Often that‚Äôs less than 5 minutes into the 30 minute story! One story can last me a few nights. LOL.  
Another that I like to use is the 15 minute Ocean soundscape to relax me and lull me to sleep. 
There is so much more in the Calm app that I enjoy, and it keeps growing. 
Thank you, Calm!

author: Bbllttzz
title: Recently upped to lifetime
content:
I am enjoying this app so much. It really helps me focus on the breath and not on things which cause anxiety and stress. I also love the sleep stories. Works so well that I have never heard the end of a story. I had rated it 4.5 because I was struggling with the cost and whether or not to pay for the full version. Since then I have decided that the benefits were worth the cost and paying the one time fee helped me not dwell on the cost every month. I have recommended it to many friends. 
   (I wrote this review a while ago and it still holds true. The only addition I would make is that to newcomers it may be a bit tricky to navigate the site and find exactly what you‚Äôre looking for, but they continue to make improvements and the improvements have been helpful.)

author: Sodaman32
title: Changed my life
content: This app has changed my life for the better. I knew nothing about mindfulness or meditation before this app. I mainly got the app for the sleep stories because I have issues sleeping at night and listening to audiobooks was helping. Only the type of audiobook would influence my sleep, so if it was scary or intense I‚Äôd have nightmares. I slept peacefully with the calm sleep stories. I had the app 2 years before I started using the meditation aspect of it. I can‚Äôt believe it took me so long! Jeff Warren is AMAZING!!! He guides you through meditation in a welcoming and relaxing way. I can‚Äôt imagine my life without him or meditation anymore. It‚Äôs made my life so much less stressful. The wisdom and guidance in the Daily Jay sessions is such a positive way to start the day. I know it‚Äôs pricy but get the app. Your mental health is worth it!!

author: Preston Taylor
title: Entire App Feels Like an Advertisement
content:
Most apps allow you to enroll in a series of related guided meditations without the friction to resume the series and pick up where you left off.  This app adds so much friction to my daily use. When I have 15 minutes to meditate, I don‚Äôt want to navigate through numerous menus to find the mediation series I was using. In the calm app‚Äîand the web interface too for that matter‚ÄîI have navigate past new meditations and a lot of other noise before I can find the meditation series I want to use, or the favorites I‚Äôve already selected.

There should be an option on the Home Screen that will allow me to immediately pick up where I left off in a meditation series. Instead of an option to share calm with others on my Home Screen, I should see a thumbnail to navigate to my favorites. There too much friction in using this app, and I really dislike the interface.  The content is great, the format is terrible. Please improve the app.

author: KingRoo28
title: Has Changed My Life!
content:
I‚Äôve NEVER written a review for an app, but this app seriously has changed my life. I use to have such bad anxiety that I lost all my self confidence, my ability to remain calm in the face of stress, and it began even affecting me physically. I began using Calm (alongside other mental health resources) and it has taught me so much.

       They have SO many selections; sleep stories, mediations for multiple scenarios, meditation to understand emotions, music, and the best one is that they do a new 10 minute meditation every day with a awesome little life lesson/lesson on mindfulness at the end. They're also so good about talking you through meditation, how to do it, to understand it‚Äôs ok to mess up. Its so comforting, I listen every night before bed or when im anxious, it helps SO much. My mentality, emotions, and reactions to stressors has changed SO much since using it. I REALLY recommend it!

author: Bethy1!
title: Best app ever
content:
This app is absolutely amazing, nothing with this app is annoying, for me it‚Äôs great to have the German language too. 
I love the background music with different themes, and the fact that you can set up a timer for that. I leave the night mode playing for 2 hours before sleeping and it‚Äôs such a nice sleep. I wish the App Developers read my comment and add another feature to this fantastic app: PLEASE PLEASE think about an alarm clock, or maybe another option to add different times with different background music too. In this case users can have different background music during the day/night. 
I lOVE to wake up with the background music mornings. I always wake up earlier in the morning to set a sound for couple of hours and then sleep again with it, it‚Äôs such a fantastic sleep and I have more energy in the morning.

author: leemorejacqueline
title: A new positive force in my life
content: I was first exposed to meditation at 17 when I started doing yoga ... My first teacher, who I loved, would have us meditate for about 5-7 minutes at the end of class, telling us to ‚Äúlet our thoughts wash over us like water‚Äù. The yoga stuck, the meditation didn‚Äôt ... But at 31, battling depression, anxiety and perfectionism as so many of us do, I was ready to seek a solution from within. Thank God for CALM. It surprised me with a new drive to meditate everyday, sometimes even twice. There is a session for whatever you are feeling, whether you‚Äôre in tears, in a panic or feeling enlightened and like all is right with the world. Tamara and John constantly remind you to be gentle, kind and patient with yourself, and honestly, who doesn‚Äôt need to hear that? I am so so happy to be meditating and have Calm as a force for self care in my life. Try it out and subscribe stat!

author: CalmingSeas
title: Life Changing
content: I have never written an app review before but I had to for Calm because I am so in love with this app. Not only is Calm super user friendly but I love every single thing this app has to offer. I love the daily meditations and how you can favorite any session you do so you can go back and do it again. I also love how it tracks everything for you. Most importantly though is how much this app has truly changed my life. I have bettered myself in all aspects of my life from focus in school to finding peace in a very fast paced stressful job. Anxiety has always been a major issue for me (and trust me I have tried many other methods of managing stress from therapy to medications etc) but nothing has done half as much for me as meditating regularly with this app. I really hope this app never changes because I love it so much and it is worth every penny!!

author: Rachel_O
title: Best meditation app, just one thing...
content: I‚Äôve stuck with this meditation app for a month now which is longer than any other app I‚Äôve tried. There‚Äôs so many options and I love the snippets of teaching within the sessions that give you something to think about throughout the day. My only critique is that I wish there was a packet or more sessions or even more examples within the sessions given that focus on dealing with chronic/persistent illness. Many of the examples I just don‚Äôt relate to. (Break ups, job loss, etc). I think this would even be a good advertisement opportunity considering the vast population of chronically ill people. There‚Äôs a nuance to this type of illness that desperately needs attention. That is, it‚Äôs chronic. It doesn‚Äôt go away. It doesn‚Äôt even change in some circumstances. It‚Äôs a constant trigger. Would love to hear some of the experts at Calm speak to this particular issue. Thank you for considering!

author: Soph_apilla
title: 2020 Godsend
content:
This year has been a crazy one for everyone. My anxiety and stress had been on an all time high, so when I got the notification from American Express that we could try the app for free I thought, what do I have to lose? 

Meditation has now become my go to, I‚Äôve made it the central part of my morning routine with the 10 min ‚ÄúDaily Calm‚Äù meditation to begin my day. Throughout the day, if I feel myself beginning to get tense and stressed, I know it‚Äôs my queue to go ground myself again with the app. The guidance is excellent for beginners, like myself, and really helps you zone in. 

This app has made me more mindful, it allows me to slow down and ground myself before I react. Overall I would recommend instilling a daily meditation practice to anyone. You truly do feel the difference, just be patient and give yourself grace, but stick to it!

author: MorganElizabethK
title: Frustrating‚Ä¶
content: I got this app to help me fall asleep, and all it does is frustrate me. I really wish I hadn‚Äôt paid for a full year‚Ä¶ I don‚Äôt want to listen to 45 minutes of a sleep story when I‚Äôm going to sleep. I only need 15. After that, the story wakes me up. I don‚Äôt understand why this app has made sleep timers so difficult. You can set a timer to make the app go to sleep after a certain amount of time just playing the background sound, but it will still play the whole story. The only way to actually get a sleep timer is to play a story from a playlist, but I haven‚Äôt had that work consistently. Also, why can‚Äôt the app keep track of where I left off in a story or playlist? If you navigate away, it has no idea where you were. Which is extremely annoying for the playlists because if you want to use the timer, you have to restart them, otherwise they are treated as a single story with no sleep timer. I really thought this app would be better designed for sleep‚Ä¶ very disappointing.

author: chipsyum
title: Fix this
content: Okay, I have a lot of trouble sleeping due to anxiety and stress. This helps, BUT out of everything I have looked at, there‚Äôs only four free things to listen to for sleep. I have favorited all of the free things and in total there‚Äôs four. I cannot afford the subscription either, so my counselor recommended headspace also so I also have that. But that‚Äôs not the point. There‚Äôs so many things that cost money, and I get it, you guys should have some things that need to be paid for but I don‚Äôt understand why there‚Äôs literally only four things that‚Äôs free and why subscriptions cost so much. Please cut it down a bit or something, many people have the same issues as me and can‚Äôt listen to a lot of things either because there‚Äôs so much things that need subscriptions and they might not have that kind of money. I have read other reviews and I see that other people agree with me.

author: Gen VII
title: You won‚Äôt regret it.
content:
I‚Äôm not one for writing reviews, this is my first because I always think to myself if an app does its job then it‚Äôll speak for itself. However, Calm does it job and more. I have trouble sleeping on various occasions, particularly when I‚Äôm sick, being sick gives me a strange anxiety causing me to stay up later and later. I tried the free version starting off with the ‚ÄúSleep Stories‚Äù (Blue Gold to be exact) hoping that it would help reduce my anxiety and get me to sleep peacefully. It‚Äôs done exactly that, I‚Äôve used it for the past 4 nights and upgraded to premium in order to listen to more stories as I Calmly get whisked away to a better nights sleep. 

I can only imagine what the other functions of the app do and how they may help, but I‚Äôm more than pleased and genuinely looking forward to exploring the rest of the app. Thank you !

author: Studio_R
title: Awesome app, however... üòï
content:
I used to rave about Calm to my family and friends a while back, telling them how helpful it was for insomnia, meditation and relaxing. My personal favorite sleep story is ‚ÄúThe Waterfall‚Äù. (I still don‚Äôt know the ending because it always put me to sleep within 5 minutes!)

Another thing I loved about Calm was the number of features available for free. Although I couldn‚Äôt afford the annual fee, the free items were VERY helpful to me. Now, I‚Äôm greatly disappointed that most of those free features are now paid features, including ‚ÄúThe Waterfall‚Äù. 

It would be great if Calm at least offered a monthly payment option. The subject of mindful meditation, mental health, etc. is no longer taboo and on the rise and people of all incomes need resources available to them. I don‚Äôt fault Calm for charging for most of their features, but with the app ranking at #1, they should make more features available for people who cannot afford to pay a fee.

author: breannaxbruhh
title: All I can say is wow
content: I downloaded this app as the free version and didn‚Äôt really do much on it, but one day I kinda jumped into it and thought that it was kinda cool. So I bought the monthly subscription and life‚Äôs kinda gotten in the way and I sort of forgot about it. Well today is Martin Luther King Jr. Day and today was the first day I listened to a daily calm. It was about contribution and how you can be inspired. She talked about how you contribute without even noticing it such as helping a friend through a hard time. Well, it just so happens that I helped a friend through a rough night tonight and I just kind of felt like it really spoke to me and i felt touched. I am looking forward to doing this everyday from here on out and I cannot wait to see what daily calms are headed my way. Thank you guys for creating such a peaceful, uplifting, and thoughtful app. (Sorry this is so long lol)

author: Teresa M3
title: üíï
content: I love the Calm app!  I recommend getting the premium content.  Calm is a tool for dealing with the challenges of life.  There is more awareness on anxiety, depression, and negative feelings.  I am hopeful for the future because this will improve people‚Äôs lives.  I gifted the app to my friends and family who also enjoy it - beautiful, inspirational meditations, music, masterclasses, teachings, body exercises, sleep stories and music and so much more!  I wish my family and I had Calm for difficult times in our lives.  I am comforted knowing we have Calm now for difficult times in the future.  I am excited to see the upcoming new content which is frequently updated and improved.  Thank you to everyone at Calm - you all inspire and help me!  You changed and improved life for my family, friends, and me!  And for many other people in the world!

author: MrShaaSha
title: Calm app is currently saving my life
content: I believe this app is more or less saving my life. I have suffered from depression multiple times over the last nine years and I was unsure what was causing it. I believe I was overworking my brain and not giving it enough rest or stillness. The comment is allowing me to practice meditation in a way that I am never tried before. And I am not a newbie to meditation with my Indian culture and Hindu upbringing in America, I have learned a lot about pranayama. But this calm app offered something different, which has been amazing at allowing my mind to rest. My depression experiences has likely cost me over $500,000 in opportunity cost. I am excited for the opportunity to remain mentally stable for years to come so that I do not jump into an elevated state that could lead to a depression.

author: LovetheSun_21
title: Locked!!
content: I get really bad anxiety and a friend told me to try out this app. So I downloaded it and by the looks of it, it looked pretty good. So I left it at that and didn‚Äôt dig deeper til I needed it. A few days later I was going on a trip to Colorado with my swim team. We were away from home and I got really anxious. I decided to hop onto this app. I opened thinking about the vast choices I get to ‚Äúcalm‚Äù me down, but then was struck by everything being locked. I didn‚Äôt know I had to pay to be at peace with myself. I do prioritize my mental health, but having to pay $70 a year for it is kinda of ridiculous, especially for someone who works seasonal. There was an anxiety one that my friend said was good for this situation. But of course it was locked. Now Ik why people are still stressed, cause they have to pay to be calm. Instead of getting upset right away, I clicked on an unlocked one and let it play. What are you supposed to do when you finish the unlocked ones??

author: LMarag
title: Usage tracker on Home Screen is not calming
content: I want to start by saying I love this app. My doctor recommended it to me during a stressful time of persistent sleep issues stemming from increased anxiety. From sleep stories to calming sounds I then branched into using the guided meditation, the Daily Jay and more recently the Daily move. This app in general is wonderful. Please, however, consider removing the usage tracker from the opening Home Screen. There‚Äôs nothing worse than being reminded upon opening the app that you haven‚Äôt used it when you‚Äôre trying to calm yourself down. Maybe put it at the end of a session as a ‚Äúpat on the back‚Äù that you took time for you instead of opening to a ‚Äúshame on you, you haven‚Äôt practiced meditating, etc.‚Äù  Little difficult to embrace the Zen. I love everything else about this app. Thank you for your consideration.

author: artistheidi
title: Canceling Subscription due to AI
content:
I hardly ever write reviews, let alone negative ones, and I‚Äôm super disappointed to write this one. I‚Äôve used Calm since like 2017 or 2018 and it was wonderful. Admittedly the last couple years I haven‚Äôt used it as much, but when I did, I really appreciated it and found it helpful. 
However. 
I just saw that there is, or will shortly be, a new sleep story using AI technology to have Jimmy Stewart narrate it. Regardless of the fact that his estate/family consented, I find it insidious and irresponsible of Calm to endorse the use of AI to make money off a person after they are dead. It‚Äôs ethically gray at best, exploitative and sinister at worst. Personally, I would not be calmed, soothed, etc. by listening to the AI-generated voice of a dead actor, but hey, that‚Äôs just me. 
Anyways ‚Äî Calm will never get another dime from me, nor will I ever use the app again; I canceled my subscription and deleted it today. A better world is possible, as Arundhati Roy said, and it is already on its way. But this sort of thing certainly has no place in it.

author: Ehriddle
title: Great but listen to feedback
content:
I‚Äôve been a lifetime member for nearly three years. The daily‚Äôs, courses, breathing, and sleep stories are top notch. The app was indelible to developing a wellness routine for me, and got me into meditation. However, for sometime myself and other users have asked for a way to queue tracks, or create playlist- a relatively simple feature, yet am told by support they‚Äôre doing other things. As a result I have been using Hoomband for sleep tracks for the better half of a year, with this I can be guaranteed there will be something playing to help me drift back to sleep- and it would be too disruptive to get on the Calm app and pick something else. 

Other suggestions like new background scenes, or breathing exercises understandably take time. 

All in all the app is still 5 stars.

author: CxmplicatedLife
title: Calm üíñ
content: I‚Äôm a teenager and I have really enjoyed using Calm. I like to listen to the meditation music, it just puts my heart at peace :). I exercise a lot and I love listening to the calming music as I stretch or do yoga. I really appreciate this app and all the helpful resources they have available! I‚Äôd like to better my self care, so I started one of the self-care series. One of my friends has some bad anxiety and I‚Äôve recommended this app to her. They have very short sessions which is very helpful if you ever feel out of it or something. You can just take a short break and open this app and feel at peace with yourself and everything around you :). As for as I know the music, stories, meditations, etc. are all available for download so that you can listen offline. I hope you enjoy Calm as much as I do! üíñüòÑ

author: Simile is AWSOME!!!!!!!!!!
title: Lives up to the name
content: I‚Äôve had the Premium version of this app for only a week now, but I have been loving the wide selection of meditations (and meditation series!) that are available. I‚Äôve found that because I‚Äôve invested in the subscription, it‚Äôs been a bigger motivation for me to be consistent with a daily meditation routine (the series options have also motivated me to keep going). The background scene and it‚Äôs accompanying calming noises also adds an element of relaxation to the experience, which I very much enjoy. I haven‚Äôt tried the sleep stories yet, but my partner and his family love them. The only thing I would like to see changed is allowing us the ability to select more than one emotion for the check-ins and I‚Äôd also appreciate a larger emotion selection. However, this app is wonderful and I highly recommend it.

author: psyengage
title: Helps Me Calm Down
content: I have been using this app for a little over two weeks now and I think it works great for anxiety or stress. The large collection of soft noises and music allows me to have a second to myself to pay attention and breathe. It also helps me to fall asleep faster. I recommend this app to everyone. In psychology class, we learned how using breathing exercises, like the ones in this app, allows our flight or fight response to simmer down and bring our anxiety levels down. Our body‚Äôs sympathetic system spikes when we run into danger. When we feel anxiety our body does the same. Calm music helps to increase our parasympathetic response which allows us to calm down. This app does just this. There are so many options and you are bound to find an exercise for you!

author: Batgirl_Is_Awesome
title: Stress free
content: I had been having a very bad day, I had not fallen asleep until 12 the past night, had a stressful day of online learning wrapping up the trimester, and overall VERY angry. I had remembered that I had the app calm and decided to try it out. I clicked on their ‚Äúsoundscapes‚Äù option and played one of their river options. I immediately relaxed and the quality of the sound - it‚Äôs amazing! It‚Äôs like I was really there! I definitely recommend this app for all sorts of things. The paying option is expensive, but I share it with someone else. The sleep stories had helped me relax and fall asleep, and I personally do not like mindfulness. Had not worked for me before and and did not think it would. I had used it and it was very well done. Incredibly calming. Seriously, use this app. It‚Äôs good.

author: suedave88
title: It has everything.
content: I have used the Calm app for three or four years now and recommend it to all my friends. More information is constantly being added. The bedtime stories, which I listen to nearly every night, have such a wide variety to choose from. My 9 year-old granddaughter does the same choosing her stories from the kids section. Both she and I also use the app to meditate. They have a special kid section for that as well and they offer everything from body scans to categories where they give lots of instructions and directions and also categories where they speak very little. It also has visuals to help you breathe deeply. I know this is a subscription app and we all want things that are free, but remember usually you get what you pay for and that is certainly true in this case.

author: monkey simple smart ap
title: Good but too expensive
content: I love this app, especially when I‚Äôm stressed. Or I can‚Äôt sleep. I wish they had more of Jeff. Very relatable and grounded and his advice feels like it comes from deep down experience. The music could be better for my personal taste, but it‚Äôs not bad. And I found some really great unusual music here like Dumont. The price is definitely too high. Many of my friends are on a tight budget in no way could they afford to spend the money on this luxury. And I say luxury because until you experience the app that‚Äôs what it seems like.. When you can‚Äôt use it because you‚Äôre very busy seems like a waste of money. I say all of this, but after having used it for a few years, I would hate to give it up. You should give a break to people who are retired or handicapped.

author: your daddy b home
title: Useful, but too limited
content: When I first downloaded this app, I was so excited to try out mediating in a new way! But when I found out how many limits there were until you unlocked the premium version, I was quite disappointed. There are different categories like mediation, sleep, and music, but you can do only up to three or none of the options given inside each category. Even when you can do one of the mediation/sleep/etc. options, it only lets you do one ‚Äúday‚Äù or ‚Äúchapter‚Äù. At first I was fine with only a few options given, thinking I could do all the chapters of each selection, but they don‚Äôt let you unless you pay. I do get why they would need the money from putting so much effort into this beautiful app, but they have to at least make it somewhat enjoyable without having to pay for basically everything that is offered. So unless I‚Äôm able to complete all the days in each option inside the categories, I think the app would be pretty decent.

author: Orangetang222
title: Life changing - can‚Äôt believe I waited so long to try it
content: I‚Äôve been using this app for a couple weeks - it‚Äôs helped so much to restore calm and build healthy mindfulness techniques, relieving intense anxiety. The daily Jay has a piece of motivational advice everyday. The outstanding sleep stories have helped me fall asleep peacefully (never did I imagine such a concept for adults) and if awakened with anxious thoughts in middle of night, I can listen to something curated with intention of falling back to sleep, and it works! It builds the restorative habits the many of us with hectic lives need - we often don‚Äôt see past our daily lives to make time for ourselves. This app helps build those important habits for the mind. I feel more positive each day. So try it - $70 for a year is a deal due to how useful it is.

author: qawsderftgyhujikolpzxcvbnm,#2
title: Amazing
