content: I had been feeling really stressed with school and one of my mom‚Äôs friend recommended this app. It was like magic. There is a monthly subscription fee, but you don‚Äôt have to subscribe to have the app. I haven‚Äôt subscribed and I still use the app. I personally love listening to the scenes in the background and if you go to the ‚Äúscenes‚Äù tab in the app, you can make it so the scene‚Äôs sound plays even if you aren‚Äôt in the app. The sounds are just so calming. You can also do a feelings check in which I try to do every morning. It has a bunch of emojis to choose from to relate to how you are feeling and you can write more about it. Once you do this, you can also see your history to see how you were feeling another day. I really enjoy this app and I highly recommend it.

author: senoritaugly
title: Wasn‚Äôt great to begin with, much worse now
content: I used this app for a while a few years ago.  It wasn't super useful to me, even then a lot was behind a paywall, but I like the guided breathing exercise. I stopped using it and deleted the app at some point. When I downloaded it again recently, a lot had changed. The front page is now almost entirely paid content and the breathing exercise I used to use has been moved and was pretty hard to find. Also, you used to be able to adjust the breath pattern more, but now you have to have a subscription for anything other than 4 seconds inhale, 6 seconds exhale. There is very little content in this app that isn‚Äôt behind a $70/year subscription and they don‚Äôt even let you read descriptions or listen to previews of a lot of things, like the sleep stories, so you know what you‚Äôd be paying for. Used to be good for the breathing exercises, but now that they‚Äôre harder to access (not what I wanna deal with when I‚Äôm stressed), it‚Äôs completely useless to me.

author: Phillydayyy
title: Great app, but please fix offline downloads!
content:
We used headspace to sleep for years and it‚Äôs great but we‚Äôve really been enjoying calms sleep stories collection. We recently started turning off Wi-Fi & putting our phones on airplane modes at night and love that we can download the sleep stories to listen to without internet. 

However, at first the app would sometimes crash a couple times after about 30 seconds of listening on offline mode but would start working flawlessly after a couple starts. Sometimes it wouldn‚Äôt crash at all. Just recently it started crashing every night non-stop. This happens on both mine and my wife‚Äôs phone. Fresh installs, fresh reboot of phone, doesn‚Äôt make a difference. 

Please fix this so we can go to bed without having to restart a bunch in offline mode! No issue in regular mode.

author: Ella79
title: Fantastic app (w/ a recommendation)
content:
This is a fantastic app. It costs a lot for an app, and I expected to quit after the free trial. But it was too good and useful. There are lots of different guided mindfulness meditations, which I‚Äôve actually been using regularly. It‚Äôs really helped me work short meditation practices into my day at different times (and for different purposes: from focus to calm to sleep). I‚Äôve also listened to some of the sleep music and sleep stories to help wind-down and get a good nights sleep when I‚Äôm hyped up over a stressful day.

Request: One thing I‚Äôm really hoping they will add soon is a separate set of guided meditations (or at least one longer one) for actual mind-body physical healing (after injury, surgery, or from illness). I would also benefit from guided meditations on coping with & living with chronic pain. Please consider adding these!

author: moony5556
title: Amazing app - Bad support!!
content:
This app changed my life on an everyday basis. I finally learned what it really means to meditate and it‚Äôs been helping me ever since. HOWEVER...if you need help or have a question, you are only offered bot responses. Anything outside of basic ‚Äúhow to‚Äù and you hit the impenetrable wall that most tech companies create...no human to talk to...a big contrast to the way you would expect a wellness app to operate. 
My biggest issue is that your courses do not translate across devices so when you move from Apple TV to my iPad - The iPad doesn‚Äôt know that you‚Äôve already started the course and wants to start you from the beginning again. Also, it would be great to be able to buy some of the music that they offer‚Ä¶ But no one to talk to or ask about any of this!

 If you want people to be happy and calm you have to give them support!

author: thewordtester
title: My Favorite Meditation App
content: From the get go, I love that it doesn't make you create an account to use it. There are lots of nice nature sounds available with visuals for free and I really appreciate that they will keep playing when I use another app or lock my phone (a setting you can turn off). I also like that the nature sounds starts playing upon opening, the ease of swiping to different sounds, and that I pick what sounds pop up on my screen. I have just been using that feature for a while and have just decided to give their guided meditations a shot. It doesn't seem like they have as many free guided meditations as Simple Habit, but they seem to cover the topics I want, and I'm partial to simple nature sounds anyway. Even when I don't want to meditate it makes wonderful background noise. Really appreciate it.

author: reader in Georgia
title: Excellent app -
content: This is a well thought out application for meditation and has strong anchors in psychology..  As a psychologist I weekly recommend this app to my patients to use to quell and address anxiety and sleep issues.  The research is sound and the principals realistically discuss that facing and accepting anxiety (however paradioical) works!  I like how the app states to accept the thought and to let it float on by.  Awareness is a strong tool in strengthening our self esteem.  Self care makes us stronger and more compassionate individuals where we can give back and support our families, friends and communities.  This is positive psychology in its truest form.  Keep up the good work.  Now for more programs for kids and teens.   And perhaps setting up meditation centers in schools.  Excellent and well thought out.  Thanks for all of your hard work

author: Just a humble editor
title: Has potential‚Ä¶Includes suggestions
content:
I recently got a free trial for a year through work, which includes paid content. I‚Äôve read the reviews from people with free trials, and I doubt I‚Äôd buy it, seeing just what they‚Äôre seeing. Here‚Äôs what I like about it so far: The ‚ÄúHow to Meditate‚Äù series by Jeff Warren, the  ‚ÄúRadical Self Care‚Äù series by Lama Rod Owens, a few of the Sleep Stories,‚Ä¶

Here‚Äôs where I‚Äôd suggest improvements: I just had to look up the names and titles of these, which I‚Äôd bookmarked as favorites so I could find them. The organization could use some improvement. I‚Äôd suggest sorting things by what you want to DO (e.g., movement, meditation [by type]), etc. 

Also, I recently lost a loved one. When I searched for ‚Äúgrief‚Äù, ‚Äúgrieving‚Äù, ‚Äúloss‚Äù, etc,. It returned exactly two meditations, both by the same person. I think there‚Äôs a real need for more in-depth topics, based on the other reviews I‚Äôve read.  And if you can‚Äôt make this app free, I‚Äôd suggest creating a ‚Äúfree-will donation‚Äù feature for those with means to help people who can‚Äôt afford this app but who also really need something like this. I‚Äôd be willing to contribute a few bucks to help a struggling student or senior, or anyone. 

Just some thoughts off the top of my head. Thanks.

author: PJ HC
title: The Calm app is essential to my life.
content: I love this app so, so, so much.  It has many sessions and options.  Meditations of varying subjects and lengths.  I love Tamara‚Äôs voice.  She‚Äôs so calm and intelligent in her meditation practices knowledge.  I have a lot of stress (husband of 27 years recently blind sided me with divorce papers), fighting depression and bucketfuls of anxiety.  Eating and sleeping issues.  There are mediations covering all those issues and more.  There are sleep story aids, soothing music.  There‚Äôs a calendar to keep track of your sessions.  I use this app everyday day.  Sometimes multiple sessions a day.  Sometimes I like a session so much I will listen to it more than once.  If you‚Äôre looking for soothing, easy, judgement free guided meditation, you can‚Äôt go wrong with Calm.  WELL worth the nominal fee.  I recommend this app to anyone and everyone.

author: djdjrbcjdj
title: Free trial?
content: This app seems like it WOULD be cool.  Of course, it would only make sense to have ALL the features unlocked for the 7 day trial period before charging $80 for a year subscription.  I mean, let‚Äôs be real.  How can you guys charge that much for something that is predominantly locked throughout the app?  Very disappointing, and frankly, I feel like I‚Äôm getting hustled.  Everyone knows you let the consumer try it first with all the premium features before charging a whopping $80! Honestly, this app should be free with ‚Äúin-app‚Äù purchases.  Is it only for people that have $80 to gamble that most likely have million dollar estates or are the ones riding their Peleton bike overlooking the city lights in their high-rise condos?  Jk Do not get me wrong.  I am looking for the benefits from this app which I am sure it can provide because I see all the great features I love.  Unfortunately, all those features are locked which is dumb.  Please fix this because I‚Äôm sure u guys deserve a 5 star but I guess I will never know.

author: raggedrosie
title: Lifesaver
content:
In a little over a year I have found that ever so gradually I am facing fears, memories and addictions which I didn‚Äôt have the courage to explore. I need to face, explore and find a new path for myself within. It‚Äôs not an easy thing to look and feel within, to face my role in the stories that seem to control me. But day by day I am, and sometimes I can even let things go! Not all the time, but often enough that I am encouraged. The sleep stories are also remarkable. I usually fall asleep before they are over and some I return to over and over for the voices and the stories themselves. Such blessing for an insomniac! 
You are the best therapy for anyone seeking a place of refuge in a world of constant noise and anger. Thank you, Tamara, and all the writers and readers who ‚Äúcalm‚Äù my days and nights. I have a long way to go. And you are great companions.

author: Lllllljc
title: I love this app!
content: I'm new to meditation.  I've tried several apps, online sources, etc, and always come back to this app. The narrator's voice is absolutely perfect for this. She's very soothing, clear, and her voice just works for this.  There is just enough instruction to help bring me back on focus.  I also love the various background sounds you can choose from which provides me with a consistency from each session I choose which has helped me get in the swing of things.  I was really hesitant to pay for something like this, but it's been three months and I have no plans on canceling.  Additionally, I did have a problem which turned out to be my fault. I contacted customer service when I was trying to figure out the problem.  They were quick to respond and provided great instructions.  Highly recommend this app.

author: LivNo.9
title: Money well spent
content: This app saved me.  I've been in and out of work for the past few months due to what turned out to be massive panic attacks.  Doctors recommended medication but I chose meditation instead.  3 weeks in and I have been able to control these attacks thus far.  I will update my review in a year's time.  I really love this app.  The guidance is soothing and informative.  Who knew an almost 40 year old blue collar guy could benefit from such practices?!  By the way, I use it while walking, before bed, and after breakfast while the house is still quiet.  I have also been eating better and spending time in the kitchen cooking to keep my mind busy on more important things.  This app has taught me to control my thoughts.  I wish it was around when I was in my 20's!  My life would have been much improved.  Try it.  Buy it!

author: Dgqh619
title: We need this. You need this.
content: I‚Äôm a user for years now and these are some of my reflections. The thing about meditation is that you probably have all the tools without this app. What I appreciate is Tamara‚Äôs voice (the main person doing the guided meditations) and the topics that change everyday. Kind of like a meditation plus someone telling you to be in the present and that your feelings are valid. There is also other things they‚Äôve added over the years like soundscapes and sleep stories and music. Since I‚Äôve been working on my mediation practice I appreciate that it logs your sessions. Also, maybe it‚Äôs just me but it feels satisfying to see the quote and image after you finish your meditation for the day (it feels like a reward,  but it‚Äôs really a reminder of that day‚Äôs lesson).

author: Cool200054
title: Slight improvement needed
content: Don‚Äôt get me wrong this is a nice app, I downloaded because of the adds on tv, however these adds describe a free app that would specifically play green noise, however I was disappointed to find once downloading that the adds were untrue. Green noise is not available with the free version, there is nothing wrong with bonuses for paying extra however almost everything in this app requires you to pay with very little open for free use. I would find this app more enjoyable for use if there was more open for people who do not pay. Though the features provided on the app are quite relaxing even if they are just on the free version, and I will still use this app, I would love to see a increase of free things on this app. Maybe even have adds come up on the top and bottom of the screen as you can see in many other free to use websites.

author: ANDYS JAPANESE AUTO
title: SLOW!
content: Love the app. However, this app is so slow when I need it the most to relax the other day. My Verizon internet and home Wi-Fi is the highest data I have and yet it‚Äôs so slow to load, it was waiting and waiting to load the sounds of the forest and I was so the opposite of calm. Maybe to many folks are on the servers at the same time? I‚Äôve read so many reviews about folks complaining that there is a fee to pay for an app service, my suggestion is to do research on what‚Äôs involved in app and software development. The amount of money Involved creating an app Is expensive, the developer has to pay huge fees every month in addition to the employees they hire to create quality content and research as well. Life is not free! Free apps are not that great, this is a great app but just too many folks on there server is causing lag on my end.

author: teachlikeaunicorn
title: Amazing!!
content:
This app is just unbelievable. I am a mom of two, ages 16 & 6, and I am also a special ed teacher, and I use this app both at home snd with my students!! Both of my kids have sensory issues as well as OCD, ADHD, and severe anxiety. My daughter‚Äôs needs are more severe than my sons are, and over this past year, there were some nights where this app was the only thing that got my daughter to sleep. She particularly loves the Disney lullabies and the Matthew 
mcconaughey sleep story... can you blame her?! ü§£üôÉüòâ haha JK...  but seriously, they are so relaxing ... I even enjoy the sleep stories!!

I was fortunate enough to receive a subscription for free when Calm was doing the give away for teachers years ago; however, even if I hadn‚Äôt gotten it for free, I would pay for it in a heartbeat!! One of the best apps we own, even if we don‚Äôt always use it!!

author: Tigertiff816
title: Terrible navigation, geared more towards sleep rather than meditation
content: I paid for a year subscription and I‚Äôve done about 10 sessions now. It‚Äôs stressful just trying to find a meditation. There‚Äôs no categories except sleep, meditate and one other I can‚Äôt even remember. Most of it seems geared towards sleep and I was wanting daily meditations. Most seem to be either 3 minutes or 30 minutes. Not much in between. The apps inability to find what I‚Äôm looking for actually made me get annoyed and just close it without doing my daily meditation. The sessions I have done were not that great most of them went completely silent in the middle making me break out of my meditation to see if it was still playing or the guide would come back and it would be so loud it would scare me out of my meditation which defeats the purpose. I‚Äôm just going back to the meditations I get on the bodi app that I find actually good. Guess I wasted money on a year of this app.

author: Sensei Loki
title: Please change home screen!
content: I love this app and have been using it since 2016. I feel like I know Tamara haha! My only complaint is that the new home screen is way too cluttered. It seems like a small thing, but visually it‚Äôs not very calming. I liked it better when the home screen just showed the Daily Calm and you could find other meditations on a different button. There should be a section for ‚ÄúNew Meditations‚Äù so we can see the updates and new additions, but it‚Äôs my strong personal opinion that the home page now looks way too hectic for a meditation app. It‚Äôs bugged me enough for the past few months that I finally wrote a review. But I recommend this app to everyone, I absolutely can‚Äôt say enough good things about the meditations/backgrounds/music- keep doing awesome things, and please simplify home screen!

author: Gamer girl 090772
title: Was amazing.. at first
content:
I love what you‚Äôve done here, everything you guys had on the unlocked free stuff is amazing until you took that away from me. I used this app for years Before you locked every single thing i use in the sounds and music (thats the only thing i use). Before they were locked off, this app was helping me with panic and anxiety attacks during the day and helping me sleep at night. I was perfectly fine using this free and now when i scroll through the sounds to find something that‚Äôll help me again, no joke every singe thing was locked and I actually had the worst mental breakdown in a long time. This was the only app that ever actually helped me, ive gone through so many apps and websites until I found Calm. Now once again i dont have anything to help me and im having panic attacks without anything for relief
I dont want to pay the $60 whatever dollars a year because im so. Flipping. Broke. And so i think ima just give up and suffer through the pain now

author: MaggieRkingz
title: this app is absolutely incredible
content: i‚Äôve been using calm for about over a year now. I started using it back when i went to therapy. During that time period i was really struggling with sleep and had a really rough time trying to figure out how to fix it, then my therapist suggested this app for me and ever since it has truly turned around my sleep schedule. i use it EVERY SINGLE NIGHT to go to sleep. I listen to the same sound every night (rain sounds), and it‚Äôs just so helpful! I‚Äôve struggled with night terrors and rough sleeping my entire life, and have also been taking melatonin since i was about 5 (14 now), and melatonin truly helped until i reached an older age where it just wouldn‚Äôt help me sleep anymore. So since i‚Äôve had this app, things have truly been amazing for me! thank you so much and i TRULY TRULY reccomend! :)

author: Shaun in Reno
title: Amazing!  My favorite app.
content:
Calm has officially become my favorite app. I never thought I could meditate and develop mindfulness...Calm thankfully proved me wrong.  It has helped me sleep, reduce my anxiety, improve my depression, and reduce impulsive/reactive behavior.  In short, Calm has helped me a calmer person. I‚Äôm excited to see where this journey will go.  If you are in CBT (and definitely if you are in DBT), this will greatly help you overcome negative thought patterns.

For beginners, do the 7 days of calm.  Then do the 21 days of calm.  If you need, repeat the 21 days of calm. This will train you with the ability of basic meditation.  If you commit to improving your mental and spiritual health.  

Final advice, don‚Äôt buy the app right away.  If you wait, you will get an email for 40% off an annual membership.  Then, take advantage of that membership and commit to changing your life.

author: lovingorca
title: I don‚Äôt like that a lot of apps now have Subscriptions
content: I don‚Äôt like that a lot of apps now have Subscriptions. Even apps that you have to buy first. Then they have subscriptions. The cost of living has gone up and so has corporate greed. Food cost more. Diet plays a big part in our health. We have to eat healthy in order for our bodies to function properly. 1. physical health comes first. When a person eats healthy they feel better. We need proper nutrition in order to maintain good health. 2nd. our mental health. This app can be good. I also like VR which is a 360 view that makes you feel like you‚Äôre really there. Meta Quest headsets. Calm could make an app for the Meta Quest headset and make it so that the person can use it offline. 1.A Beach scene. 2. Car ride. FirePlace. To name a few.

author: mplus points?
title: I love this app!
content:
I have tried a few meditation and sleeping apps, and this is by far my favorite. There are many ways to meditate with this app, with different voices and messages, and I love that. 
There are also many sleep stories that I enjoy and listen to over and over and sometimes I can repeat every word, but that‚Äôs ok; I still seem to fall asleep before the end of the story. Even if I don‚Äôt, I know, there will be another one right behind it to help me fall into slumber.
Another great feature of this app are the soundscapes. My favorite is the crashing waves, and the gently falling rain. 
For any mood you are in, you can find a sound, story, or meditation to help you relax and destress. I highly recommend this app and thinking it‚Äôs worth every penny and I hope you agree.

author: Zedd77
title: Great content hidden in a frustrating app
content:
As a lifetime subscriber and longtime evangelist, I hate giving Calm a low rating. To say it has changed my life would be an understatement. But as its content library has grown, the app layout has made it harder and harder to use. 

Today I had a rough day at work. I had a few minutes between activities and thought it would be good to sit for 10-15 minutes meditation. Today‚Äôs Daily Calm topic didn‚Äôt fit the bill. So I went looking. 

I tapped into the Anxiety tab and instantly felt anxious. The choices were overwhelming, not laid out in any pattern I could see, and some didn‚Äôt seem on topic (‚ÄúGet Energized,‚Äù for example). It‚Äôs the same for all the other sections; a presentation that makes decisions difficult and puts barriers between Calm‚Äôs users and Calm‚Äôs amazing content. I closed the app and just went back to work. 

It hit me then‚Ä¶ the app was making it harder, not easier, for me to gain a sense of calm. 

Which is a shame because I can see the care that went into this design. It‚Äôs clearly intended to surface sessions users might not have found on their own. Those design decisions themselves seem to acknowledge the app bloat, and are trying to help. Sadly, Calm needs more than care, good intentions and great content; it needs a ground-up redesign or it will just keep getting more and more difficult for users to find their calm.

author: Laumbrani
title: The Daily‚Äôs
content: I really appreciate all the daily meditations. Each one is unique to the narrator/author and has its own wisdom and insight. I resonate with Jeff Warren the deepest as he reminds me that it‚Äôs not only okay to be me‚Ä¶.it‚Äôs actually pretty friggin‚Äô awesome. Jay has great stories that really help highlight the point he is making. I‚Äôm a big fan of metaphor type learning and often use them in my private practice; so I dig that style. Tamara has a soothing demeanor that always puts me at ease and helps remind me that staying in the moment is always the right place to be. I‚Äôve been listening to the sleep stories for a couple of years and only recently started practicing meditation. Wow, have I been missing out! Thank you for doing what you do. You‚Äôre changing the world one  one listener at a time.

author: Purple Skates 88
title: Can‚Äôt find what I came for
content: I saw advertisements with very satisfying videos.  One was a long cube being cut into nine thinner blocks.  The other was kind of like traveling through space in a glowing worm hole.  I am in the seven day free trial of the premium and can‚Äôt find those.  They were so satisfying to watch.  I want to watch them over and over.  I listened to a sleep story last night, it relaxed me but did not put me to sleep.  The guided meditations are nice.  The only way I will possibly pay for this is if you show me what I came for.  Also, hot tip... if you want to pay for a year, cancel the app and you get  a thirty percent off offer immediately. If you go into your iTunes subscriptions, there are several different prices for a one year subscription to premium.  Discount baby!

author: AshlitaMuchamas
title: Great save for two things...
content:
I love the calm app. I use it primarily for white noise to get my baby to sleep (works like a charm!), and periodically for myself for the same reason. I do wish it had a fade out ability, however, in conjunction with the sleep timers. It would be so nice to have it slowly drop in volume down to nothing. This is my biggest wish - it would make falling asleep to the tracks and STAYING asleep so much easier. 

The app also has issues sometimes where it‚Äôll take a few tries to get it to actually play again, or it‚Äôll freeze on one of the sceneries and rotate, but needs to be quit/relaunched to actually function correctly beyond that. Minor bugs, no biggie. 

The various meditative sounds are wonderful, and I‚Äôve used them on really rough days. I genuinely appreciate having an app that slows my brain down.

author: Penny poke
title: Sleep
content:
Hello, I‚Äôm Jessica mother of Amy (age 5) and Molly (age 3) now tonight my children decided they wanted to listen to Snow White but when we searched we didn‚Äôt see anything so we made a list of tales you should add! First off, Princess and The Frog, my children love this tale and before calm I read it to them almost every night. Second, Goldie Locks, I remember picking Amy up from Pre-K and her telling me all about this story, she was very happy when I bought the book and read it to her and wants it on calm too! Third, Hansel and Gretel, this sweet book made Molly drool about a candy house, so I knew it must be added to calm which hopefully will! Lastly, The Three Billy Goats Gruff, this Story I told Molly when she wasn‚Äôt even two, but I knew she liked it because as I read she giggled happily in her crib. Anyways hopefully you see this. Stay Safe Stay Home.
          -Jessica

author: Very Serious Reviewer
title: Never been so calm!
content:
From the moment of my first meditation session I‚Äôve been hooked! I have Tourette Syndrome so my mind is constantly stressed and on high-alert. However, I found that during mediating, my motor tics vanished! I admit, I had my doubts about this app. I‚Äôm usually not too good at mediating and it sometimes brought me more stress than relaxation. But the narrator walks you through it and keeps you focused and calm. It‚Äôs like you step outside of your body and go to a sort of spiritual place. You won‚Äôt believe it until you try it and I highly recommend that you do! 

Great for stress, trouble sleeping, sadness, reducing stress from  Tourette Syndrome (and things alike), etc. Basically, if you‚Äôre feeling down, angry, stressed, guilty, grief, lost, or overall just not good‚Äîthen this app is definitely for you!

author: kat baloo
title: The Calm
content:
I have found the calm app to be a daily transcript for peaceful, mindful living. It is so easy to quickly feel overwhelmed,!stressed out and frazzled in today‚Äôs technological minute to minute incessant barrage of information. Our world has become bombarded with uninvited interruptions as if this is the norm. 
The calm helps one to return to that peaceful, blissful place that is so necessary and reminds us that space and peace and calmness are some of the keys to obtaining an inward fulfilling place. The inner space that regulates our interaction with those things outside of us that demand our consciousness whether invited or not. The calm helps us stay in touch with that divine inner spirituality that can be considered a regulator of sorts that provides a strong boundary for successful containment of the the things we choose to be important !

author: kutzinke
title: Great for beginners or the experienced
content:
I have a high-stress job, and at an employee wellness seminar, they suggested mindful meditation. Then I saw an ad for this app on Facebook. So I thought, ‚ÄúWhy not?‚Äù
This app is wonderful. There are sessions for beginners that are a great introduction to the practice. I used the app for two weeks before deciding to upgrade. It‚Äôs 100% worth the steep price. You can choose from a wide variety of background music or nature sounds to play during your session, or choose silence. The sessions run from fully guided to no guide. You can set a timer. You can just do breathing exercises. As someone with anxiety and depression, I absolutely love the courses on gratitude and self-worth. I have definitely noticed a difference in my ability to handle stress and calm myself in hectic moments. I have recommended this app to all my friends and coworkers.

author: Rebecca74
title: Unsubscribed because of in app notifications
content: I just unsubscribed from my yearly subscription because the constant and unavoidable in app notifications were intrusive and the opposite of calming. They include banners that cannot be dismissed without actually listening to new ‚Äúcelebrity‚Äù meditations or sleep stories I have zero interest in and green notification badges on the music and stories tabs that alert you every time there is something new. This should be optional. These sorts of notifications are stressful, Fuel tech addiction and a constant feeling of a need to be doing something rather than just be, and are basically fueling the exact fire the app is supposed to help put out. It got to the point that I couldn‚Äôt stand to open the app. I have no interest in paying $100 a year for more unavoidable notifications. I hope the developers take this feedback into account. The ridiculous amount of stress they place on celebrity over quality of content is also off putting.

author: Dchlarson
title: A little disappointed
content: I love the idea of this app, even after downloading and discovering what is available to you. BUT! The options I have are very very limited if I don‚Äôt pay for the premium Calm experience. Just like every other app, I am fully aware you can‚Äôt get the best of it without paying for a premium version, but with this app, your options are SO limited that you barely even have options if you don‚Äôt pay for premium. I can only listen to 1 story if I don‚Äôt pay for the premium version, and every other category options are just the same amount of limited. I was going to give this 3 stars for the regular version and not the premium version, but after further exploration on the app, I found myself even more disappointed with how many options I DONT have because I didn‚Äôt pay for premium. Other apps will let you explore more even without the premium version, but this one does not do that. Thanks for taking the time to read my review.

author: leiahbeiah
title: Came for Breathing Exercises, Stayed for Everything
content:
I signed up for Calm in late October 2020 during a particularly difficult bout with anxiety. The Breathing Exercises were what drew me initially, because yoga had taught me the importance of regulating my system through the breath. The exercises helped a lot. I quickly found that the Sleep Stories were another instant salve for me in times of need.

At this point I have done countless meditations and a few masterclasses. I have logged over a thousand hours of mindfulness. My daughter loves her nightly Sleep Stories just as much as I do. We daydream about who we‚Äôd like to hear narrate a story, or if we wrote a really relaxing story, would Anna Acton want to record it? :) I just renewed for another year because I couldn‚Äôt be more pleased with my experiences with Calm.

author: KikiTheCruz
title: Too gamified & cluttered now
content: Love the sleep stories. Bought a lifetime subscription 5 years ago. They just won‚Äôt stop fiddling with the interface, though, and I‚Äôm less and less satisfied. When I wake up in the middle of the night, I just want to pick another story: I don‚Äôt want to be confronted with my ‚Äústreak,‚Äù I don‚Äôt want to be told to take a bath before bedtime, I don‚Äôt want to run through all the choices on the app (which are legion). Gamifying meditation and sleep does not make for a calm experience‚Äîit makes it more stressful! And in the middle of night case‚Äîharder to use and counterproductive! The devs are so bent on getting users to try every new feature on the app (selling data?) that they‚Äôre failing to use common sense. Just let us arrange out own home screens and block out the features we don‚Äôt want or use. Please!

author: Elidods1234
title: I just wish it could play while my phone is locked.
content: I‚Äôm deeply in love with this app. I‚Äôm a man with high functioning Autism, ‚ÄúAspergers.‚Äù I am most thankful for it when my panic attacks start up, or when my fears and stressors kick in. But I would love this even more if only I could still use is while my phone screen is locked, and maybe if while I have to respond to a text ect. that it would continue to play in the background, instead of cutting off. Maybe if it played in the background until I decided to close out the app, after satisfying my purpose. It would be an even better experience for me, and maybe some others who might agree. But that would be my only advice and or adjustment to an otherwise perfect app. I‚Äôm a fan for life. God bless.

author: ksm928
title: Worth it for sleep stories alone!
content:
I've had to medicate myself to get to sleep for a very long time. I tried this app and loved the stories. I decided to splurge on the premium features (I rarely spend money on apps) and see how it went. That was a year ago and I just renewed my subscription. I plan on making better use of the meditation portions this year. The sleep stories are wonderful though and I would happily pay for this app for just that! Lots of different story readers to choose from so you know you'll find a voice that relaxes you. I can now sleep without sleeping aids! It's wonderful! Thank you!!!

Edit : I would love a section to track my mood and basically use as a journal. It would be really interesting to see the correlation between days where I meditate and days I don't and how it affects my mood.

author: oovoo_sucks
title: Lack of variety for free users
content: I would rate this app a 3/3.5 because I was very disappointed how it said it was ‚Äúfree‚Äù but you literally almost have to pay to do anything on it. For the free users, I do not recommend this because the lack of variety. If you are purchasing the app it would be a much better experience. I had a difficult time using the app because it was a little hard to navigate because of all the different things that was offered (for the purchasers only). This app did not do much to my sleep. It helps me fall asleep faster because I was focused on the meditation. I got my normal sleep and there was not a massive difference. The appearance of the app was very pleasant at first then it got overwhelming to look at because of all the options it gave the purchasers. Overall, I would not recommend this app if you do not a plan on purchasing the full membership of it that includes all of its best features.

author: greenthumbtato
title: Helped with my problems!
content: My anxiety was worse then ever, but then a friend of mine suggested the Calm app. I started meditation that night and I started to feel like a completely different person. My friends noticed that I was becoming happier and calmer. But on the third week of Calm, it started to slow down and load slower. But once I updated the app, it became faster. There were new meditations, and sleep stories. Everyone started to notice my issues were slowly disappearing. But the school bully also wanted to know how I got rid of my problems. I told him, but he told me, ‚ÄúThat is so stupid. No APP can do that. Calm sounds dumb.‚Äù I didn‚Äôt care, calm can really help with whatever problems you have. From anxiety, to narcissistic people. I definitely recommend this app.

author: Riley cat
title: Calm app
content:
I gave the app calm a 5 star rateing because it has so many different ways to keep you calm you should definitely download the app calm if you have trouble getting relaxed or calm.

P.s. How you download the app calm is so you go to the app store,than once your there click on the Magna fine glass on the top or the bottom when your there press on the button that says search and a blue blinking line will come up on the side than letters should come up on the bottom than type  in "calm" than press search. Than look for a blue square that says calm in the middle once you find it press on it than a cricle will come up that means its downloading when its fully colored in than wate a little wile and than there will come up a button that says open your gonna press that and start your Jorrny.

author: Lighthouse lance
title: 5 stars to 3
content:
Still my favorite meditation app but I have an iPhone and had many downloaded on my phone. Have always paid for the app after realizing how well it worked. Well now it won‚Äôt let me keep the downloaded daily meditations I loved. Before you could download them to the iPhone. Now it doesn‚Äôt which sticks cause spending a lot of time in areas without service (you know nature lol) I‚Äôm not able to access all my favorite daily meditations which before I was able to access and have it downloaded. Please change this back so I and others can access these daily meditations offline and I can switch back to a 5 star review. This was a huge selling point for me and truly unfortunate it has been switched. 
Still a great meditation app and can still download the programmed meditations.

author: MABDVM
title: icalm has been life changing!!
content:
I downloaded this app as I was going through issues with my treatment for depression.  I have never been good at the relaxation portion of yoga, but found I truly was needing to find away to help myself focus and care for myself.  I couldn‚Äôt believe how quickly I fell asleep after doing a body scan & listening to a sleep story. 

I still am not practicing ideally, listening to meditations on walks, while driving, or while doing work, but I am moved by the lessons in the different areas and need these gems of insight.   This practice is getting me closer to catching up on things at work and getting me to that place where I can truly practice meditative moments.  
I look forward to continuing and improving upon my practice and finding some inward quiet and peace.

author: R√•ven
title: Changed there formate on no option to have the mountain lake continue
content:
I‚Äôve been using this app now for three years. It was great till about two updates ago where after the sleep meditation then all background sounds of the ‚Äúmountain lake‚Äù stop when the meditation ended. They said, tech support, I could download the mountain lake and adjust the settings. Well there is no option for that for the ‚Äúmountain lake‚Äù background sounds. I‚Äôve told them now once a week since this changed. And still no movement on getting this option for the ‚Äúmountain lake‚Äù background to be set to continuously play throughout the night.

Apparently my money I have subscribed to them over the three years and suggesting there app to other people means nothing to them. 

Maybe this review will get a better response.

author: LindaIsNotHappy226613
title: Best meditation app, in my opinion
content:
When I was looking for a good meditation app last year, I tried out maybe 4-5 of the most popular ones in the app store and found that Calm had the most pleasing audio narrations and visual design out of all of them and was also the most usable. And it works!  Over the course of the past 13 months, Calm has helped me go from just a handful of 10-minute sessions per month initially, to now meditating for 30-45 min each morning for 28 out of the past 30 days. (My only complaint is I hate these prompts for app store reviews, especially at the end of a session! Hopefully they go away now that I've left one?)

Also, as a suggestion, I'd love to see some basic data visualization to track my progress, eg, # of sessions per month or total time per month, graphed over time.

author: eb83098
title: Life changing
content:
Update: app is slow. 

Original: I can‚Äôt recommend the Calm app enough. I‚Äôve been a member since 2020 and it‚Äôs had a profoundly positive effect on my mental health. I had severe anxiety and a 9-month episode of major depression during Covid 19, when I couldn‚Äôt get out of bed and didn‚Äôt know what was wrong with me. Along with my psychiatrist and Recovered Codependents 12 Step program, Jeff Warren, a Calm meditation teacher, helped me gently and positively reprogram my terrible negative self-talk, gain a bit of detachment from my thoughts, and get into my body again. I listen to stories, meditations or music before bed several nights a week. Tonight I‚Äôm listening to ‚ÄúWonder,‚Äù narrated by Matthew McConaughey. Thanks for making this such a great app‚Äîit‚Äôs still helping me heal to this day.

author: Jordan C 2146
title: Could not recommend this more
content: I‚Äôm someone who suffers from immense anxiety, insomnia, and just an overall lack of being able to relax. I downloaded the calm app one night when I couldn‚Äôt sleep, yet again, and I turned on one of the sleep stories and was asleep in minutes. Not only that but I stayed asleep the whole night! I woke up in the morning refreshed and so I thought I would try one of the daily meditations. After my first daily meditation, I understood why people make this regular practice. I love that this app keeps me on track and reminds me to check in with myself, complete my meditations, and also has an abundance of sleep stories to chose from. In doing my check-ins, I can actually see how in one week I have gone from overall very anxious, worried, and stressed to calm, happy, and grateful.

author: Puglovin'
title: Needs more narrators
content: I want to rate this app higher, because I use it daily and find it useful, but Tamara Levitt‚Äôs syrupy delivery makes me feel like I‚Äôm a kindergartner, and I have trouble getting through some of her meditations due to the way she speaks. I‚Äôm often so distracted by my annoyance with her that the meditation is worthless. I understand the irony that I‚Äôm supposed to be learning equanimity via meditation to deal with feelings like this, but I guess I‚Äôm just not that advanced yet. She ends every meditation with ‚Äúwiggle your fingers and toes‚Äù as if we‚Äôve been taking a break on our nap mats and it‚Äôs time to get up for our juice boxes. I like the content of her sessions, I just don‚Äôt like her delivery. On the other hand, Jeff Warren is great. I wish he had more sessions on here. I paid the annual fee for the app, which is why I‚Äôm still using it, but I doubt I‚Äôll renew unless they change things up a bit.

author: Sheathedoganimates
title: Great app but
content: The app is great and calming, and it‚Äôs a nice way to track thoughts and sleep patterns. But the one thing I don‚Äôt like is that you need to pay money to do 95% of the stuff. Some of the only things you can do are the quotes and the ‚Äú7 days of happiness.‚Äù But the reason I gave it 4 stars is the check-ins. It‚Äôs a nice way to track your thoughts, sleep patterns and to center yourself. I find it calming to do right before bed because I can get out my thought for a peaceful sleep. It can also track your sleep quality and you can tell them what variables made your sleep good or bad. This is extremely helpful because then you know what to do and what not to do. I am using the free version and getting along fine so far, but it is frustrating how little you can actually do without paying like 70 dollars a year.

author: Potato & Wine
title: suggest de-emphasizing longest streak in favor of current streak as part of being present :)
content:
Calm was my first introduction to meditation, and I‚Äôm still using it one year later. Thank you! Really good guidance for beginners and those growing their practices. A wide variety of themes makes it easy to customize my practice. 

The app is continually improving with new content, more organization, and bug fixes. 

ONE big request: on the Streak stat page, consider highlighting he current streak instead of the overall longest streak. Or hide the longest streak in a menu option that people can look up if they want. The purpose is to stay present feel accomplishment in any current streak, even if it‚Äôs small‚Äîand not be tempted to compare it to my longest past streak and feel bad. It‚Äôs still nice to know the longest, but would prefer on a voluntary basis

author: OtherBlueGirl
title: A pretty cool app (but for a price)
content: I‚Äôve been trying to deal with my anxiety and find ways to calm my mind, and my Apple Health app recommended Calm.  The layout is pretty user friendly and I adore the nature sounds. My major complaint is that the majority of the content is locked by the paywall of Calm Premium. They only have one day locked for a couple of sessions, which makes little sense to me.  I wish that they had a couple of full sessions and stories up for free as a better way to get people to subscribe.  Speaking of that, I also wish they had a monthly subscription.  Not everyone can shell out $70 at any time.  Despite these drawbacks, I‚Äôm still making use of the app. The Breathe feature allows me to select a scene and just breathe and focus on myself for a few minutes.  I‚Äôm sure the other features are great, but I have no way of knowing because I can‚Äôt afford that annual fee.  Add a monthly fee and I‚Äôll be a happy lady!

author: Start Everyday with Calm
title: First Thing First
content: I started using the calm app when I was struggling and things were falling apart. Now I start my day off by meditating with the calm app. I listen to Tamar‚Äôs daily calm and it helps me to focus on what I want to concentrate for self improvement. Calm has helped me to make self care a priority which has improved my relationships with my family and friend. I live more in the moment that helps me to respond with kindness and compassion instead of react with anger and hurt. I now enjoy my own company and am learning to treat myself like I would treat my friends. Calm app has gently encouraged me to reflect on myself and the positive changes just followed. I look forward each morning to start my day listening to Tamara and then now also squeeze in Daily Jay and session with Jeff.

author: Koolaidton
title: Fluidity
content: This app helps me break away from many things that are just thoughts going throughout my head. When my mind is filled with nothingness besides my own feeling of my body and sensations, I‚Äôm not only able to make the best judgement and decisions for myself, but for everyone around me. Mediation is tricky, sometimes you think you‚Äôre too busy for it, or that you‚Äôll be, okay, since you had a great, successful day, but those days add up to bigger picture of peacefulness. Able to focus on you and not the superficial things around you, since all you really can control is how you react to certain things. The first month ive ever tried this, it truly brought peace to my mind so much, tears of joy and calmness dripped onto my jaw!  Thank you Calm and Tamara Levitt!!!!

author: Anya 12 y old
title: AMAZING! But only if‚Ä¶       P.S. PLEASE BUY PREMIUM CALM! ü§©ITS AMAZING üíÜüèΩ‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏èüíÜüèæüíÜüèª‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è
content: Calm is an absolutely amazing app! I just got it and I can already tell that‚Äôs going to help me immensely with my anxiety! All of my feelings get welled up at night and a meditation is extremely helpful to help release all of that stress that I‚Äôm feeling for the upcoming day! However I would like to note, that without premium Calm, you‚Äôre not really going to get anything out of the app at all. Now there is nothing wrong with this ! But I just wanted to let everyone know! Please buy the premium Calm!!! There are so many stories, meditations, and stretching sessions available! I highly recommend this app! And I‚Äôve just started! I can‚Äôt wait to see what else it has in store! I will write another review if anything changes!

author: Yessir11118
title: Thank you
content:
When I say a use calm everyday and night I mean it. It‚Äôs helped me with my anxiety so much. I feel so much more relaxed then before. I have had calm for almost two years now and decided to finally write a review since it‚Äôs so good. Everything about calm makes you feel like everything‚Äôs going to be okay and that your also being wrapped up in a warm hug!

A suggestion: Since I have zero complaints, here‚Äôs a little thing for a sound series since you do some with pop music and such as calm remixes. Try to do some anime songs as a slowed down and calmer version. I bet there are more people out there who would want this as anime can be a sort of relief and break from reality and I find if it were mixed with calm it would be so much better ‚ù§Ô∏è

author: charliecon
title: Sorry, Tamara :(
content:
I just can‚Äôt handle the voice that Tamara uses in her meditations. I wish I had realized how much of the content in the app is with her reading before buying a year. I have no ill will towards Tamara herself, and she seems to be a wonderful person. 

But she puts on this fake voice when she does her readings, and it just sounds like the least genuine thing I‚Äôve ever heard. It completely pulls me out of meditating because it feels so forced and fake. I put on Wind in the Willows for my daughter and Tamara‚Äôs voice sounded borderline inappropriate for kids with how breathy and passionate she tries to sound. 

Tamara, with all respect, PLEASE consider using your normal speaking voice which is already perfectly pleasant! You already have a lovely voice! You don‚Äôt need to go so hard with the breathy false enthusiasm. It genuinely is a deal breaker for so much of the app‚Äôs content and it bums me out.

author: Suzy3127
title: I love Calm!
content: I tried Calm because my therapist thinks I can benefit from meditation.  I was skeptical since I tried some meditation tapes and they made my anxiety worse!  I put on one of their meditation and I felt so much more calm and relaxed afterwards, their stories help me fall asleep on nights when I just couldn‚Äôt settle down and they even have music and meditation for every mood.  I even played the baby shh (one of the sounds they have on there) for my fussy 2 month old niece when she, my brother and sister-in-law came to visit and she settled down and fell asleep quickly!  I am glad they have the option to pay for a yearly subscription as there is no way I can pay monthly.  I highly recommend this app for those who suffer from anxiety, depression and any type of mental illness.  This really does work!

author: ADKegley
title: Change Your Life
content:
Teachers - it‚Äôs free! There is an ENTIRE section for kids of all ages, through college, in addition to the adult courses.

For anyone else, spend the $60 and challenge yourself to listen to just one 12 minute Daily Calm per day. It‚Äôll even remind you at set times.

Before you know it, you will want to go thru all the vast and constantly growing content.

The MasterClasses are fantastic, especially the one on Discovering Happiness. Between meditations on different subjects to short guided yoga segments to OMG the Sleep Stories - this app has honestly changed my life and how I am dealing with every single thing in life, good, bad and ugly. 

There is something for every part of the day. Most segments are a bit over ten minutes but there are longer as well.  There are too many options to list! And even just the sounds (waves to lakes to cat purring) are great to have in the background, especially if like me, you get a little overstimulated and benefit from gentle white noise as a reminder to slow down.

I am so in love with this app!!! Best $60 I‚Äôve spent in ages, although I originally thought it was billed $5/month. At least it prompts me to get as much as I can out of it. 

Make the investment in YOU. I promise you won‚Äôt regret it.

author: Margemary
title: Calm is helping me so much!
content:
I have been using CALM for almost two months .  I love it.  What a perfect way to start my day.  I am actually learning to meditate and be mindful.  Not, just mouthing the words.  I'm almost 72 and this it fills me with happiness to have found this wonderful gift to myself.  Thank you, Calm.
       Update..  I've been using Calm for four months now.  My husband and I do the daily meditation together each morning.  What a great , positive, way to begin our day.  I continue to be amazed by the sleep stories.  They put me right back to sleep if I wake up anxious about something in the middle of the night. A train ride through Siberia, more knowledge about sheep than I could ever imagine, lavender fields.  Smile.  They are like a magic trick. Thank you, Calm, for brightening my life.

author: kaylaberg123
title: Love this app but needs improvements
content: I‚Äôve been using this app every night for a week now and I will say that when it comes to the story section, majority of the people they have reading those stories don‚Äôt really have a soothing, soft voice to help put you to sleep and I‚Äôve seen others complain about that feature also so hopefully they can make some changes. I love the nature sounds like rain and campfire especially since I can set a timer and they will continue to play even when I exit the app! Another thing I love is the lullaby section but I‚Äôm so disappointed that there‚Äôs only 4 to choose from and the only one that puts me to bed/makes me tired is lullaby to the stars. PLEASE add more lullabies that are softer and mellow like lullaby to the stars but please more lullabies would be amazing!!! Overall the app is good but considering I paid for the premium I just wish there were more sounds to choose from

author: Twistedcerebrum
title: Being Calm
content: I have been using Calm for a month now on a regular basis. It took me a while to start using it even though I had a subscription. This year in 2024 I was sitting there analyzing my life, I came up with the one thing I had never exercised was my mind. So I began a journey and formed a habit to get up at 5am and make my tea, then to meditate for 10 minutes while my tea brewed. Ten minutes has now turned into 30 minutes. I feel really calm and it seems I have been gaining more focus on all aspect of my life. Now I wake up in the morning and am very excited to meditate and gets some daily wisdom from the instructors. The best part is this journey is just the beginning. I love you all and hope other people can find the harmony I have found.

author: JCAJ_15
title: Please Add User Profiles within the App
content: Since it‚Äôs launch, my son and I use Calm religiously. We love it; however, I am becoming frustrated because every time I open the app at the end of the evening I am bombarded with choices for my child since he was the last user. He constantly on favorites pieces that I have favorite because he thinks he is on his account, and I lose my favorites category to choose from because sessions come and go. Please add the capability for family accounts, or for my son to access his profile so I can access my profile, this would help immensely reduce the frustration of having to filter through content that is not related to either of us when trying to choose a sleep story a soundscape or music at bedtime.

author: guayanese mango chutney, MD
title: I‚Äôve never heard the end of my story once!
content: I could never recommend this enough. I have adhd and anxiety. Falling asleep some nights seems impossible with all of my racing thoughts and restlessness, and I have used medicinal sleep aids, meditation, reading by nightlight, and every other solution available before I found calm. The sleep stories give me just enough stimulus that I can tune out my thoughts and lull myself to sleep. I would never have dreamed of a solution with such simple effectiveness as the calm app.  I have been using this app for 3 years, and have always listened to the same story, Blue Gold by Phoebe Smith. I can quote the first half word for word, but to this day I have never heard how the story ends. So rarely do I have to resort to medicine anymore. Thank you creators!!

author: aeaeae242424
title: Don‚Äôt ever take away Jeff Warren
content: It was down to 3 stars at this time last year. Content had taken a nosedive. I was bored and losing value. Understandably, times were and are tough. You stepped it up in the past six months but Jeff Warren has been a game changer. Real, accessible, fun, calm, differentiated and tangible learnings. Scripted, but unscripted in delivery. Not in the perfect lulu gear. Great job‚Äîsomeone who sounds like you, with vulnerabilities AND higher teachings. Now please decrease the random music and enrich the areas of the app that reinforce why we came. 5 stars for the daily trip, but please simplify. The most critical categories under the meditation tab are really thin and stale. Thanks for all you do and for also providing even a few nights where our children can dream in color‚Ä¶

author: JLE546
title: Give it TIME!
content: I have been using Calm for just over a year and my goodness what a wonderful thing meditation is using Calm. I am a 57 year old male with undiagnosed ADD, I have been dealing with Depression, Anxiety, thoughts of Suicide and just overall mental health issues for ALL of my life. I started Calm and I was skeptical and played around with it for the first few months and didn‚Äôt think it would really help. Well I am here to tell you that the meditation instructors at Calm for the best. Yes, I tried other meditation methods and apps. But, Calm is in my opinion the best. So do yourself a favor and give it time don‚Äôt give up and focus on your Self-Care using Calm and you will reap the benefits of using Calm. I am in such a better place now. I am not sure where I would be without Calm. Thank You !!

author: kbm31419
title: Valuable resource in and out of the classroom
content: Applied to get this app to use as an educator in a middle school classroom. It was a constant in my room all year and into our distance learning time. We listened to meditations and music and sounds to calm and inspire. During our independent reading times I would project the fireplace image and sounds, other days the mountains and lake or a summer meadow. It became a fabulous part of our cultural. Now I have ‚Äúbreathing moments‚Äù during our Zoom classes. I share my screen and the students listen and watch. I truly appreciate the Calm app. I hope to continue using it in my classroom and encourage you to try it in your own. The students and I love it. (Their favorite was the Labron James‚Äôs series.) Thank you for this valuable resource!

author: maikawari
title: The best mediation app there is
content: I absolutely LOVE how these 10 mins sessions are designed. So effective and can easily fit in my morning routines, I rarely start my day without it now.  I love the beautiful combination of silence mediation/breath work and the inclusion of a strong moral message of the day at the end of each session. I have been using it for over a  year now, however I am excited to yet explore the other aspects of the app, that are geared to other parts of the day/emotions.  Tamara‚Äôs voice is so calming ( good choice of app name ;) and I really appreciate when she uses her own stories for the listener to resonate with. I salute you Tamara for carefully curating the lessons here and spreading the positivity  we need to love and accept ourselves first in order to give it back to the world. Thank you. Bless you and your beautiful efforts.

author: Collin Beder
title: Meditation will change your life for the best, I‚Äôm not kidding.
content: I don‚Äôt ever write reviews on apps, this is the first one that I have ever done, so this app is saying a lot already. I am a 25 y/o male and I‚Äôve been struggling with self esteem & confidence issues for pretty much my whole life. About 3 months ago I started religiously meditating daily, not kidding you, its a boost to my self, everyday. It‚Äôs one of those things that if you don‚Äôt do it for the day, it gives you the consciousness to know that you could feel better by meditating.. when you‚Äôre feeling down, feeling stressed, not worth it, or just literally anything, Calm has a meditation for it. If this is your first time learning to meditate, give this app a shot and stick with it. It‚Äôs literally like an inner super power. Good luck with your self improvement! Much love!

author: Yogi bear 2015
title: Excellent
content: A friend at work told me about Calm. I have been experiencing anxiety and wanted to try meditating. I want going to take a class, but this app came along. First, I used the free options: falling asleep to the stories (I love this! Like being a kid.  It is really soothing!) & meditations in the morning. I could feel a difference in how I was feeling in a few days, so I paid for the yearly subscription. Probably the cost of two sessions with a teacher. Now, I meditate every morning (daily calm and one other, depending on how I'm feeling) and it starts my day in new frame of mind. My husband has been doing them with me, too.  He was never interested in anything like this. I recommend this app to anyone looking to try meditation and sleep better. It's a part of my daily life now and it's making my life better!

author: Tramaine Montell
title: This App is Helping to Save my Life!
content: As a young adult in a chapter of my life that feels like the clich√© ‚Äúmidlife crisis,‚Äù this app Does the opposite from all the other apps I wake up to with overwhelming notifications of messages and news and advertisements, it instead since me a reasonable and digestible amount of very positive and encouraging and affirming notifications seemingly when I need them the most! In the moments, I‚Äôm overwhelmed and don‚Äôt know what to do. I‚Äôve gotten a notification from Calm that says, ‚ÄúOverwhelmed? Take a moment to breathe. Feel your feet on the floor, etc‚Ä¶‚Äù these moments, save me from spiraling into my PTSD, anxiety, ADHD, and even feelings of wanting to give up on life. Usually after the help of the app, I get up and I take on the next action with a calm mind. üôèüèæ‚ù§Ô∏è

author: Bingley52522
title: New Homepage
content: I‚Äôm not happy with the new look of the home page. You‚Äôve tried to cram too much content on that page so that it now looks busy and cluttered, which is exactly the opposite of the name and theory behind calm. It‚Äôs also harder to find past episodes of the Daily Calm. Before the change, if I missed a session w Tamara or Jeff, I could simply scroll down to where their recent episodes‚Ä¶ the ones I hadn‚Äôt listened to yet‚Ä¶ were grouped. Now I have to leave the homepage to search for them. I get that you‚Äôre trying to offer new options to clients, but putting too many options on the home page makes it harder to find the stuff I come here for‚Ä¶ maybe rethink the design of the app? More choices are not necessarily better‚Ä¶

author: Alltheluna
title: College Student's Go-To-App
content:
I know as a college student I'm not the majority population of this app and 30-60$ for a subscription is definitely still steep to me but I can honestly say this app is life changing.

I was diagnosed with severe ADHD and depression which is a wonderful combination of no focus and no sleep. I was recommended to start a mindfulness practice and it took about a month of cutting out my coffee budget to buy my first subscription.

I've been a member for 3 years now and I always make sure to have this in my budget: I finally have a regular sleep cycle, my focus has improved greatly, and I was able to reduce the amount of medication I had to take.

People who have known me for years have noticed I'm happier, kinder, and FAR less stressed. It took about a month or two for me to  really commit myself but I have not regretted it since and I'm actually saving up for the lifetime subscription! 

TD;DR: It looks pricey, it takes time, but it's worth it and it works.

Update: finally saved enough to get the lifetime subscription, it‚Äôs my go to app for sleep and stress relief and was absolutely worth the money. Really hoping they expand more on the breathe bubble and sleep soundscapes!

author: DarinLogan
title: Calm changed my life.. literally!
content: For the past 4-5 years I have had sleep insomnia, I‚Äôll lay down in bed early, turn everything off, relax and get comfortable, and still my wheels turn for hours. When I do fall asleep I never dream, and I wake up about every hour tossing and turning, even if initially falling asleep on my back. I tried this app by referral, and the first thing I listened to was ‚ÄúWonder‚Äù narrated by Matthew Mcconaughey. I‚Äôm still not exactly sure how, but I must‚Äôve fallen asleep shortly before the story was over. I had a dream that seemed to make up for the past few years because it went on forever. I slept for 7 hours, only waking up twice. Needless to say, I will be using this app regularly. I‚Äôm very grateful for everyone who puts effort into this app. As cheesy as it may sound, it‚Äôs changing my life.

author: We love Alex
title: A lifesaver for going back to sleep
content:
My husband passed away unexpectedly, and I immediately started waking up after being asleep for a couple of hours and not being able to fall back asleep. I became desperate to figure out how to get back to sleep fast.

That‚Äôs when I searched for sleep apps and liked the way Calm sounded.

I don‚Äôt know what I would do without the sleep stories. I put one on when I wake up at night and within 5 to 10 minutes I‚Äôm back asleep. They constantly add new ones,  and I really love the travel ones. They also have sleep meditations that work great too. I don‚Äôt like hokey meditations as I am a Christian. These are straight forward and practical. They have fantastic meditation series for daytime that as a bonus helps me stay focused as well as help to cope with grief and anxiety. 

If I‚Äôm waiting somewhere like a doctors office, they have master classes on different subjects like parenting that I can listen to as well.

This app is a must have if you struggle to go to sleep or stay asleep or simply want to help stay in control more of your emotions. It is truly a God send and a blessing worth every penny.

I‚Äôm so grateful for it as it has changed our lives. My daughter loves the kids bedtime stories too.

author: ComebackMama
title: Helped me make the comeback in ComebackMama
content: Sometimes life sends you a lesson so overwhelming you want to roll up, hide and never come out. This app as part of my morning routine and evening sleep helped to root me in being present and mindful so that I could take the action I needed to make a comeback. I‚Äôm so grateful for this app. I do use a couple of others as well but Calm offers a wide range of what you need. *My only hint to any of you is this ** while you‚Äôre pursuing clam and peace take note that it is present and presence as well as curiosity and acceptance of self that you‚Äôre after. This is what give you the calm before taking action. And, taking action as a centered person who knows who you are and your beliefs, is what will give you more growth and satisfaction in life. I wish you all well. Holly from ComebackMama

author: urbanmusicgal
title: Calm is a life changer
content: I arrived in my senior years worn out and discouraged. My life was changing fast and I didn‚Äôt quite know what to do. My head began to spin as it always did at times like these. Then I read somewhere that mindfulness, and staying in the moment where essential for health and adjustment. I googled ‚Äúmindfulness‚Äù and the first thing that came up was this app, ‚ÄúCalm‚Äù.After a few meditations I knew that I had to you invest in my own health and from the very start I begin relaxing, learning how to stay in a moment, learning how to calm myself down, and learning how to participate in my own life at this age. So I thank ‚ÄúCalm‚Äù so much for this opportunity. I am a senior and my life has changed, slowly and thoroughly, in many details, because of this app called ‚ÄúCalm‚Äù .

author: Shidaya
title: Re-testing
content:
This has been plagued with bugs for some time now and maybe it would be better if I paid for it, but I agree with others, the price is ridiculous. For a while it wouldn‚Äôt open at all, I‚Äôve reinstalled several times and now I can‚Äôt sign in because another button is on top of the sign in button or the ad to buy a subscription won‚Äôt go away. Completely useless! Here was my original review which moves the rating from 5 stars to 1: Whether you are new to meditation, and have no clue where to start, or are skilled, and simply want timers, this app is perfect...and I have only used the free parts of it so far!
Update: The developer contacted me and for now the app is working, but even the link they sent in my email wouldn‚Äôt work, so apparently there have been a lot of changes and bugs are being worked out, we shall see üòâ Meditation shouldn‚Äôt be so stressful to achieve.

author: Dougie_D
title: Great content, not so great app
content: I‚Äôm a premium subscriber and thought I would use the app quite a bit after I downloaded it‚Äîbut that hasn‚Äôt been the case. There‚Äôs some really great content, although the sheer volume of options is overwhelming at times and I often end up exiting without picking anything because I can‚Äôt decide what I need/want most. To me it doesn‚Äôt feel like the app has a unified vision. It‚Äôs trying to be a lot of things all at once, and getting to useful content seems like a chore as I navigate through what seems like numerous screens and ‚Äúgamification‚Äù modules. The overall aesthetics are nice; e.g., color palette, but I find myself wishing there was a super simple version of the app where I could see just my 10 favorite pieces of content and nothing else. I think honestly I would use it a lot more if something like that was available.

author: crosskira
title: Sleep stories!!
content: I‚Äôve struggled with falling asleep for most of my life, where it sometimes takes hours. I do have bouts of not being able to sleep at all. I‚Äôm not sure how this will do during those more intense times, BUT the sleep stories have knocked me out twice now and that is a MIRACLE. I love the celebrity stories and how well they tell them. I‚Äôve always been one to hyper focus on my thoughts or get lost in my day dreams or an annoying sounds so I never thought a sleep story would work, but I realized when I started to fall asleep during a lecture (while I was in my bed) that if I try to focus on something kinda boring I might be able to pass out üòÇ helps my mind not hyper focus! I‚Äôm still in the 7 day free trial so it doesn‚Äôt hurt to try!!

author: BobbiLuvsFood
title: I love this app!
content: I have no regret with downloading this app. This app is so helpful when I am doing work or school and I just need a break from it all. I love all the scenes and sounds you can choose from! My favorite one is the fireplace! My recommendations would be to unlock more of the stories and sleep sounds and maybe add more mood check inns? I am not saying this to be critical at all because I love this app! Just a recommendation! My mom was actually the one who told me to download this app! She uses it all the time! Thank you so much for creating this app it helps me so much! I just started listening to the sleep stories on meditating because I have a lot going on in the pandemic and it helps so much! The creators did a great job in putting their best into this app because this app is the best! ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è

author: Eww David
title: CAN NOT LIVE WITHOUT THIS APP
content: I bought this app during a deployment that was not very easy to get some shut eye. Being military, your body is pretty much trained to pass out whenever your not moving, however after the last few years of deploying, time zone changes, shift swaps, inconsiderate wall mates and the lack of understanding of ‚Äò24 hour quite hours‚Äô i needed something to help relax. This app, paired with Bose noise canceling headphones has saved my sanity. Throw on some bob ross or another wonderful sleep story, let the soothing sounds wash over you and drown out all the mindless chatter of the day. I also love that it plays a ‚Äòscene‚Äô afterwords, needing a constant ‚Äòsound‚Äô to over power the noises outside without being too much and this is perfect. Honestly I don‚Äôt know what I‚Äôd do without this app, especially overseas

author: FuegoTaki
title: Calm > Headspace
content:
I got a free Headspace account through work, but I ended up paying for Calm because I prefer it and ended up using it way more often. I find the guided meditations better suited for what I want in my meditation time  - A little less talking, more breathing, a choice between a female and male narration (I find the female voice to be less judgmental for some reason) and topic-focused, CBT-based thought reframing. I feel more centered and inspired after each session!

The sleep stories and sleep sound libraries have become a favorite feature I didn‚Äôt know I wanted. I‚Äôve been having some stress-related insomnia here and there, and the bedtime audio options pair really well with a lavender essential oil diffuser for relaxation and creating an enjoyable sleep hygiene routine. 

Keep it up, Calm team! I love this product.

author: tcyvgigviyygvicygycgyct
title: Don‚Äôt get this appüëéüèª
content: Why u ask? WellEverything is locked and so you can‚Äôt get to any of the good music he can‚Äôt do any fun stuff so you get a week free day trial but the. It‚Äôs 69 dollars a year! I am not poor but just it i just can‚Äôt really do it I mean I feel like everything should be free except for like the really good songs maybe but it‚Äôs very bright like all of them are locked so it‚Äôs no relaxing very much because it‚Äôs really boring so do you not get this app you‚Äôre just wasting your time and you might want to delete it later so I got this app so I could fall asleep better but I can‚Äôt fall asleep with all the things off and so they really got to chill and unlock some things it‚Äôs just so dumb so if someone‚Äôs reading this please unlock some stuff OK because this is on believable so all the rooms were good but to me it wasn‚Äôt that good it was really boring and really dumb and so I Hope song read this and knock some things because it‚Äôs not that cool if everything is locked and I won‚Äôt have you meditate like Fosse and so yeah bye

author: Mrslvb
title: Lifesaver
content: I have been wanting to meditate for a very long time, but never really knew where to start or how to do it. One night I was having an anxiety attack and decided to try and find a meditation app. Calm came up and I decided to look into it. The first thing I saw was the bedtime story ‚ÄúBlue Gold.‚Äù The reader had the most calming voice and the story took my mind back to a trip I had taken to France. I was asleep before the story was finished. In fact, I fall asleep before most of the stories are over and I stay asleep longer. There are so many different offerings, including the meditation I had been wanting. There is limited access to the free portion, so I decided to purchase the yearly subscription, and I am so happy I did. Really worth trying.

author: c hoffman
title: Cured my Insomnia
content: I had a hard time getting to sleep.  My crazy work load, a problem boss, I could not shut down my brain.  The sleep stories and meditations took my brain down a much calmer path.  I fall asleep so fast.  I have yet to finish one of the stories.  Just like when I was a child.  In the middle of the night I wake up and my brain runs off into Worryland.  Find another sleep story or meditation and I am back in dreamland.  No laying there staring at the ceiling, winding myself up.  There is a meditation for when the office gets overwhelming and I escape for a 5 minute break with my earbuds.  Calm sounds drown out the noisy office.  Words of wisdom for every situation.  Even movement to improve my wellbeing.  Which reminds me.  I need to do my daily move.  Ciao!

author: arce12345678
title: Nice meditations, lacks personalized organization capabilities
content: Enjoy using Calm and appreciate the attempt to include mental health tools in an insurance plan by allowing insurance sponsorship. My only critique is that it‚Äôs difficult to find specific things. The only way to save something that interests me for later is to add it to my favorite list. But if I add the first meditation in a series I have trouble finding the series later. Or finding something that I had seen but didn‚Äôt as to my favorite list. Or knowing what I‚Äôve listened to before but had unfavorited. It would be nice to see things that have been played and to be able to save things and favorite them separately. It would also be nice to be able to search for a title and save a whole series until I‚Äôve been able to complete it.

author: Judy N, Berkeley, CA
title: Calm app is great for reframing brain and body
content:
I appreciate the short daily meditations which quickly and easily change my brain‚Äôs focus, stress level, and teach me in minutes how to create positive energy and relaxation in my my body in as little as 7-10 minutes in the morning. 

 The teachers use science and their many years of hands-on teaching and interesting real life examples to make the short sessions fun, interesting and impactful.  Free library of speakers including recognizable persons such as Matthew Maconaughy, LeBron James as well as other international speakers.  

The subscription is a goldmine for less than $6 for a month with a one year purchase. Cheaper than an exercise membership or therapy consultation and produces immediate results.  Highly recommended.

author: penguinchild
title: This is great.
content: I‚Äôve had a few meditation apps before. I like this one a lot. My insurance company gave me a free year of the premium. I have been able to pull myself out of triggering moments. I‚Äôve done group meditation in person before and some chanting as well. Personally, I am unable to sit, so I lie down. I also cannot visualize images in my mind.
