There are plenty of options in this app for simple mindfulness meditations which focus on breathing. My journey thus far has brought up suppressed emotions and tears as well as reset my emotions to a more joyous state even after ten minutes. The variety of teachers makes it a novel experience, so I haven‚Äôt gotten bored yet. I like the simplicity of 10 minute sessions. Makes it easy to stick to a practice.

author: Jules playz
title: Great but...
content:
Calm app is awesome for when it is thundering outside because I can put sounds on. Calm covers every need I have especially considering I get frustrated easily. My counselor showed me this app, and I loved it. The only thing is that whenever you log in, sometimes it just glitches you right back out of the app. About every year there is also this time, and for about a week calm just freezes and kicks me out of the app. You also have to pay to use calm for a year. If you don‚Äôt pay, it will only give you like 1 soundscape, 1 song, 1 book ETC. So I wish calm could not have the membership part, and I wish calm will one day fix all the glitches that come out. Thanks for reading! 
(I still love this app though!!!)

author: Ella1289
title: Best purchase you will make all year!
content: This app has completely changed my life. Ever since I started using it, I now sleep all night without waking up once. Before I would wake up to battle with thoughts about the day ahead or past mistakes or even excited about the next day and wouldn‚Äôt get the rest I needed to face the day. Also the daily meditations have helped me stay focused at work when I need to and give me boost to finish my day without feeling overwhelmed and super tired. The more you practice the more mindful and present you become and this brings you a sense of peace, joy that I had never experienced before. If you are not sure wether to purchase or not, don‚Äôt think about it any more, give it a try you won‚Äôt regret it!

author: DarrinOfEarth
title: Changed me
content: I needed something. For years I needed centering. I‚Äôve always tried meditating but just couldn‚Äôt make it happen. I started with the free calm app. Tried the 7 days of Calm. 10 minute timed meditations. I skipped days, on days I did practice my mind wandered. Sometimes weeks went by before I practiced again. But every time I did it, it got better. I got more out of it. My anxiety lessened and then disappeared. Joyfulness snuck into my everyday life. Mindfulness has become a daily necessity for me. I just beat my streak and am progressing happily. Currently on a 140 day mindfulness streak and am so thankful for what I have learned through this app. No, you do not need it to practice mindfulness but the guidance has been so beneficial to my daily practice. I will never give this up and am thankful that I found this app.

author: RoAnne23
title: Love it, has helped me so much
content:
I have anxiety, depression, and nerve pain (peripheral neuropathy). Plus lots of regular life stress with family, work.  Downloaded this app after trying out another one referred by a friend.  That didn‚Äôt work as well for me. 
Was drawn to Calm because of the soothing background options. Used sporadically at first, now I use it in the morning regularly, and at night if I can.  At night I like inner peace and self-care meditations. 
The sleep stories are the best. I have disturbed sleep and wake up around 3 or 4 am. Instead of staying up overthinking and in pain for hours like I used to do, I listen to the nightly sleep story. Now I fall back to sleep within minutes and don‚Äôt get to finish the whole story. Favorites so far have been Bob Ross and Sleeping Beauty read by Nick Viall from The Bachelor.

author: Obenshc
title: Never Hear the Ending
content:
I signed up for CALM quite awhile ago.  There are many times I have not been able to go to sleep... my mind is racing with various lists of tasks, projects, paperwork and everyday life responsibilities that have to be tended to.  CALM is my drug free alternative. It is nights like tonight that it gives me the most for my money.  I have my next chemo treatment tomorrow.  There are times when I am okay and can sleep, but recently it hasn‚Äôt been that easy.   So I turn to the app and I am usually out in 15 minutes.  I have yet to make it thru a story.  

I was recently able to use the kids stories on two of my young god children.  I was babysitting one night and they just could not lay down.  I played one of the stories for them... they were not even a year old yet.  I timed it.  SEVEN MINUTES and they were down and out.   SEVEN MINUTES... what a blessing.

I simply love the app.  If you question the benefits of paying for premium membership just keep in mind the monthly fee wouldn‚Äôt even pay for  a month‚Äôs medication so I am just fine paying for
extra content each month.  Especially since I KNOW it works.

Thank  you,
Christina Obenshain

author: jen jingle
title: It could be way better quite easily
content: I used Headspace for years and loved it. My company now pays for the Calm app so I downloaded the app and used it. There‚Äôs one HUGE advantage that headspace has that I think calm could adopt. Any of the narrations that have a soundscape in the background, you have a slider to choose the volume of the narrator‚Äôs voice compared to the soundscape. This may not seem like a big deal, but for sleep stories it‚Äôs a huge deal. For anyone that uses sleep headphones with Calm, like me, in order to get a nice comfortable volume where you can hear the soundscape clearly, you have to turn it up so loud to where the narrator is too loud. Headspace slider takes care of this perfectly. Unfortunately even though my company pays for Calm, I‚Äôd rather pay to use Headapces just because of the slider volume function for sleep stories. If Calm can do the same thing, I‚Äôd gladly use their app. But as it is, Calm isn‚Äôt for me.

author: letuskeeptiktok
title: I love the Calm App!
content: I have been using Calm for almost a year now to help focus my energy somewhere else when I have late night panic attacks. Distraction techniques and most breathing techniques I learn from therapists or psychology classes I am currently taking do not work for me personally. My mind is too swarmed by my fear that I can‚Äôt focus on anything but that fear. Although calm does use breathing techniques, I believe it is not the ‚Äútraditional‚Äù techniques taught in classes. These breathing techniques have you focus on certain parts of your body instead of your breathing itself. When I focus on my breathing, I actually start worrying if I am breathing enough and it doesn‚Äôt help, but calming my breathing through focusing on relaxing every part of my body helps me a lot!

author: Bill Nihillist
title: Buy the premium version! It‚Äôs so worth it!
content:
I‚Äôm getting emotional even writing this review!  This app is everything you could want and more. Between the daily mood check ins, the creative calming stories, the playlists, the sleep aids and the master classes, this app is about so much more than ‚Äújust‚Äù meditation. It‚Äôs a full on mental wellness app, giving you the tools to improve your own life. It prompts important thoughts that you would never think of on your own. If you‚Äôre having trouble in any area of life, this can make a difference. 

Spring for the annual premium package. I never ever buy this kind of stuff but this was so worth it!  I think it was only like $60? And it gives you access to all the things that make this app so special. Plus it‚Äôs much cheaper than therapy lol.

author: Scmsmezzo
title: Incredibly expensive and glitchy, months between new stories
content: I have had Calm for quite some time and they have gotten far too much of my money. The sleep stories are great, but the app is NOT intuitive or user friendly and there are no helps. It crashes at random times in the middle of a story or meditation, shutting off and going back to the home page of my phone or iPad. My daughter and I like the stories for kids the best, but they have added only 1 story in the past 4 months. It‚Äôs well nigh impossible to tell what subscription you have because there is a list of 15 different price renewal options. I found out mine has been auto renewing for $15 per month, making this literally the most expensive app in my life. For that much, there should be way better helps in the app and I should be able to use it for more than 4 mins at a time without it crashing, kicking me out, or freezing up my device.

author: Tina Hatris
title: No COVID19 topics & little new content
content:
I was gifted Calm as a gift and really enjoyed it initially. However in these uncertain & stress inducing times, Calm has not addressed it. The Daily Calm hasn‚Äôt address it and seems disconnected from what is happening.  This was my meditation app & it‚Äôs very disappointing that there‚Äôs nothing to address the stress and anxiety and roller coaster of emotions that have come with COVID19. 

Additionally, the meditation options have not changed much in the 3+ months that I‚Äôve had the app. The breath of topics are wonderful but once you completed the available meditations, that‚Äôs it, no more are offered. For example, I stared the kids meditation with my daughters and they loved it but there were only 4 sessions offered for their age group & after awhile they refused to repeat the same meditation they had already done that week.  

 It started out very promising but has fallen short. I was very disappointed that the meditation offerings did not grow over time.

author: jocerizz38
title: Fantastic, but.... üòï
content: So i‚Äôve been using calm for a few days, and it is really helping me!! This app is so great, and i feel relaxed and clam when i use it! But i was going to do seven days of sleep, and i had already done the one day. I tried to do the next day, but i needed calm premium in order to do this! So that‚Äôs one of the problems! There is barely anything you can do on there when you don‚Äôt have calm premium! And another thing is that i feel like $70 is a lot for one year! I mean like, get it, like you need to make money, but you should try to lower the price just a bit! But that‚Äôs just my opinion. So i really do think that it‚Äôs a good app and all, those two things just really got me! But as i said before, it‚Äôs a rally great app for meditating and all, like it is calming and relaxing!

author: longtooh
title: Greedy
content: Thought I would try out the app? (I have trouble sleeping and been depressed lately) Think Again!!!  Unfortunately you can‚Äôt even get a trial unless you have $70 to give them for a 1 year subscription up front?!?!  My first thought when I heard about this app was that someone coming up with this idea would genuinely care and want to help people?!?!  Boy was I WRONG and disappointed when I found out that,  ‚Äúsurprise surprise surprise‚Äù they‚Äôre just like most everyone else and it‚Äôs all about the $$$MONEY$$$!!!!!  These little things are what end up pushing people over the edge... (because now I‚Äôm REALLY not tired and even MORE DEPRESSED) So, Thank You Calm!!!  Your app had the exact opposite effect that I was hoping for and all I did was want to check out what I thought looked and sounded like a great thing? Unfortunately I‚Äôm not rich and apparently they only offer a 1 year and not a monthly subscription? Hope the people that can afford all the good things in life enjoy this as well...  Did Donald Trump invent this app???

author: Ehrehrhehrhehrhehrhehrhe
title: Such a good app
content: This app is amazing and has helped me fall asleep so much easier(I‚Äôm not a hard sleeper) and has honestly been really helpful in the past year and a half because I‚Äôve had a lot on my mind and usually can‚Äôt even lay down for a good period of time before getting distracted by a text message or something else like that. But the sleep stories help me focus on one thing and one thing only instead of going off on a thousand different tangents and never going to sleep. Some stories that I would recommend are beauty and the beast narrated by Alan Sklarr, the nine worlds narrated by Erik Braa, and journey to the stars narrated by Levar Burton. Anyways this app is very helpful and is definitely a good choice if you have trouble falling asleep at night

author: NutrA348
title: Life Saver
content: I became a lifetime subscriber of calm a couple years back from a Black Friday deal. It was once of the best purchases I‚Äôve ever made. I had been wanting to meditate more and this has given me all the tools I need without being too overwhelming. I have anxiety so it‚Äôs been helping me deal with that. I do the daily calm almost every day. I feel like using this has help me to start my day off in a more positive note. Also, currently I am going through a breakup which inspired me to write this review. I have been doing multiple meditations from the app daily and it has been such a huge help in getting though different feelings and emotions when they arise. Highly recommend Tamara‚Äôs heartbreak meditation. Incredibly grateful for this app.

author: dawnfromcamano island
title: An Integral Part of My Day
content: I've been using the Calm app daily for nearly a year & it has been life-changing. I feel more centered, thought-full, relaxed & well, calm! Each day brings a new topic for meditation with the same very soothing voice--thank you, Tamira. There are multiple choices of sounds & visualizations if you choose to use one. There are many guided meditations with a wide variety of topics. And just when I thought this app was perfection, I find the introduction of Sleep Stories.  I have told several people about this app & they are also finding it beneficial. One parent uses the app with their anxious child. I am gifting this app to two friends for Christmas. My warmest thanks to the folks at Calm for what I consider to be the Best App Ever!

author: Buc Fan
title: Tamara and Calm are Awesome
content: Today in my gratitude journal I noted I‚Äôm grateful for Tamara, a woman I‚Äôve never met and likely never will meet. When I graduated college 26 years ago I meditated for a while and it helped, but alas, I got out of the habit of making time for myself and 25 years went by before I‚Äôd find this app. It‚Äôs wonderful. Tamara is such an excellent guide with her comforting assurances that it‚Äôs okay to be restless or experience whatever emotions are distracting you, and gently bringing you back to the breath. I could go on, but I‚Äôll just finish by saying that Tamara and the other guides are superb and I am starting to love starting my day with Tamara‚Äôs daily calm. Like any other habit it takes time. Please invest that time in yourself because you‚Äôre worth it and you will benefit.

author: KayWood111
title: Does not honor their gift cards. Poor customer service
content: Unfortunately, I had a 50% off 12 month promo and also had asked for a giftcard for Christmas for the year that would be enough to cover the discounted price, which I received. Well Calm does not honor their giftcards the way most businesses do and would not let me redeem my giftcard to pay for the promo (credit card only). It was a waste of money and I lost out on 6 months of this expensive app because they would not honor their own giftcard as a form of payment. Customer service was no help and would not offer to assist me in correcting the matter. Of course giftcards are also non refundable, so it was just a waste. I‚Äôm not even sure how this is legal‚Ä¶ I doubt it is. Once I reached out, I am just in disbelief that they still would not help me or extend my membership by the remaining time at least. This is all so unfortunate since the app itself is nice. The company does not seem to value their customers.

author: A adreamer
title: App suggestions
content:
This app is great, and has a wide variety of music, stories and soundscapes for sleeping. I just wish there were a few things. 1. I wish there was a way to load multiple stories at once, like a playlist so they could just start one after the other. 2. I would love it if when you pulled up a story or at the end of a story they had maybe like 3 other story suggestions that were similar to what you had just picked. (Like if I pick ‚Äúdreams‚Äù read by Harry Styles, they would have 3 additional story suggestions that were similar). 
3. I love the stories with music in the background, I would enjoy having this option on more stories. 

Other then that, this is a great app with so many options.

title: Something for everyone
content: I have had a subscription to CALM for about 3 years. I started after the death of my husband and then into a retirement that didn‚Äôt look like anything I had planned it to be. I have slowly learned to stay with the present, return to the present and accept the present. The offerings are extensive and frequently new. The authors are knowledgeable and relatable. I do 3 minute meditations, 10 minute meditations, an hour meditation,  and  use their soundscapes and music often. I would suggest trying it for a year because it takes a while to  make healthy habits and adjustments. The rewards are profound. Not ‚Äúwoo woo‚Äù, just opening up to appreciation and awareness of our amazing time here as much as we are able.

author: E.M. 78225
title: Borderline fraudulent.
content:
Bought the original version. After the original update, it became a subscription service. Now, after the latest update, it won‚Äôt even open. Don‚Äôt bother.
** I have added one star because they at least took the effort to fix the fact that it wouldn‚Äôt open. It worked, but I had figured that out 3 weeks before their response. I still am not happy that as an early adopter to this app, I helped pave the way for a subscription app that is several times more expensive than my original purchase. This was the first and only app that I had ever paid for, and this is the perfect example why I don‚Äôt buy apps.  I liked what I purchased, but it has changed into something completely different, and now I have to pay extra to enjoy its full benefit. Bad karma folks. Thanks for trying to help me with part of my issue. If you want anything more from me, you‚Äôll have to address the full complaint.**

author: SpenceMMA
title: Calm helped me break the barrier to begin meditating
content:
Like many things, I find that getting started is commonly the biggest barrier, and meditation has not been different. Finding the time, space, or even method to meditate used to deter me from doing it, and I wasn‚Äôt even sure if I was doing it correctly- which discouraged me from continuing the process. 

Calm has helped me enter a headspace which is relaxing, and the guided meditations give me just enough of an outline to lead me into a meditative state in seconds. The app also acknowledges when you get a daily consecutive streak, which I find very encouraging!

I would still consider myself a novice at meditation, but with the help of this app, it no longer feels like an impossible, scary thing. Thanks, Calm!

author: Breakfast smoothie
title: Perfect app, until recent update
content: This app helped me through the post-pandemic time, when I had high anxiety and was trying to get back to my old self. I started meditating every day and using sleep stories to help with nighttime anxiety. I told everyone about it and downloaded it for my kids. More recently, the update to the app now highlights the weekly streak, to the point where the app feels obsessed with the number of times I used it in a week. If the point of the app is to reduce anxiety, this new feature is doing the exact opposite. Who cares about my streak!?! What‚Äôs important is that I use it to support myself as needed. The streak tracker feels very self serving on the part of Calm, to ensure eye balls on the app, and is a HUGE disappointment. I find myself using it less. Please change this feature!!! Return to actually presenting yourself as a calm app!

author: K.r.w0990
title: Love it
content: I‚Äôve had the CALM app for a while now and it‚Äôs been literally sleep-saving! I have terrible anxiety at night I‚Äôll wake up and can‚Äôt get back to sleep because of all my random thoughts however I recently started letting the CALM sleep stories/music/etc. play all night versus the first 30 mins I‚Äôm in bed and I‚Äôm now sleeping through the night even after getting up to use the bathroom I easily fall back to sleep. Lastnight it wasn‚Äôt on (my fault) however once I turned on the thunderstorms I was out within minutes. Love all the features available but nothing more then it‚Äôs ability to help me sleep. Even my husband like to hear it as he‚Äôs falling asleep, and of course my kiddos love the kids sleep stories! Thank you CALM!

author: Allie-Woo
title: Invest in yourself! It‚Äôs worth it!
content: Calm, has changed my life for the better. This mindfulness practice has helped me deal with anxiety! It has helped me internally, locate how I feel! How to handle emotions, how to accept uncertainty! Self acceptance! Life‚Äôs changes, It has taught me to live in the moment! To really be fully present in the moment! That‚Äôs all we got is our breath and the moment ! Really breathe, listen to my body! Release my need to control and go with the flow! I could go on and on! I love all my teachers! I truly appreciate what they‚Äôve done in my life! Self discovery at its finest! This calm app is one of the best investments I‚Äôve ever made for myself! Tamara, Jeff, Jay! I am grateful for y‚Äôall! Thank you so much! Y‚Äôall are really out here making huge impacts on ppls life‚Äôs!‚ù§Ô∏è

author: ZurilovesSerenityxxxx

They constantly made me feel like the bad guy. Even doing this made me feel bad and guilty because I took this moment for myself. Now I feel much better then when I first started. author: JCastillo OCS

author: NJCameraLuver
title: It should be better
content: I‚Äôm comparing this app with my favorite meditation app, which is surprisingly Peloton‚Äôs app. I don‚Äôt like the lack of new content on Calm. Also, most of the meditations seem to be led by Tamara Levitt and I find her voice to be more annoying than soothing. She talks like a cinematic actress or a hypnotist and not just a person doing a meditation. What I love about Peloton is that they‚Äôre constantly adding new content and you have 5 different people you can listen to for all sorts of meditations. I think different personalities will speak to you and this app is disappointing, especially considering it‚Äôs $70/yr subscription. I‚Äôm also not into sleep stories. I want a nice 10-15 minute meditation before I go to bed and I want choice and perhaps some New Age music playing in the background. After having it several months I‚Äôve cancelled the subscription since I now favor Peloton to Calm.

author: JackH27895
title: The best meditation app
content:
I never leave reviews, but this app is so good I had to give it 5 stars. Meditation is my passion, and I‚Äôve tried every app; Calm is by far the best. The ability to have and change the background noise is a total game changer! The sound scapes are wonderful falling asleep tools, and the variety of voices keeps things fresh. 
But my favorite feature by far is the ability to manually enter meditation you do off the app- it allows for a better record of your habits. Calm premium is worth every penny, I recommend it to all my students (I‚Äôm a yoga teacher) and my friends and family as well. Calm is the perfect tool for beginners, as well as the perfect tool for intermediate & advanced meditators because it‚Äôs got such a wide variety of topics. I‚Äôd give it more stars if I could.

author: G. Yundt
title: Essential daily app
content: I reached for this app when I was going through a period of feeling really run down and drained. Some other life events were happening and I needed some extra help to get through. The short and long meditations, daily meditations, and sleep stories made a huge difference. Luckily life has come back around, but even though I'm not in a slump I'm still enjoying the daily meditations that I do first thing in the morning and a sleep story at night. Sometimes if I have a break in the day I'll do a guided nap or a quick meditation- especially on a hard day. I love this app and use it almost every day. I highly recommend it to my friends and coworkers, especially if stressed or having trouble sleeping.

author: Tex B
title: Bait and Switch
content: There should be a third category free, charge, and brief experience. Since it is probably is not your fault I gave 5 stars as the 3 free minutes I found before I deleted the app had great content. SUGGESTION: 1. clearly label the free stuff. 2. Give the free stuff away without having to jump thru a bunch of hoops. 3. Don‚Äôt give any free stuff away in this situation so the customer knows what they are truly getting. Most customers like me a used to a generous amount of free content such that they can make an informed decision Thanks

author: SFDoug
title: Literally life changing
content: I‚Äôve tried to incorporate meditation into my life so many times over the years, yet only since starting with the Calm app have I succeeded. The app has so much variety ‚Äî from 1-minute to much longer guided meditations, varying approaches and diverse teachers or meditation leaders. There‚Äôs always something helpful there. I‚Äôve gone from just the Daily Jay (Jay Shetty) mindfulness lessons to now turning to the Calm app 3 times most days - a mindful start with the Daily Jay, a midday break with one of the work-related meditations or one of the nap programs, and an evening mindfulness check-in. Everyone around me sees the difference. Most importantly, I see the difference. I‚Äôm coming up on 365 consecutive days of this, and I‚Äôm not going to stop.

author: Smitz11
title: No real HomePod integration
content: Would be 5 stars besides the fact that you can‚Äôt ask Siri to play the daily calm.   For example if you can‚Äôt sleep they are asking to open your phone (waking you up more!) to then open the app, select a sleep story, open the air play menu, then finally select a HomePod from the menu.  What‚Äôs even the point?  If I even glance at my fantasy league or some thing because I opened my phone for calm because I can‚Äôt ask my HomePod to just play calm.  The Siri shortcut is no better you have to continue on your iPhone, same thing look at your phone.  The money you pay this should‚Äôve been taken care of by now.  Apple has given the developer the tools with Sirikit media.  This is not unreasonable and for a app claiming to be about mindfulness you‚Äôd figure less screen time would be a top goal.  If this isn‚Äôt resolved by the end of my subscription year I won‚Äôt be renewing.  Content great, falls on app development

author: Yahtzee Game Fiend
title: Bait and Switch
content: I would give this app a 0star if I could simply because while the app is free to download you can‚Äôt access any of the stories,meditations etc. without a subscription. Yes they offer a 7 day free trial but if you do t continue the subscription the app is basically useless I found 2 things I could access without paying and even if you can download during the free trial once you cancel you only have what you could download and how many time will one want to listen to the same story/ meditation or whatever. I really feel they should explain in their ads that a subscription is needed the they are advertising to people with anxiety sleep issues etc so I feel it‚Äôs terrible business practice to offer people hope of some relief and then say oh but you must pay for it even though we said it‚Äôs free technically the app is free but it‚Äôs useless

author: bugüçÄ

content: Hi I am really enjoying the calm app. At first I did not like the sound of Tamra Levitt voice because it wasn‚Äôt relaxing to me. She narrates the majority of the meditations. But I am getting used to her voice and also there are a lot of meditations where you have the option of a male narrator with a more calming voice. I do wish they had a female narrator with a lower tone voice. It‚Äôs important to have a variety of voices and not use one voice for the majority of the meditations because that voice could not soothe some people. But so far I am really enjoying the app because it is helping me limit my social media activity and I just feel better being on this app then on Instagram or TickTock etc.

author: AnxiousSleeeper
title: Not well thought-out
content:
I decided to purchase it primarily for sleep stories. And after my free trial has expired I realised that I am stuck with primarily stories recorded by people that have no business recording sleep stories. I realised that I am deeply annoyed by high pitch whispering and the ‚Äú S‚Äù sounds pronounced unnecessarily loud making me jump in bed each few seconds. Calm app makers! Please hire more people with sweet and velvety voices that are ACTUALLY soothing or adjust audio recording to smooth those sounds out. ( or put it as an option for listeners)There is a reason every classical singer out there is trained to smooth their Ts and Ss so the songs are actually enjoyable.
So far the only truly soothing story I found was read by Matthew Mcconaughey. That‚Äôs a lot of money to pay for very little use I am getting.

author: BonJard
title: Great sleep stories
content: As adults, we often forget how effective a bedtime story is to help us sleep. I guess that‚Äôs why our parents read them to us as kids to calm us down and get us to drift off to sleep. We perpetuate the practice with our own children and they will with theirs. It‚Äôs a magical formula that seems to work like a charm every time. This app has some of the best sleep stories for grownups and kids alike. The narrators are very skilled at reading softly and slowly and the stories often interjecting sleep suggestions get your mind prepared for sleep. One of my favorites is Harry Styles who‚Äôs soft droning voice has lulled me to sleep many a night. I highly recommend this app for everyone. I got it through my health insurance plan and it‚Äôs one of the best services they‚Äôve ever provided.

author: Margaco
title: Calm is the best App

I recommend this app to everyone right now because everyone needs to meditate and almost everyone has A hard time sleeping at times. author: CMB1310

content: Hello first of all this is a great app and has so many wonderful ways to help with emotions, meditation and general well being. During my free app usage I did not really get use out of the different programs mainly I got it to listen to stories from certain actors whom I love the sound of their voices. I‚Äôm sure she is a wonderful person but I have a hard time with the whistle at the end of her sentences and the use of the letter ‚ÄúS‚Äù. I am SO over lululemon!‚Äù ‚ÄúOMG she‚Äôs such a boomer!‚Äù ‚ÄúOmg! Is that a wrinkle!?!?!? [SCREAMS]. The app would be great but I bought it for sleep meditation. author: ilovemysleep123
title: Helps insomnia!
content: I have been dealing with insomnia for years now. I‚Äôve tried herbs, oils, prescription meds, diet, exercise, and bedtime routine. All work for a short period of time, but the night waking with the incessant thoughts never end. I looked into meditation and came across this app. This is the best thing that has ever happened to me! For the first time in years, although I wake up through the night, with the help of the sleep releases and/or the bedtime stories, my mind is quieted and I go back to sleep! I do one meditation through the day and feel it helps me with my focus through the night. I have a ways to go to be an awesome meditator, but this app is awesome! I can‚Äôt stress that enough! I‚Äôve been using it for a month. It has been worth every dollar spent! I highly recommend it!

author: galaxygirl56

content: I am warning you don't buy it is a waste of storage and time. I mean if u have a lot of money and i mean ($62 a year) go ahead spend your money but for the middle class out here we don't have money to be buying useless things we are probably only going to use once. author: Sierra SLP

content: I‚Äôve found help in the supportive, empowering and healing places in Calm. The practitioners are the real deal, and there is variety for individual preferences. The Poetry Pharmacy, Jeff‚Äôs How to Meditate series, the Master Class on Sleep, sleep stories and sleep meditations were favorites early on. It‚Äôs wonderful to have such a rich healing environment always close at hand. These days I meditate solo with the open-ended timer set to a tropical beach wave for background sounds, with bells set for every five minutes‚Äîone set of choices among many options. I also use the 4-7-8 breath pacemaker (one of several) for falling sleep. I‚Äôm grateful Kaiser pays for my subscription but think this is an app worth paying for. A world of calm is a haven in a crazy time.

author: megan corbin

content: When I saw calm I wanted to get it so badly so I did and so now it is helping me a lot. The meditation videos are helping me calm my mind down after a hard day.
