author: shoe_00
title: Did not expect it to change my life.
content:
I haven‚Äôt had this app for a while. I haven‚Äôt even paid for the full app yet. (Sorry for any grammar mistakes, I‚Äôm tired but I felt an urge to write a review for this app).

I have anxiety, and that anxiety worsens as I look at the news, experience asthma that causes me to feel like I‚Äôm dying, and just 2020 in general. I‚Äôve had insane family issues (but not as bad as terrible, terrible situations and I am grateful for that).

This app helped me get through that. I‚Äôve been able to get better sleep by turning on a sound from a scene and just listening to it. I look forward to mood check ins. Those mood check ins help me feel relieved. It‚Äôs a place I feel like I can be totally honest. I used to lie a lot because of my anxiety, but I‚Äôve been getting better at that because I‚Äôve begun to see my issue as I exaggerate in these mood check ins.

I can‚Äôt wait to use the features it offers after you pay. It‚Äôs not that high of a price (70 a year) and I think it‚Äôs worth it if you struggle with anything. How to deal with anger, how to be happier in life, how to sleep, how to meditate, there‚Äôs so many interesting and cool things I‚Äôm just mind-blown.

author: a n o n y m o u s s
title: do not waste your money on the subscriptions!
content: In my personal experience, this app did not help me at all. In fact made my anxiety and insomnia worse. This app may work for a lot of people but i do suggest you start off with  a trial to see if it works for you. DO NOT get a subscription that is yearly unless you are completely and totally certain you will be using Calm and be committed to it. I tried to cancel my subscription and it had gave me a notice that it in fact did cancel but, i had chosen the yearly subscription and it has yet to fully cancel. I canceled my subscription months ago and it is still billing me for the app that I am no longer using. It says it won't stop the payment until the renewal date which is in February. That means it will continue to charge me for the next 4 months even though I had rightfully cancelled my subscription. I am quite disappointed in this app as a whole but I'm sure each experience is different for every person.

author: Sresad
title: Worth Every Penny
content: This is my first foray into meditation. This app was recommended to me by my manager. I work in a very chaotic and stressful field with lots of high and lots of lows. It‚Äôs so easy to get swept up into the mindset you‚Äôre not enough, and allow that anxiety and stress negatively affect your self love. For the last couple weeks, using calm for 10-20 minutes a day, I feel more relaxed, and areas in my life even outside of the office have had positive impact. I‚Äôm working out harder in the gym, I‚Äôm more open with friends and family, and the gratitude that I‚Äôm feeling right now is immense compared to just a couple of weeks ago. This app is pricey at $70 dollars. But that‚Äôs less than one therapy session. And i believe it will, with time, make me a happier and better version of myself.

author: sopa de tomato
title: Truly the best
content: My husband used headspace and I use Calm, and let me just say that Calm has truly out paced HS by FAR. I have anxiety to the point of panic attacks and this app was suggested by a therapist to me; it has truly helped me learn how to breathe and stay in the moment during difficult reactions. They offer frequent new content that is relevant, master classes, whole topical series, simple bells and a timer, download options, favorite your go-to sessions... it is all here. Track your progress if you like to see that as well. Not only that but the UI is lovely and beautifully simple. This is by far the most value for an annual premium subscription I‚Äôve ever gotten out of an app and I can‚Äôt recommend it enough. If you‚Äôre on the fence about which one to try, please try this one.

author: @Dr_Cooper007
title: Life changing
content: The Calm app is changed my life. Previously I had stressed and anxiety built up to which I wasn‚Äôt aware of. Ultimately it would burst out and cause big melt downs for me. I actively knew I needed some help to which I tried counseling but it just didn‚Äôt do it for me. It wasn‚Äôt what I was looking for. I then prayed. I felt the Holy Spirit share two things to help me with my emotions. 1). Start Journaling. I use an app called Penzu. Then of course 2). The Calm app. I‚Äôve NEVER would‚Äôve done either. Unfortunately, in my previous mindset it was ‚Äúsoft‚Äù but that was a lie. This has improved my emotions which has made me better in my relationships and at work. I‚Äôm Super thankful for the calm app. Second year using it and I‚Äôm ready to take it up a notch.

author: kittyplays65
title: A laggy way to find sleep
content:
I‚Äôve been using Calm for almost four years now, and I‚Äôve found it to be an AMAZING tool. It has helped me fall asleep and stay asleep, calm down when I need to, and stay focused in various situations. Though‚Ä¶there has been an issue as of late. The app itself is incredibly laggy, and requires a long wait time to do basic functions. For instance, I was trying to figure out how to add songs to a playlist so I could avoid having to be woken by an upbeat pop melody. I couldn‚Äôt figure out, and due to the app being laggy, there just wasn‚Äôt enough patience in me to keep doing the wrong thing.

Don‚Äôt get me wrong - I love the app, and will continue to use it. The lag is slowly ruining my experience with the app, and I hope it can be fixed soon.

author: rknaakable
title: My lifesaver app
content: This app has been such a revelation in my well-being and everyday life. So much so that I purchased the lifetime subscription back in late 2019 after paying for the one year subscription. It is worth every penny. There is something for everyone of any age, from meditations to sleep stories to relaxing stretches and exercises. My kids use it as well, for there is an entire collection geared toward kids of all ages. I especially find the app to be of incredible use on days where I‚Äôm suffering from a tension headache, since there are meditations and exercises that never fail to ease the pain and tension. Having a healthy mindset can truly make such an impact on anyone who invests the time and energy into doing so.

author: KiddCox
title: My husband and dogs can‚Äôt get enough!
content: I started listening as an experiment since I work shift work and swap from days to nights weekly. After the first session, my husband asked, ‚ÄúWill you play me a sleep story before bed?‚Äù! I was in absolute shock! Even when I stay awake past his routine bed time to swap my schedule, I have to play him a story and he is sound asleep within a few minutes (maybe even seconds). I have also noticed our four dogs are enjoying the relaxing voices and sounds. All four are soundly dreaming shortly after the beginning and have started to expect a story as well! They snuggle down in their specific spots and wait with anticipation! I am excited to have found something that finally helps with my insomnia due to shift work!

author: girl8971
title: Best anxiety relief app EVER
content: I‚Äôm a 10 year old girl and I have major anxiety because in the year 2015 my parents got divorced and I was fine with that but now in 2019 a.k.a last year the day after Christmas I went to my dads house and had anxiety and could not sleep at all. But when I got this app it saved me and whenever I feel stressed I will listen to one of the videos they recommend for me and I feel like the anxiety that has taken over me has been defeated by this app calm. I definitely recommend this app it is a life saver if you have anxiety like I do. Also if you can‚Äôt fall asleep then you can listen to story‚Äôs if you are an adult or a kid and you can listen to nap time music. One time when I listened to the nap time music and I fell asleep on the couch for an hour.

author: Missy__A
title: Nothing Better
content:
I am a Special Education Teacher and I use this app not only with my students in the classroom but at home to calm myself from a busy day. 
The first time I played a story for the students there was not a sound in the room. The spinning and repetitive noises stopped. They thoroughly enjoyed the calmness and security the story and peacefulness provided. I use it every day after PE class to bring the children back into a space of calmness and ready to learn. 
I also use this app at home when I‚Äôm feeling anxious. I do yoga and mediate to the 7 days of anxiety. It has helped my mental state so much the last month. 
Thank you for allowing teachers to use this app free of charge. I use it every day and I cannot thank you enough.

author: T$$Munny
title: Free Version is Sad
content: It‚Äôs frustrating when apps claim to have a free version but then literally nothing is available for free. On this app, you literally get one story and one meditation unless you upgrade to the premium version which costs $70. Just list it as a subscription and not a free app. It would be so much more helpful if you could really check out the features of this app for more than 7 days without signing on for the subscription or being prompted to subscribe every time you touch anything. Sadly, this is an app I might really like and would consider paying for if it had a legitimate free version that I could try out for awhile without the false promise of a free version with no features and constant prompting/pressure to buy.

author: SKA-N33
title: Highly recommended!
content: I love this app and I cannot say that enough. I haven‚Äôt used many of the meditation aspects but the sleep stories alone are worth the subscription price. My anxiety loves to act up when I‚Äôm trying to fall asleep which means I can lay there awake for quite a while before I actually fall asleep. Listening to the sleep stories allows me to focus on something else and my anxiety fades away. A few of my favorites are ‚ÄúThe shipping forecast‚Äù, ‚Äúblue gold‚Äù, ‚Äúthe seventeenth princess‚Äù, and ‚Äústarlight symphony.‚Äù There‚Äôs at least one new sleep story every week so you can try new ones but also rely on your favorites. There are also ASMR options for those who enjoy that. Thank you, Calm, for helping me get more sleep!

author: Taylor.Lynn
title: AMAZING - but would like some new features
content:
First off, this is such an amazing app - great job Calm! This app has morphed into a meditation and relaxation masterpiece. 

It‚Äôs missing a few features that keep it from being 5 stars for me, though. 

1) I‚Äôd like to be able to mix all sounds (both scenes and sleep sounds) with other apps (like you can with the apps White Noise and TaoMix). This would allow me to play sounds in the background whilst listening to an audio book for instance. 
 - It would also be nice to be able to mix sounds & scenes with Calm sleep stories. I find some of the stories too quiet and needing some extra background noise. 

2) If ever able to mix sounds with other apps it would be nice to control volume of the Calm app separately from the phone master volume (TaoMix has this feature currently). 

3) I‚Äôd like to be able to mix or overlap the sleep soundscapes for customer soundscapes. Oh, and more of the soundscapes, please, they‚Äôre great!

4) It‚Äôs time to morph the scenes and sleep soundscapes into one category. I love a couple of the scenes and would be so sad if they were removed (specifically rhythmic waves and gently flowing stream - I could sleep to those any day!), but the others are a little dated and could be replaced with the sleep soundscapes and more of those added

author: DLOA159
title: DO NOT BUY if you travel across time zones.
content:
The app is flawed. Bottom line. Caching and syncing aside the app fails to create a consistent experience regardless of time zone and that is a flaw. Customer service looses credibility when they try to explain it away as if that is just the way it is or has to be. They attempt to talk circles around the average consumer because they don't know the wiser. That non-explination falls flat to me because I am a digital communications major who is well versed in tech.

Instead of trying to explain away this unfortunate product shortcoming they should try and practice service recovery and invest in the app to bring it up to speed w/their competitors.

I am extremely disappointed. I will be deleting the app and moving on. If they knew anything about customer service recovery they would do something or offer a make-good instead of crafting big-word excuses.

Customer service turnaround time is horrible as well. I sent over my original concern on a Saturday and it took them 4 whole business days to respond. So lame. This is how companies get washed out in this digital landscape. Here today, gone tomorrow. I have a decent amount of influence in my social circles and have encouraged friends and family to download and use Calm. I will now, based on this conversation, fire up the App Store and move on to a competitor...and so will they.

Do better. Don't make excuses. Take action.

author: Johnny5321
title: Great sleep stories but no queue feature
content: Calm has some of the greatest sleep stories with a huge range of topics and narrators‚Äô voices. Almost all the stories are 20-30 minutes. There is still no queue feature so if you wake up in the night, you have to go in and choose another story (very poor arrangement in this with Calm‚Äôs Still Awake? Page that blocks access to stories) and hope that looking for another story doesn‚Äôt wake you up more. Some poor design elements, like a virtually hidden Search by Narrator feature, which was hidden more during the last update. Still, it‚Äôs one of the better sleep apps. For the ANNUAL subscription price, though, I‚Äôd expect it to be perfect. 3.5 out of 5 stars.

author: newplayer 50
title: Trying to cancel auto renewal
content: I actually like the app very much, but find that I do not use it.  I got an email notice for an automatic renewal, but I decided to cancel.  About a week ago, I opened the email and went to the renew area.  At the bottom was a  cancel option.  I clicked it and it said I couldn‚Äôt connect.  So, I reopened it and all the options to buy were present, except the cancel option.  Weird.  So, to test the connection I tapped the monthly renewal option and, sure enough, it opened right away and was willing to take my money.  I did not click to pay, but closed out.  Then I send a note to apple about my problem - with no response still.  I then went to my app account and, again, there is no option to cancel this app, only to renew.  That is why I gave a one star on the review.  I guess my next step is to remove my credit card from the App Store, so I don‚Äôt get an automatic renew charge.  How stupid is that?!

author: Kelly Gtz
title: This Calm App has literally saved my life!
content: Tamara Levitt‚Äôs voice is so soothing, I have been listening to the daily calm for almost a year.  When my anxiety spikes, I take a time out and use one of the body scans or meditations.  This app has helped me with night terrors, anxiety attacks, depression, and PTSD for almost a year.  Honestly, I don‚Äôt know if I would have gotten through some of my traumatic hurdles without it.  The children‚Äôs bedtime stories helped soothe my two young grandchildren when they would stay with us, and my friend‚Äôs two small children who recently lost their father.  And let‚Äôs be honest...there‚Äôs nothing better than Matthew McConaughey reading you a bedtime story!  Thank you to the creators of this app.  I promote it and share it constantly.  Tamara is my personal rock. üíúüíú

author: TriangleABlue
title: I won‚Äôt delete it unless...
content: I just don‚Äôt get it. Why do have to waste your time to buy Calm Premium, just to feel happy and calm yourself?! Everything is AMAZING! Besides you have to PAY to ease your mind. I would love to listen to the stories, the music, and to fall asleep, but I can‚Äôt üòíüòûüò†ü§ß My New Year‚Äôs resolution was to become a healthier person mentally, physically, and emotionally. I‚Äôve also been trying to fix my sleep schedule, but it‚Äôs kinda hard because of the things I need to UNLOCK! This really pisses me off. JUST MAKE EVERYTHING FREE! My gosh üò´üò©!!! And I‚Äôm not buying it! I hate those types of apps... But seriously, do you think you have to give MONEY to become a better person? Make it freeeee! If it‚Äôs not free in 2 months, I‚Äôm deleting. Which will be very hard because I love it! Pleaseee ü•∫ thanks for reading have a great day/night! üíï

author: üç¶üçßüçüüçïüçîüçâüçøüç©üç™üç´‚öΩÔ∏è
title: Pretty good
content: I downloaded this app because I recently have had a lot of anxiety issues and thought that this app would help me sleep better. I t was pretty good but there where not a whole lot of options if you did not subscribe or pay which I did not do. The ones that where free though where pretty good and helpful I just with that you did not have to pay. I have problems with this kind of stuff a lot when the it‚Äôs self is free to download but the content inside you can not use unless you pay and I don‚Äôt want to pay for an app that you can find the same stuff online for FREE. I also did not see that you had to pay for the stuff in the description. I just think that if your going to make someone pay make sure they know that they are going to have to.

author: gingerhawke
title: Alternate Daily Calm narrator?
content: One of the best apps out there. I use it every day and also at night for sleep. Music selections are exceptional. My only issue is the voice of Tamara Levitt, the narrator (and I believe brilliant creator) of Daily Calm. The content is great: it‚Äôs the vocal affectation that I find grating. Like another reviewer, I‚Äôve tried and tried to no avail. My only resort is to turn it down to lowest audible volume. During the didactic part of the meditation, the voice changes to something more authentic, but then, relapses to the vocal fry and breathiness that seems designed to enhance the meditation experience. It obviously works for many users, and there‚Äôs no doubt that Tamara possesses wisdom and us a gifted teacher. I just wish she could lose the affectation and talk to us in her normal conversational voice. Barring that, maybe offer another narrator.

author: stylish4less
title: Life changer!!
content: I cannot day enough wonderful things about using this app!! It‚Äôs been a year now, and this app has allowed me to reach a level of personal care that I have been craving since my teens and 20‚Äôs... and I‚Äôm finally finding it in my 40‚Äôsü•∞.... it has made it more accessible to do these meditations on my breaks from work or and especially during really emotional days, when I seem to need it the most! Thank You Tamara Levitt and the many others involved in creating and contributing to this app!! Your beautiful words and thoughtful care you put into each one is truly life changing! I look forward to my daily calm every morning and evening!! Thank you from one deeply grateful and compassionate heart to your truly compassionate heart!‚ô•Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏èü•∞‚ú®~ Shaun from Santa Cruz, Ca.

title: Daily Calms out of the can
content: I‚Äôve been using Calm for almost 3 years now on an almost daily basis. I think it did help me with a lot of issues and I do begin to notice benefits from using it in my life. The reason why I‚Äôm only giving 4 stars is that the ‚ÄûDaily Calm‚Äù sessions, something I used to look forward to, have been simple replays of previous sessions for a while now. That‚Äôs annoying, especially since they let you save your favorite sessions. So it happened to me a couple of times now that I played one of my favorite sessions and then the following day I listen to the exact same thing as a ‚Äúdaily Calm‚Äù because it‚Äôs being replayed. I think the daily sessions should be new, otherwise I feel a little fooled. Other than that I really like it.

author: poseygirl28
title: too expensive now
content: I used this app religiously to help me sleep because of my anxiety. It would be so hard for me to fall asleep at night until I found the Calm App and would listen to the soothing sleep music! I used this app for about a year and I wasn‚Äôt charged for anything, which I loved because it was so effective and I didn‚Äôt have to worry about putting a dent in my pocket. I only used the sleep music, so I didn‚Äôt see the point in purchasing a membership. Now, my anxiety is coming back to me before bedtime and I can‚Äôt use this app because ALL of the music is locked!! I understand that money has to be made somehow, but I‚Äôm so truly disappointed every single song was locked. I‚Äôm a college student on a budget that can‚Äôt afford to pay for miscellaneous things so this hurts! Anyway, if you have the money I‚Äôd definitely recommend this app. It works wonders!

author: eis4Me
title: Needs more things for free PLEASE
content: This app has amazing, relaxing white noise to listen too, great night stories etc. but people who don‚Äôt pay $60 a year can‚Äôt listen to music or listen to most of the stories plus the week long meditations only have ONE day you can listen to for free. If apple wants more good reviews for this app they should have more choices for people who can‚Äôt or aren‚Äôt allowed to etc pay so much money for this app. It has so many cool features but it should be more accessible to everyone. I hope apple or whoever owns this app changes this for the better because many people who are depressed or anxious might not be able to pay that yearly money on top of everything else and they need to have this app to help so if that is changed this app would be five stars, because money isn‚Äôt everything, how people feel is 100x more important

author: Nazmis
title: My favorite app
content: I have been using the Calm app for over 6 months now, and I don‚Äôt know how I lived without it!  Whenever I am feeling stressed, I can choose a meditation from their vast selection to alleviate the stress - and let‚Äôs be honest, we are living in a very stressful time.  I LOVE the sleep stories, which I use nightly to help me relax and ease into sleep.  There are so many to choose from and I have many favorites. It is such a luxury to have someone read me a story, using a calm, peaceful voice.  I am usually asleep before the story is finished, so I have to admit that I don‚Äôt know how most of them end!  I love this app so much that I signed up for a lifetime subscription - and it is worth every penny!  Try it - you won‚Äôt be disappointed.

author: Element9O
title: Excellent but recommend more options
content:
This app is beyond great. Meditation is such a gift to everyone who allows time for it. I have been an user of Calm for 4 years now and love the accessibility of it. It‚Äôs great for quick sessions when life catches up. I‚Äôve deepened my practice by taking what I learn here and carrying with me. 

I find the nature scapes/sounds to be extremely relaxing, and I love how I can toggle between whatever I am feeling like listening to depending on my mood or the environment. 

All good things, but I would love to see Calm incorporate more options into the mood check-in at the end of the sessions. There are so many different types of emotions that don‚Äôt make it to the choices that are made available.

author: Alpha.c
title: High promise, but not there yet
content:
I'm one of these users who bought a lifetime subscription after taking a meditation course that was very promising. Sadly, it was not indicative of the rest of the Calm experience. Issues that require attention:
‚Äì The app is highly un-intuitive: It's hard to find favorite pieces
‚Äì The offline experience is abysmal. I use the app primarily in planes and discover that hardly anything works offline. I'm sure there are ways to download soundscapes but I can't find how and whenever I find a way to play a soundscape offline, it switches off automatically after 10 minutes. Restarting it ‚Ä¶ requires restarting the app. That's a lot of restarts over a 6-hour flight.
Maybe they will fix these issues but after a couple of years of waiting, I'm not holding my breath. If I knew today what I know, I wouldn't have bought the subscription.

author: audi454
title: Help with anxiety
content: The app opens up asking the user what they need. They give the options of anxiety relief, meditation, help with getting to sleep, etc. They have sections that allow the user to explore different sessions. These sessions consist of real people coaching one through their use of breathing techniques. They have music, kids, check-in, ‚Äúfor work‚Äù, and a wisdom section. They all work amazingly. It has been studied that people with anxiety can experience mindfulness in order to cope with or eliminate their anxiety. Being mindful of one's experience "in the moment" (also known as meditation) and doing so without passing judgment clarifies one's values, enables acceptance of uncomfortable ideas and feelings, and the use of values to alter behavior.

author: Laughing dolphin
title: Love the app, but‚Ä¶
content: I love this app Calm Premium and I‚Äôve had it on my phone for probably a year all of a sudden I go to open the app and it‚Äôs gone. I‚Äôm finding myself having to download it every single night to use it now. Royal pain. If they can fix that and it be at five star I have spent countless hours trying to fix this issue myself. Developer has been absolutely no help whatsoever. It seems as though they have no customer service. Either you fix it yourself or you‚Äôre screwed. and I paid for the premium! Which makes me really angry because I love the app itself is fabulous. are use it every night to go to sleep. Or I did. Some nights I‚Äôm just too tired to look it up in the App Store.

author: Basketball2028
title: AMAZING app!
content: Calm is my favorite app at the moment. My sister and I listen to the sleep stories every night, and we love it! I am asleep in minutes, I don‚Äôt even know what happens at the end of half the stories I listen to. My father came in my room one night and thought the music I was listening to was very relaxing, and I agreed. (The music is also great) I bought Premium and it IS so worth it. You get access to EVERYTHING. I do the breathing exercises every day before school. It definitely calms your mind. Most of the narrators voices are very calming. Another thing is that every time you open the app it greets you with ‚ÄúTake a deep breath‚Äù. You can also change the backround which comes with calming music. Overall GREAT app.

author: calm new 2022
title: Nice collection. But
content:
I wish users can have a choices of narrator voice . The voice of the lead person Tamarra, is too cheerful and has too much emotion in her voice. It is like she is telling a cheerful and colorful story. Many people may prefer such a bubbly character, but for someone who feels anxious, that‚Äôs bad news for a guided meditation. It is not that I don‚Äôt like her voice, it is that the energy and emotion in her voice makes me more anxious. I bought one year subscription and tried to get used to it. But it didn‚Äôt work. As a result, I don‚Äôt use the Apps much at all. 

I would prefer a more traditional, calm and almost emotionless voice. Some of the work offers a choice and I always choose the alternative male voice. But given that her voice accounts for 90% of the guided medications, I will not renew my subscription.

author: florent69
title: Would be 5 stars without some pesky bugs
content:
Content is great, I‚Äôve been using the app for some years now and have a paid subscription, overall I would say it‚Äôs worth it. I use the sleep soundscapes the most, and play them on my HomePod. They helps covering the noise my neighbors do at any time of the night. The Commercial Airliner, and the White Sound Ocean Surf soundscapes are the best IMO for this kind of ‚Äúsound machine‚Äù feel.
However, there are two notable issues I find pretty frustrating:
1. The soundscape tracks are seemingly loops that repeat every X minutes (maybe 20, or 30minutes?). When the track ends, there‚Äôs a gap of a couple seconds before it‚Äôs starts again, which is enough to create this unpleasant ‚Äúwake up‚Äù experience.
2. The playback experience in the app is buggy. It does not really say when it‚Äôs buffering (if at all?) but it does not always starts right away after selecting a soundscape, even though the playback UI shows as playing. Sometimes, playback does not even start until a couple seconds after backgrounding the app. That‚Äôs odd and not user friendly.

If that wasn‚Äôt for these two issues, I would give it 5 stars without hesitation.

Please Calm devs, help me being calmer by fixing these annoyances!

author: James Boston
title: Anxiety and Insomnia
content:
This is the first time I‚Äôve suffered anxiety because I have always been able to manage my emotions with very little difficulty. But recently it has been triggered and it has thrown me for a loop. 
Insomnia has come with the anxiety which has me up all night and going to sleep üò¥ üí§ on my buses to my Psych Group Therapy, then half way into my group therapy. The medication I was prescribed was making the insomnia worse, along with the anxiety about the insomnia. 
     Smooth Jazz use to help me a lot, but now is to fast and to loud. Calm is just boring enough, no calming enoughüòáto put me to sleep while I‚Äôm writing this reviewüòäLOL!!! 
     I am loving Calm so much, so very very much. Thank you üôèüèæ and may God Bless y‚Äôall and y‚Äôalls staff and Bussiness all the days of y‚Äôalls lives. 
     James A Boston Jr

author: gypsyink
title: Great app!
content: I have tried many different meditation apps. There are six currently on my phone. This is the only one I ever made the leap to paid content. I like that there are so many different ways to use the app- the "breathe" part is super helpful when I just need to slow down my racing mind and/or ease an anxiety attack. I like that I can choose just silent meditation or guided. I like that there is a new meditation each day on a different topic. Some topics I like better than others but all in all, I find they give good food for thought for the day. I also enjoy the sleep stories. I still have never made it all the way to the end before falling asleep. (Although avoid the French ASMR one- that one just sounds a serial killer whispering in your ear!)

author: True Stary
title: Thank you from your biggest Calm fan
content: I have been listening to you for years and because of Calm, my daily practice has opened me up to mindful movement, active involvement with others, healthy eating and living, an awareness of simplified consumerism and daily journaling. I am the best version of myself‚Äîas a wife, mom, community member, athlete, friend and stranger. I have cultivated a strength and resiliency to challenging situations in my family, the workplace and most recently, politically. With the various options to listen to Tamara, Jeff, or Jay, including music for the workplace and meditation for sleep, I can truly say that calm has become my ‚Äúhome‚Äù- my comforting and consistent place for whole self nurturing. With much gratitude, your biggest Calm fan

author: johanperry
title: One Request (Otherwise great app)
content: This app is really nice, I especially like the soundscapes. However, there only seems to be a handful of soundscapes that don‚Äôt have a ton of white noise in the background. Please include more soundscapes that are pure environmental sounds, not sounds on top of a thick layer of white noise. The Campfire soundscape does a great job of that, why can‚Äôt more of the soundscapes be like that? The white noise makes it sound artificial and makes it anxiety inducing, not relaxing and transportive. Sorry to be a critic on this point, I would just really like more non-white noise soundscapes, right now there‚Äôs not many options. Otherwise I appreciate what you guys are doing here and say you earned five stars for my review.

author: Tumble:3
title: It‚Äôs great, but..
content: Honestly this app is great, it‚Äôs helped me go to sleep a lot earlier and stay asleep throughout the night. My issue with this app however, is that everything is locked. There are a few soundscapes and such that non premium members can listen to but overall they aren‚Äôt the best. I understand that the company has to make money somehow, but I think it‚Äôs unfair to the people not able or willing to pay $70 a year that they get almost nothing. It‚Äôs frustrating when there is a story or a meditation I'm really interested in and I can‚Äôt even listen to a little bit of it because it‚Äôs only for premium members. Not to mention that non paying members don‚Äôt even get 30% access to the all of the things in the sleep category, I went and looked through everything and honestly it was more disappointing then I thought it would be.

author: bramblescat
title: Calm has been a miracle for me!
content: A year ago, I was still suffering as an insomniac and my anxiety and stress were burning a hole in my chest. I have been on medication for years. I tried Calm on a whim, but gave it my total committement. It worked!! I don't have to use it as often, but I love it so I do. I'm the mother of two special needs boys, my parents need me and have moved in, my brother and his wife are jobless so they are here, too! So my symptoms have been through the roof! I especially use the Daily Trip and Sleep Stories and have been able (with doctor's guidelines) to get off all related medicine. Learning how to meditate and embracing sleep stories have been a cure for me and I will always be a subscriber. Thank you so much!

author: Positively AB
title: Life-changing
content: I rarely pay for subscriptions, but the full version of Calm has been one of the best investments I have made in my well-being. As a positive psychology practitioner, I love that Calm content is rooted in positive psychology. Learning to meditate from the ground up has increased my self-awareness, made me less reactive and allowed me to be more present and joyful. The sleep stories have improved the quality of my sleep as well as given me a wonderful way to wind down at night. The master classes cover a broad range of wellness topics with practical takeaways from experts in their field.  And absolutely love the addition of the Spark!  Calm also has music and gentle exercises. It has greatly improved my quality of life, and I am profoundly grateful for this wonderful resource.

author: Kat with bat
title: Through this app, meditation is improving my life
content:
I was constantly stressed, anxious and flustered. It hit me as I woke up in the morning and stayed with me all day, negatively impacting my daily life.
I was curious about meditation and the apparent (seemingly miraculous) benefits of practice.

It was difficult to find the time or patience to start so I knew a little guidance was needed.
I tried a few popular apps and Calm has by far stood out as the BEST guided meditation I‚Äôve found anywhere.

You have a choice in guide, level of guidance and type of meditation. Help to get to or back to sleep, ambient music to sooth and even short stories read by some very familiar voices.

If you‚Äôre even a little curious I recommend downloading the app and trying the free trial.
It‚Äôs perfectly normal to be fidgety and frustrated with yourself at first, just don‚Äôt give up!
It‚Äôs difficult to describe the change you feel within yourself and everyone is different but I personally feel hopeful, energized and excited about the day ahead again.

I hope meditation can have a beneficial impact on your life too, even if it‚Äôs only to have a few moments to yourself now and then because you deserve it.

author: Brynnderful
title: Glitches
content:
Great meditations, but extremely annoying glitches. When searching through the meditations, it doesn‚Äôt show which ones you‚Äôve completed. And there is no way to mark one as completed yourself. So you‚Äôre looking through ones you‚Äôve already done, and you have to just remember every one you‚Äôve done. 
Also for series, when you open the app, there‚Äôs no option to start the next meditation in the series. So I go to last completed my history, thinking there‚Äôs some ‚Äúcontinue to next‚Äù option. Nope, can‚Äôt do that either. And there is no option to search. So every time you want the next meditation in a series, you have to scroll until you can find that series again, and remember which one you‚Äôre on. 
As much as I love the meditations, I probably will not purchase again next year unless changes are made.

author: Marenez
title: Worth it.
content:
When I have a long day I find it hard to unwind and fall asleep, no matter how tired I am and I usually have night terrors that wake me up throughout the night.  Sleep is hard for me.  Sometimes even the fear of night terrors keeps me from falling asleep.

But this app has helped me so much.  It‚Äôs not like reading a book, because when I read I can‚Äôt help but read fast to find out as much as I can about the story, and it‚Äôs easy for my mind to wander while I‚Äôm reading.  It‚Äôs also not unusual for me to lose myself in a book and accidentally stay up much too late.  

The stories in this app are engaging, but the narrators usually read slowly, with drawn out pauses between sentences, which help ease my mind and allow me to relax and let go of worry.  They keep me grounded and in the moment.  Instead of letting fear or anxiety take over and drive my thoughts, the narrator is in the driver‚Äôs seat, and they are so calming.  I have yet to finish a story because they put me to sleep.  I also sleep through the night almost every time I use this app.

A dependable, good night‚Äôs rest is priceless, so the yearly cost of this app is very much worth it in my book.

author: newbee112
title: Help with intense grief
content: I knew I needed to do something to help myself naturally when I was faced  with intense grief and the enormity of fear, helplessness and hopelessness. I had the Calm application for years but never used it. I received an email with a discounted offer to try a premium membership. I decided to give it a try. I am so grateful I did. I use it before sleep and when I awake. I carefully selected those taped recordings that were to my liking( not all were). I had to try a few to find ones that worked for me. The ones I have selected soothes my emptiness and fills the absence with refocusing my thoughts,  as well as accepting and dealing with my thoughts in a healthy way.  I end  and start my day in a much more positive way.

author: euclids5th
title: App crashing upon loading
content: I have been using Calm since the summer of 2018, and it‚Äôs been a game changer for me in terms of dealing with anxiety, stress, and breathing. These past few months my sleep has severely suffered, and the white noise landscape has been a miracle for my sanity. I love the sleep stories but find that they are very short and so are more useful for me to listen to unwind prior to putting on a soundscape to lull me into sleep. I love the daily calm meditations though I wish there were newer meditations added a lil more frequently. Overall, Calm is like a crutch for my sanity. One aspect that has been getting progressively worse is the app crashing upon launching Calm from my phone. Recently I have to relaunch Calm four to five times before it launches properly. I really hope this improves as I‚Äôve grown very fond of this app.

author: wildappleseed
title: Well done!
content: I was recommended this app by my pain management care team. I was having a very hard time getting back into my practice after 8 years recovering from CRPS. Initially meditation was heightening pain level for me. This was a hard thing to navigate for me as I have over 40 years experience with meditation practices.  This app has helped me easy back into a fruitful practice at the pace I needed. After the first three months I was well into recovery for my condition and pain/ anxiety levels are significantly reduced. I really like all the options in the app and have shared this with family and friends. This app is appropriate for all levels from ‚Äú what is meditation‚Äù to ‚Äú life long practice‚Äù. Well done!

author: Buddysye
title: Life Changing Experience
content: Every morning, minus just a few days, for more than a year, I begin my day with a guided meditation from CALM, usually with Jeff Warren.  I have spent so much time with him, I feel like I know him.  The experience has truly been transformative.  I began meditating on the advice of a counselor after experiencing a panic attack on an airplane. I have never had mental health issues and at 58 yoa, it came as a shock.  Not only has the meditation practice helped relieve my General Panic Disorder; but it has made me a much better person; and these are the words of my wife of 35 years and my adult children.  This has lead me down a path where I am now taking mindfulness classes in order to hopefully bring these tools to friends and colleagues.  Thank you Jeff and everyone at CALM!

author: heykellies
title: Excellent app, and excellent company to support
content: Calm has been in the news lately‚Äîgood news, for doing good things‚Äîso when my subscription expired earlier this week, I was only too happy to renew it. I‚Äôve been using the app for a little over a year now, off and on (trying to be more on than off but sometimes keeping good habits is hard), and I find it very useful. It‚Äôs well organized, easy to navigate, lots of variety, and helpful reminders to make it a habit (assuming you respond to the reminders, lol). I also like that I can log in through my browser and play some of the music playlists on my computer while working. All in all, an excellent experience with this.

author: Xtina Duke
title: Everything promised and so much more.
content: This is going to sound extreme, but this app has changed my life. Not only have I been able to fall asleep without any stress, I actually feel lighter every day.  There are so many fun extras in this app as well! You can track how your feeling each day. You can write short gratitude lists, and even go for a deep thinking question.  I‚Äôve had insomnia all my life.  I put on a sleep story and I‚Äôm out without worry or stress.  I tell everyone I know to get the app and subscribe!  My mother and I often joke about how long we can make it through a story.  Run don‚Äôt walk. Get this app and subscribe.   I would give this 100 stars if I could.  Bravo calm and thank you.

author: 46Dani46
title: The app I can‚Äôt live without üòå
content: This is the app I can‚Äôt seem to live without no matter how stable my life seems to get (3 years and counting). My favorite features are listening to the scenes or the music, and of course the daily Calms. I love the sleep stories and Master Classes as well. I‚Äôve listed to the mindful eating and pillars of health master class at least 3 times each now! I have recommended and gifted this to my mom as well as some of my friends. I‚Äôve tried other meditation apps and this one seems to surpass them all in the user friendliness and quality (especially sound quality!). Highly recommend Calm to anyone looking for a great guided meditation app or someone to talk them to sleep at night :)

author: ILoveCalmApp
title: Life Changing- Premium Overpriced
content: When I first got Calm about a year ago, I was really stressed out and couldn‚Äôt get to sleep. I was taking 6-10 mg of melatonin a night which was really unhealthy for my body (I am 13). Calm was truly a life changer because it taught me to meditate and had amazing sleep stories and a good amount of them were free. Then calm switched mostly all of their stuff to premium so I stopped using the app. After a visit to the doctor I was told to try meditation again and I immediately thought of calm. My parents capped the limit at $30 a year and they thought $60 was outrageous. I really think that calm is amazing and of you can pay for premium I definitely think it would be worth it.

author: DoItDaniT
title: 1,000+ days
content: I‚Äôve been on a streak since the pandemic hit. 1 meditation a day-sometimes I only have time for a 3 minute, and others I choose longer. I love the variety of classes to meet my emotional needs for each moment of my day. As a family, we complete a kid meditation and sleep story each night as part of our nightly routine. I have even started to incorporate some meditations from this app in my classes with my students! This app has completely changed my life! I also do gratitude tracking, mood tracking, and sleep tracking, and have seen way better sleep prioritizing, and reflection! I can‚Äôt recommend this app enough! (And I love that they partner with my health insurance company!) ‚ù§Ô∏è

author: boostercat
title: Sleep
content: There seems to be something for everyone. I find something new almost every time I begin my night time rituals. Which is kinda my problem; I don‚Äôt have a set ritual, that allows my mind to shut off. As soon as my head hits the pillows, it starts analyzing my day, and reminding me of all the things I should have done during the day, instead of the things i did do. It‚Äôs frustrating, but I‚Äôm getting a handle on it, sort of. Sometimes it works and sometimes it doesn‚Äôt. But this app helps. Even if I can‚Äôt find sleep, I can find calm, find relaxing, find release of the troublesome thoughts or putting them where I can find them the next day and deal with them properly.

author: pupventures
title: Love it
content:
Really love this app. The master classes are my favorite part. Very interesting and easy to listen too. Really wish they would make more of them. I have a year subscription and have listened to almost all of them (finally getting around to finish the rest) and some of them 3-5 times (gratitude, disproving happiness, rethinking depression, the 4 pillars of health and sleep are my favorite) would love to see some new ones. 

The only thing I would change in this app would be to ability to set the meditations like an alarm clock. They do have reminders but if I could set a meditation to start at a certain time I could do it without having to touch my phone (we all know how distracting phones are first thing in the morning)

author: natp8509
title: This is just annoying and bothering
content: Ok don‚Äôt get me wrong I love this app in all but what really bothers me is that almost all everything in this app is locked because you have unlock calm and it costs money the reason why I don‚Äôt unlock calm is because my parents don‚Äôt know I go through stress,anxiety,depression so I don‚Äôt ask for the money for calm,It really bothers me that I can only listen to a few stories in calm I really think that you shouldn‚Äôt lock almost all of the stories,lullabies,songs,mediations you know all that stuff I really don‚Äôt wanna ask my parents for the money I know there is a 7 day free trial but the 7days will end soon and I don‚Äôt wanna pay for it, this is really helpful for stress anxiety and depression but a lot of the things in this app cost money but other than that this app is amazing and really helpful to the people who pay for it.

author: pinklavender55
title: The end of the day ‚Äúcalm‚Äù
content:
I started Calm on the recommendation from a friend.  I used the free version to start.  At bath time I relaxed to the various download themes for waves, mountain sounds, rain/ storm sounds, and such.  I closed my eyes and could feel the tension melt away.  I opted for doing a yearly membership to open up the sleep stories when they offered a discount.  

I find myself using the sleep stories to turn off my racing mind and to fall asleep quicker.  The ones I favor most I download to play offline.

This is a wonderful app if you want to decompress after a stressful day.  I would give it 5 stars if it was more affordable.  I wouldn‚Äôt have opted for the yearly subscription if it weren‚Äôt for the discounted offer.

author: Breathe In Peace
title: Daily Calm
content: Long time subscriber .. abundant in offerings .. part of my daily routine including morning meditation, sleep stories, 7-day practices and more .. the Daily Calm has been life changing for me .. the only critique I have is most of the sleep stories I wouldn‚Äôt personally consider stories but rather pieces of verbal information about various locations around the world, while interesting, they don‚Äôt envoke  relaxation and sleep for me. Often times the narrators voices aren‚Äôt soft and soothing and at times difficult to understand. Consequently I rely repeatedly on the few that offer what works best for me which is a soft spoken soothing bedtime story.  Thank you Calm for making our lives and the world more peaceful

author: Sithmaith
title: Poor support
content:
I hate to do this because I love Calm. I love it so much that I have a lifetime subscription. However, the support has become so useless that I'm hoping that this will get the attention of the support team. 

Around November 25, 2024, the open ended meditation, my favorite, quit syncing to the Apple Health app. The guided meditations and the unguided timed meditations still sync. It may not be very zen of me, but I would like to get credit for all my meditation minutes. 

Previously, you could send an email to the support team, but I can no longer find that option. All that's available is a chatbot, and it appears very basic. I don't want to sit around for an extended period of time talking to something that asks the same questions repeatedly and only seems to be able to refer me to articles in the archives. I want to correspond with a real person. Please help. Until then, I'll stick with the 1 star review.

author: Kittenseeker
title: Devastated to lose original breath circle
content: I had an older version on my phone for a long time and was using the free breath circle with 6-3-7 breath and a beautiful scene behind the circle. I made the mistake of updating my app in order to upgrade to a paid subscription, only to find the part of the app I was using was no longer there. The updated version offers breathing circles, but none have the same timing (even with using the limited controls offered) and there is no scene behind the circle. I can understand the app choosing to start charging for a popular item, but to take it away completely and then charge for something inferior is maddening. Paid subscribers should have better controls to fine tune the timing, a choice of music, and a choice of calming backgrounds behind the circle. Maddening to upgrade to a paid only to find the paid version is inferior to what was offered for free previously.

author: bwhshzuwhusbwvajjz
title: Amazing! And a suggestion too
content: I really love the calm app! It‚Äôs helped me so much in so many hard situations it‚Äôs truly amazing. I do have one specific suggestion. I think you should add a feature where you can make a playlist. I‚Äôve found so many songs I like on the app but I don‚Äôt always like the rest of the album, so having a feature like this would allow people to make a kinda of mixed up playlist of songs or even sleep stories. Also as a side note, ever since the app updated it has been very glitchy when switching through tabs on the side bar and everywhere else in general.  Thanks for reading this far lol and I hope you‚Äôd consider my suggestion!

author: MuffinTop13
title: EVERYONE needs this!
content: I‚Äôve had this app for a few years now, and while I go through phases in my usage, it never fails me. Traveling and can‚Äôt fall asleep? Lost your job and need some help centering yourself? Babysitting and need something to keep the kids entertained or calm for sleep? Can‚Äôt sleep? Anxious? This app has completely changed my self care routine, and practicing gratitude has honestly, literally, kept me alive. I can‚Äôt afford therapy, but this app truly does help, and has everything you need to work on yourself. I love the sleep stories, and I rely on the nature sounds to calm my mind almost every night. I will have this app on my phone, forever. Best year subscription I‚Äôve ever purchased.
